Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a little far away from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Alex G
Reviews.Content: First I must say that I was there in august 2010, but I write this review because I think that from the previous reviews one might think that the hotel is a walk away from the centre of Paris. The hotel was very clean and the services were great, the people were very nice and friendly except for the lady who served breakfast, who seemed to be in a bad mood every morning, I don't know the reasons (but I was in Paris two years ago, maybe she doesn't even work there any more). Breakfast was very good. The hotel is located not too close to the centre of the city and we had to walk from the hotel to the subway and back every morning and evening. This was a little annoying especially in the evening, when we were tired after a day of walking in the city. If you have a short stay, I recommend the hotel, but if you stay a week or more, maybe you should search for a location closer to the centre because after 3-4 days of walking to the subway and back and 20-30 minutes in the subway you will think that you waste a lot of your time in Paris every day making the trip to the centre of the city. But a very nice experience after all and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: HoJo4751
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GHF for a week to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary as well as a 65th birthday. The hotel definitely lived up to all the positive reviews - and then some. Our room (#53) was a bright, spotless, nicely decorated corner room with an unbelievably comfortable bed and a wonderful shower. It also had an amazing balcony from which we could watch the activity in the neighborhood. As others have said, the breakfast was delicious and satisfying and the woman who took care of the area for most of the week was a delight. As far as location - it was perfect! It was away from the hustle and bustle of crowds, but with both an RER and metro station at Nation just a 5 minute walk away, any tourist site in Paris was easily accessible. A “Paris Visite” transportation pass really made things simple. Nation also gave us a quick connection to the Roissybus which we used for our transport to and from the airport. But the best part of the hotel was the incredible staff! Everyone greeted us with a smile and bent over backward to answer questions, give directions, or provide helpful suggestions. We especially enjoyed being able to talk with the people at the desk and find out more about day to day life in France and Paris in particular. To us, that’s what travel is all about - learning the culture of an area. If you’d like to avoid hordes of tourists and want a real Parisian experience, the GHF is the place to stay. When we return to Paris this will definitely be our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: UncleMonty
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, brilliant staff. Far enough away from the hullabaloo but close enough to get to it easily enough. We loved it. They even gave us a free bottle of champagne to celebrate our marriage. Unheard of in any other hotel. Staff were always on hand to help with directions or recommendations and couldn't have been more helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough yet far enough away”
Reviews.Author: PezzersDad
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, modern hotel run by efficient staff. Rooms are on the small side, but, hey, it's in a capital city and the price reflects that. It's in the 11th arrondisement which, on a map, looks a distance away from 'the sights'. Yet it's close enough to all those sights as there is a Metro stop 100 metres away and a bus stop next to that which gives you access, via the 'Visite Paris' ticket that every tourist should have. It's also far enough away to be away from wall to wall tourists and to get a taste of 'capital city' France. Bread shops, patisseries, good restaurants, all of which will be recommended by the staff at the hotel, abound in the area and there are other sights to see in an area of superb architecture. I can only recommend you put it on your list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a short break. A must stay”
Reviews.Author: soobroo99
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here, decided to book it for a 3 day break. It lives up to its expectations and more. Very well situated for the Metro, 2 stations within easy walking distance. Front desk staff very well informed, very helpful and very polite. Rooms very clean and bright with everything you need. Even complimentary tea and coffee which is unusal in Europe. Outstanding moment...... on our return from a day out we found a complimentary bottle of champagne and 2 glasses, which we enjoyed... but the icing on the cake was the phone call from the front desk asking if we needed the ice replenishing !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Americans! This is what you're looking for.”
Reviews.Author: SeanC888
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a review here before, but had such a great experience, I felt I had to take the time. I know, as an American, we're sometimes not sure what to expect in a European hotel. This one, I assure you, will meet or exceed all your standards. In fact, we stayed in a nice hotel in NYC the night before arriving in Paris and it was half the size of the one at Le Grand Hotel Francais and not nearly as nice. The room here was large and well-appointed with a big bed, great bathroom/ shower, iPod dock, couch, bureau and a small balcony looking out on a quaint street. The price was right, with a good breakfast available downstairs and a bottle of champagne awaiting us on arrival. Be aware that you're not going to walk out the front door of this hotel and see the Eiffel Tower, but that's actually a huge plus. For one thing, this hotel is in a "real Parisian neighborhood". There are great restaurants and cafes all around this area and in Place de la Nation, which is 2 blocks away. The metro station is almost across the street with one train taking you to the best stop for the Eiffel Tower. But the real treat at this establishment is the hotel staff. They put up with my terrible French, gave us directions everywhere, made great restaurant recommendations, ordered us cabs and made us reservations at the cabaret "Paradis Latin" (great show) one night. Ziad (spelling?), the manager was extremely generous and attentive as was Oceane (sp?) who made great recommendations. If you don't want to stay with the hordes in the tourist area and want a real Parisian experience, this is the place. Bon voyage.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ABF145
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Grand Francais while taking advantage of a long layover in Paris. Our corner room was lovely! Not overdone, just well appointed, clean and comfortable. The free wifi was faster and easier to access than many of the other hotels we stayed in on this trip. The front desk staff was terrific! We had lots of questions and they were extremely helpful. There are 2 Metro stops nearby, making it very convenient to get around the city. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.Lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MaluPena
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks completely renovated and the clerks are very nice. The room was no bigger than a matchbox but beatifully decorated and furnished. It had a plasma TV and an Ipod dock. The bathroom was also very nice and modern. Everything was very clean and courtesy slippers were provided. It is a bit far from downtown but if you donÂ´t mind travelling, there are 2 subway station in a 3 blocks radious. You can get anywhere using the subway. The trip to the louvre is about 20 minutes. The neighbourhood is very nice and calm, with plenty of good restaurants around. Breakfast was good too. IT was expensive, 140EU, like everything in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to Grand Hotel Francais and it's still as good as I remember. Just a really good hotel with excellent customer service. For a Paris hotel, the rooms are a good size. The bathroom is slightly small but the shower is great! The location is also really good - really close to the metro making it so easy to get around. If you're going to Paris, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: orla m
Reviews.Content: Myself and husband have just returned from Paris and we highly recommend this hotel, it is very clean and in a great safe location, the staff are very friendly and speak good english , we will stay here again really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: wanderingsar
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Francais We stayed here for three nights in December. We booked this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The staff were friendly and helpful, the manager spoke perfect English and kindly listened to my rusty French, and there was a nice personal feel to the hotel. Our room was at the front of the building, looking out onto boulevard Voltaire. Double-glazing means that you wonâ€™t be disturbed by traffic noise. The room was clean, neat and well-equipped, with a comfortable bed, plenty of storage space, safe, flatscreen TV, an iPod dock/radio and tea and coffee making facilities. There was also a minibar/small fridge with complimentary drinks. The bathroom was small but very clean and modern, and the shower was wonderful! Free wifi is available, which is so useful (why canâ€™t all hotels provide this?!). Our room rate included breakfast, which was a self-service continental buffet. The breakfast room is quite small, and did get busy towards the end of service at the weekend, but on Monday morning it was more relaxed. The hotel is located in the 11th arrondissement, which is to the east of the centre. It is very close to several metro stations - rue des Boulets is the closest, Nation is a five-minute walk and Bastille which is about 10 minutes - so it is easy to get around to the main tourist sights (if you get on line 9 at rue des Boulets, this will take you direct to the Grands Boulevards and Eiffel Tower). However, walking is by far the best way to see Paris - there are free maps available at reception. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent base”
Reviews.Author: alexmalta32
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 day stay in Paris. We chose this hotel on the basis of price, availability and good reviews. It is a cosy place, more like a pension than a Grand Hotel! Room was small, but with all necessities, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was more than ample and unrushed. The reception staff were indeed very helpful and with useful advice whenever asked. The free wifi was problematic to connect to.But all in all a pleasant experience. The hotel is located in a quiet area, but just minutes away from Nation metro - a hub letting you visit most of Paris after just one switch or directly. I would highly recommend this hotel for any short stays in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: Alona F
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. We paid 120 EUR per night. When we arrived we were upgraded to superior room for free. The rooms are very small (even the superior), but clean and cozy. The staff is great, they helped us a lot by recommending restaurants and giving tips about metro and locations. The breakfast is good for the price, outside of the hotel you will eat less and pay more. The hotel is not in a tourist zone, which is actually was an advantage. It was quiet at night. Also you have metro stations near by (about 5-7 minutes walk)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: mutated_ideals
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice now. The first was in 2005, and then again in February 2012. This was completely by accident as we couldn't remember the name of the hotel in 2005 when we booked this holiday and only realised when we went down for breakfast as it has been completely renovated since then! Obviously, this tells you something about the hotel, as it's fallen into our criteria of a good location and good reviews here twice now. The hotel is situated on Boulevard Voltaire, about five minutes from Rue de Boulet Metro and about five minutes walk from the larger Nation metro station. Our rooms cost 160E per night and were bought through booking.com in advance. There were two of us sharing a double room. It was a smallish room, but Paris is a city where space is at a premium, especially within the city centre. If you are a family, you could fit a travel cot in. We had a good sized double bed, a small desk and tea and coffee making facilities plus a small refrigerator (which contained complementary water). The room has climate control and window which opens onto a juliette balcony. The location is fairly quiet and the room is double-glazed so we were not disturbed by noise. There is a safe in the room,The room was clean and furnished in a modern fashion. The bathroom was small, with a shower, and was clean. If you are significantly overweight, or have a physical disability, the bathroom might actually be difficult to use, as you had to squeeze past the sink to get to the toilet. Breakfast was included in the price. This is a fairly simple affair but with a good selection of yoghurt, cereal, cold meat, hard boiled eggs, pastry and cheese. There were no cereals specifically aimed at children, just cornflakes and museli. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, providing us with some good restaurant reservations locally and a map of Paris. As we were visiting over Valentine's Day, there was a complementary half-bottle of champagne in the room on arrival, which was a really nice touch. All staff spoke French and English.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: marsmontblanc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of the Tripadvisor review and we were not disappointed. For the money it can't be bettered. Very clean, modern rooms. Breakfast was excellent with Tropicana juices, croissants, pain au chocolat, bread, meats, cheese etc. The location (in the 11th) is not totally central but it's only 10 mins or so on the metro to the centre. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this little hotel as a quick stopover to Provence. It was great because it was reasonably close to Gare de Lyon and very close to Nation station..The room was wonderful ,modern,and had everything required. We had a room overlooking the road which was delightful at night with all the city lights. It was so nice , its a shame I spent most of the time sleeping to get over the jet lag. Our friends had a smaller room, and whilst it was compact ,it was very functional. The bathroom was outstanding .Obviously there's been extensive renovations to the rooms.The breakfast was nice..Nothing spectacular, but adequate..We arrived early from the airport and unfortunately our room wasnt ready so there was many hours spent wanting in their foyer..I would return there though..Staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ern50s
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. For example, they recommended restaurants with great food yet moderate prices. The free breakfast was excellent. Free wifi. Reasonable room price. Renovated bathrooms are really nice. Wish I had a shower like theirs in my home. Quiet rooms even on the street side. I was on the first floor facing the street. Really couldn't hear the traffic. Must be sound resistant windows. Close to the Nation metro/RER station...so you can get anywhere. Yes the rooms are small but that is typical in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Idea hotel for few days in Paris, Friendly, clean and modern decor.”
Reviews.Author: Shinerdiner
Reviews.Content: Wonderful value for money. This hotel was modern well decorated and clean. It was easily accessible by metro, 15 mins to center of Paris. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They upgraded our room free of charge. There is nothing bad I could say about this hotel except that the rooms are small but for the price they are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base.”
Reviews.Author: lynne s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a short break in Paris. Travelled in late January 2012. Hotel in a nice quiet area of the city but within easy travelling distance of the city centre and sights via the excellent metro system. We stayed in a standard room. It was quite small, but perfectly adequate for what we wanted. Very clean and well appointed. Very comfy bed. Beautiful shower room, towels changed every day. Only small niggle was that there was very little storage in the room. One very small wardrobe, no drawers or cupboards, but we coped! Breakfast was very good. Plenty of choice, all fresh and replenished regularly. Wonderful coffee! The reception staff were very pleasant and helpfull. All spoke excellent English, and were happy to give advice on how to get about and where to eat. They were especially helpfull to us when we had a small problem which needed their local knowledge and advice. Would not hesitate to recommend and would certainly go back there if we were fortunate enough to travel to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break in january”
Reviews.Author: call_me_al_12
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, despite being outside the main hub of paris, based on trip advisor reviews in this price range. The hotel was perfect in every way. The modern, lovely decorated room although others have said small, was perfect for our needs. The bathroom, breakfast and staff couldn't be faulted. On arrival at 9.30pm we were given a choice of restaurants in the area which we could try and we plumped for Les Galopins (French Bistro 5 minutes walk) full of French locals which is always a good sign. Nation Metro station got us to the sights of Paris in a short time. The area feels very safe even late at night and the local shop-keepers are very friendly. We caught the 351 back to the airport as the RER although slightly quicker (and you need to change at Les Halles) doesn't sign the stations very well and it was difficult to know where we were on the line.The Metro is much cleaner and better organised in our opinion. Would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value for money”
Reviews.Author: Queenbeaker1
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit late admittedly as I stayed here in Jan 2010. However, it is still worth mentioning this late on. This was the best value for money I have ever seen in a hotel. Rooms arenot massive, but certainly big enough. Very modern and clean rooms. Travel is a piece of cake as Nation station is a stone's throw away with many metro lines through it. Cannt recommend this place enough. When I go back to Paris I will be staying here without bothering to look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “When in Paris, we will book again !”
Reviews.Author: Van_Mikli
Reviews.Content: Most hotel rooms are small in Paris so they need to be well furnished and well kept. This hotel is great and doing just that! We were in the large double room on 3rd floor with free Wifi, A/C, Minibar, nice bathroom, good water pressure and wonderful breakfasts. There are supermarkets, wine bars, sandwich shops, bakeries, bistros and Metro stations all nearby. We usually just walk to the larger Nation Metro station (7-10 min) for better connections into Paris and Les Galopins nearby serves awesome and great value food. We hired an airport transfer to get to the hotel and it was reasonable. If you are renting a car, the street parking are busy but possible in this area. A Navigation system is a must. (-)The only small complaint we had was when we slept in one morning; the cleaning maid open our door even when the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� was out front, lucky the chain was on so she close the door back up. So remember other than the DND sign, to bolt and chain up the door before you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but very small room”
Reviews.Author: jclaman
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very good value, but understand that your room may be very small. For a one or two day stay it may not be a problem. We stayed 4 nights and the small room got to us. The front desk is very friendly and the staff tries very hard to accommodate your requests. Breakfasts are very nice. The first room we were in had a hole in the ceiling. We complained and there was no problem moving us. Also we asked for a room in the back of hotel, but the back faces a small street so it can be noisy. Request a higher floor. Free wifi is provided. Front desk will help in suggesting nearby restaurants. We recommend Chez Prosper which you can walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: charlotte068
Reviews.Content: We went for a 4 days escapade to Paris. Really liked the location, as you can walk a lot and feel almost come one parisienne, Metro- subway- stations are close, so it is very practical. Staff was helpful and full of "bons conseils" I loved sharing my Guerlain or Mariages Freres experience.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Paris-dise!”
Reviews.Author: Wombat R
Reviews.Content: Tres, tres charmant. And yes, Trip Advisor it was all thanks to you. We found this upon your recommendations. We have spent a month travelling through Europe and were able to rely upon the posts on Trip Advisor for being acccurate and presenting us with this little gem of a hotel. Excellent value for the budget traveller, in a perfect corner of Paris. Very close to the distinctly Parisien and quiet, up market area of Paris; Le Marais. Definitely pied a terre here. The hotel is boutique, quiet and offers exceptional value with very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast is all you need and a soupcon more - the towels are large!. Ambience is perfect for first time visitors to Paris with the rumble of the metro passing by softly underground. This is a safe area and a little more gentile than some areas. Plenty of supermarkets, boulangers, patticeries and restaurants within easy walking distance.Easy travelling to all the sights. Enjoy yout little piece of Paris. Yours, Wombat.

Reviews.Title: “A good Paris hotel, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: david1962MenstonUk
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit small and the lift is a bit slow, but the reception staff are fantastic, the room modern and very clean, tea / coffee in the room, The hotel is in a great location for the price and it very good value for money. There is a bus from the Airport that takes you all the way to Nation .. the 351, just over an hour but cheaper than a taxi, and no messing about with luggage on the subway

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely choice”
Reviews.Author: smiler1308
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a surprise birthday weekend away. I didnt have a clue what to expect, and he was really nervous about his choice as I normally book all the holidays. We were not disappointed. The hotel entrance is not the most Grand, but once in our room we were thrilled to bits. The whole hotel was immaculately clean. The room was well appointed, very modern. The bathroom was tiny, and the room was on the smallish side, but I believe this is very normal for Paris. The staff were lovely and gently amused by my pathetic attempts to converse with them in french! The breakfast was lovely, plentiful and a good choice of foods. It is very easy to get around on the Metro, which is only about 100m from the hotel. There are lots of nice resturants around the Place de la Nation which is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. There is also a selection of shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EOC_12
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review before but was so impressed I felt I must acknowledge them. , The staff are friendly and very helpful. It is very clean and well equipped and at the price a real bargain. Ideally located for the metro. We would use again and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew D
Reviews.Content: even though a lot of reviews said the higher rooms are the best, me and my girlfriend were given a room on the ground floor and it was amazing! the staff were so helpful and polite and their english was amazing, especially since we had little to no knowledge of any french. the surrounding area is lovely, with many restaurants and literally seconds away from a metro station. if noise at night does bother you though, do try and get a room higher up. fantastic 3 star hotel, wish we could have stayed longer but will definitely be back to this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Anouk199
Reviews.Content: I was so shocked at this find. Outside was pretty scary looking to me but we walked in utterly exhausted and ready for anything. What a lovely place. The second the doors opened we felt instantly comfortable. We were a bit early so we camped out in the lobby for an hour. Staff was so welcoming and kind. When we got our room up we went in the worlds smallest elevator to the 5th floor and opened the door to the cutest hotel room. Just like in the pictures! So very small but everything it offered more than made up for the size. The MOST comfortable bed we had ever had in a hotel. The bathroom was small of course but perfect, with modern fixtures. Lovely big towels (really its small things like this that matter). The location is lovely with a grocery store nearby and easy walks to several metro stations. I can go on and on but I won't.....we can not recommend it enough. We will stay here every time we are in Paris now.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gafferg
Reviews.Content: Firstly location.Although not in the immediate heart of the city,with Rue des Boulets(line 9) metro station 1 minutes walk from the door access to all the sites is easy.There are also plenty of decent bars and restaurants within a 10 minute walk in the Charonne and Bastille districts. Secondly,the room.Like most reviews have mentioned the rooms are very small.Although the bathroom and walk in shower were spotlessly clean and in perfect working order,a nice bath to relax in would have been welcome at the end of the day.The television channels were basic with BBC world news being the only English language channel.Bed was comfortable but had a large square pillow and a standard pillow which were not the best.The room was on the 6th floor and was very quiet. Breakfast was served in the basement from a buffet.A very good choice of pastries,cereal,meats,fruit boiled eggs etc.Like the rest of the hotel the breakfast area was very clean. The hotel reception were very helpful with local recommendations,but never pushy.Check in was very quick. Overall the Grand Hotel Francais is very good small hotel,the size of the rooms and lack of facilities would prevent someone from spending too much time in the hotel,but that's not a bad thing with so many sight a short trip on the metro away. Tip.try and have as many euro coins as possible if using the metro.Tickets are bought from machines on the station concourses,books of 10(carnets) are the best deal.But for some reason the machines do not take euro notes.So unless you want to pay a fee for using your credit/debit card,stock up on the coins!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyHapps
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely experience staying at this hotel. Admittedly our first impression upon walking into the lobby was one of slight concern, as the design is fairly awful and we initially thought we were staying somewhere far worse. The staff were very welcoming though and when we did finally make it to our room after the creaky elevator ride, we were pleasantly surprised by our rooms. Although very small (as most hotels in paris are), the rooms were very nicely fitted out. Very cute little bathrooms and very comfortable bed. Over the three nights that we stayed there, the staff continued to prove themselves as friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was simple, but very good for the price I believe. So generally a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: chicfrommalmoe
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great service and a perfect location! We went on a romantic weekend and this hotel was perfect! The metro is located 100 meters from the hotel and there are a lot of nice restaurants nearby. Greatly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Welcome.”
Reviews.Author: attitudetwo
Reviews.Content: I would quickly recommend this hotel to anyone and will be back in the future. Our welcome was warm, advice on eating and sights right on the mark; however, the real plus was the breakfast and the room. Also, the location was perfect for most of the tourist sights and museums. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Palmer736
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean well located and friendly. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and made our stay memorable. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone and will be back next year. Thanks very much and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: joolaaaree
Reviews.Content: Checkin= fast, friendly, nice, lovely people. Room- small, smaller than small, but clean, nice, comfortable and better than 3 star. Breakfeast- fresh, quality, clean. free wi fi. good city access. stay here its lovely, but pay a little more for a bigger room then its 5 out of 5. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: tvgal2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week at the beginning of December and found it to be a clean, convenient place not in a tourist area. The front desk staff are friendly and very helpful - making calls for me, following up on a late shuttle to the airport, directions to places in the city, etc. The room was small (to be expected - I was by myself and I've traveled enough in Europe to know what to expect) but not too small - I could move around the room with ease and of course, in Paris the rooms have that wonderful large windows that open onto the street that add so much light. The furnishings were modern, and the bed was a bit soft but nothing I couldn't deal with. The bathroom was small but clean, modern and the hot water came quickly and in abundance. Didn't have the hotel breakfast (at 12 euros, it was a bit much for someone who doesn't eat a big breakfast normally) so I can't address that. The room was relatively quiet - although I probably should have brought earplugs as the hotel got busier over the weekend and the walls weren't not the thickest. The neighborhood seemed to be relatively safe and quiet, with plenty of restaurants and grocery stores nearby. It is a neighborhood with many Jewish residents so some of the restaurants are closed Friday nights and Saturdays, as are some of the grocery stores but it's not impossible to find other places open. It's 2 blocks from the Nation RER/Metro stop so it's convenient in that way. And it's a short cab ride to Gare de Lyon so again, convenient! I would recommend friends to stay there without any reservations. A nice place in a nice neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3Star for couples!”
Reviews.Author: BatesieUK
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff on arrival, spotless rooms and good location minutes walk from Place de Nation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: philippeottawa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the GHF in November 2011. The room was small as you would expect in Paris, but well designed and efficient. The bathroom was very clean. Breakfast was included in our room rate. I was happily surprised by the choice and quality of the food offered. The entire hotel staff (front office, housekeeping and breakfast) was pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located right next to a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurenmiller85
Reviews.Content: Pros -Good size rooms -Nice bathrooms (they werent large but they were upscale) -great breakfast -great customer service -very clean -Free wifi! Cons -Hot rooms (you could open the window but the street was loud) -loud street -didnt like the location of the hotel, it was too far from eerything and didnt feel as safe area

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in True Paris Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Obsessed101
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our stay! The hotel rooms are very nice. Better than many of the 4 star hotels that I have stayed in the US. The included breakfast if you choose it is really really good. Staff is so friendly and helpful. I do not have one nick-pick for this perfect hotel! The location is great if you are okay using the sub-way. The tourist areas are so congested and of course filled with tourists! It was so nice to be able to end the day in our beautiful true Parisian neighborhood. I have friends that live in NYC and a good analogy is that if feels like staying with them in SoHo or Chelsea rather than staying in Time Square :) Next time I stay in Paris I will definitely go back to Grand Hotel Francais...and that is saying something as I usually enjoy trying out new places for each vacation!

Reviews.Title: “If you looking for value for money yet a great comfortable hotel in Paris, very difficult to beat Grand Hotel Francais”
Reviews.Author: YFetchati
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Grand Hotel FranÃ§ais in Paris this week and as always it is really hard to beat! The value for money is great but I love the bed and the shower!! I must say they have done great job renovating the property. I love the fact that the metro station is 2 steps away and the line brings you straight to Opera and champs Elysee. But most what I appreciate is the friendliness of staff esp reception staff, they recognize you and always willing to help. well done Grand Hotel Francais..

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff, Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WobblyHeadedBob
Reviews.Content: After Flybe decided not to load our baggage on the same plane we flew on, getting our 2 night break off to a pretty frustrating start, we needed something good from our hotel to rescue the mood and we couldn't have asked for better than the Grand Hotel Francais. The desk clerk on duty when we arrived was fantastic and even though we arrived hours before check-in happily took our numbers and promised to call as soon as our cases were delivered. When we returned to the hotel that evening looking bedraggled from a wet day in Paris and their were still no signs of our baggage he asked for our claim references and the phone number we'd been given and took over complete responsibility for getting our baggage to the hotel as soon as possible for us, upgraded our room to one with bath so we could ease our stress, and recommended the best local places to eat. Nothing was too much trouble for him, or the other two staff members we encountered during our stay, and between them they made the hotel one of the genuine highlights of our trip. Rooms were clean and smart and everything worked as it was supposed to, the shower was fantastic, the bath was quick to fill, the hair-dryer was superb and even the shower-gel, shampoo, and bubble bath were great quality. The bed was the comfiest we've ever slept in, the duvet was warm and the pillows perfect. Breakfast was a basic continental buffet but the ingredients were of clear quality with delicious breads and pastries, a good selection of meats and cheeses, Tropicana orange juice and great tea. The little cellar dining room was cosy but very comfortable and very well presented. The location, just a few minutes walk from Nation RER/Metro station, is one of the nicer areas of Paris we encountered with a small Christmas market set up right outside the station, loads of choice for decent bistros, easy to find on a main road, but not such a busy main road that noise was ever a problem. It's walkable to Notre Damn (30mins) and Place De Vosges (20mins), on the right RER line for Disneyland and just two stops from Chatelet Les Halles where most of the RER lines, including the Airport line, intersect). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! A real gem of a hotel! if you want a short stay in paris this is a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Duncan S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to paris for three days in late November 2011 from the 24th to the 27th for my birthday. After a long trip on bus and tube to the city centre we were warmly welcomed by the concierge at the front desk, and then told we had been given a free upgrade to one of their larger rooms! Very nice to hear indeed! He then proceeded to inform us of the local surroundings (good restuarants, tube stations etc) very useful information for first time visitors to Paris. Breakfast was provided as part of our stay which was a great selection of the usual continental treats. The hotel is very near to a major tube station: 'Nation' but there is another Rue de Boulets that was even closer. The room was very comfortable with an big bed, clean bathroom (my GF particularly enjoyed the large shower). On day two we wanted to get a reservation at a local well known restaurant, but didnt really want to spend the day on the phone, so the concierge actually spent most of the morning on the phone for us getting us a table. Great help :) Finally when our final day came round they even securely stored our bags after check out whilst we killed time in the city until our flight. In short this is a great hotel in a wonderful city and if you want a short stay in Paris, stay at the Grand Hotel Francais :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great week, upgraded! friendly staff, clean modern room”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days. Hotel is great - welcomed warmly - were upgraded from 'superior' to 'privilege' room without asking. Room had three windows! Was beautifully presented, very clean, great shower, very hot water. Free wifi. All staff very friendly. A great local area with nice cafes and patisseries, metro station one minute walk from hotel. RER station 3 minutes walk. Highly recommend. Insignificant negatives: Breakfast enough to get you going but not incredible - by no means a problem, only TV channels in English were BBC news and CNN. We took our laptop and DVDs so no problem... Great little market on Rue De Charonne nearby worth visiting, amazing produce. We also found a massive boutique-y antiquity permanent market at St Ouen. Not in the guide books for some reason. Worth visiting for a browse/if you have a LOT of Euros.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon, and it was fabulous. The staff at the Grand Hotel Francais really went the extra mile to take care of us. They had great advice on restaurants, including where we should go for our first French meal as a couple, the best route to Versailles on the RER, and more. Everyone spoke excellent English, which my husband appreciated, and I as a fluent French-speaker appreciated that they spoke French with me instead of switching to English at the first hint of an accent as so many in the tourism industry in Paris do. The rooms are small but have beautiful modern decor and are well-organized (shelving/closet space around the bed, etc.) enough that the small size isn't an issue. The bathroom is good-sized for a Paris hotel. On our last night we were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne chilling in our room as a gift for our last honeymoon night. The neighborhood is nice and non-touristy with some great bakeries and restaurants (it appears to have a strong Jewish presence so several of them are closed on Saturdays), and the hotel is located near a Metro station as well as a 5 minute walk from the more major Nation station connecting to more lines. We could not have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tom W
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days. The rooms looked exactly like the hotels website. Nicolas and Zaid on the front desk were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel is near 2 metro stations rue des boulets and the larger nation in the 11th Arrondissement. The entire staff helped make our stay very enjoyable and I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction, as promissed”
Reviews.Author: rratier
Reviews.Content: Apart from a minor problem at the check in (they couldnÂ´t find our reservation -- and they still didnÂ´t, but they let us in), we were very satisfatied with the GHF. Rooms are brand new, complete, very clean and quiet. Not big (hey: Paris), but not too small. Not cheap (160 euros per night by couple), but again: Paris. Helpful staff (english spoken). Oh, letÂ´s not forget the complimentary champagne. 300 meters away from Nation metro station, served by many lines. The arrondissement is not a touristic one, but it is interesting to explore. We can get a feel of the parisian way of life. Get your velib and search for the good and cheaper reataurants nearby!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Esty1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many different hotels in Paris over the years and this is easily the best. Modern, exceptionally clean and a decent breakfast (a first so far for us) and very friendly and helpful staff who couldn't do enough for us. A decent sized bathroom with a walk in shower, lots of large fluffy towels and the slippers were a nice touch too. It's slightly out of the way and there isn't much to see or do in the vicinity, but there are lots of nice restaurants and bars nearby (There is a good selection down Rue Montreuil) and Bastille is about a 20 min walk away. It's also away from hoards of tourists so you tend to be out with the locals as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed Good Rest !”
Reviews.Author: kellyrila
Reviews.Content: I chose Grand Hotel Francais mainly because its high ranking in tripadvisor. When arrived, first impression is very good as hotel staff are super helpful & friendly. -ve: room is 'compact' - parisien standard !! not much room to place luggage; walls are relatively 'thin' that you can hear sound from other rooms & noises from the lift. +ve: bed/pillow are extremely comfortable; bathroom got shower; slippers available. In terms of location, its on 'Boulets' metro, about 8min walk to 'Nation' metro line which connect to RER-Gare de Lyon. Nation is quite a residential neighbourhood, safe & warm, lots of bakery, cafes, supermarket, pharmacies nearby, and we luckily came by Saturday wonderful food markets. There's a Printemps too. I would recommend this hotel to those who think comfy bed/shower is 1st priority instead of location. As Nation is really not that close to main attraction in paris to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: mattp72
Reviews.Content: The main reason for the 'very good' rating is the rate: 140 euros for two including breakfast is excellent for central Paris. For that price you'd expect a youth hostel, and it's certainly not that. However, beyond the fantastic front desk staff and the convenient location, there's not loads to recommend it. Design / look is rather 90s chintzy, some fixtures and fittings are worn or chipped, standard rooms are really small, the rooms are all crammed in together and the walls are very thin, so we could hear a neighbour opening a desk drawer (almost). Location is convenient rather than nice: it's on a boulevard populated by clothes wholesalers and electrical shops - but within minutes you can be on the rue de Charonne walking to the Marais, and it's a 5-10 minute cab ride to great bars, restaurants, museums etc. So overall, a very good budget option, but I'm not sure it quite deserves its Trip Advisor ranking of one of the top 20 hotels of Paris...!

Reviews.Title: “okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: swampie
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Okay location, not walkable to everywhere, but near the metro. Reception was pleasant. My two problems with the place are: 1) the elevator. Slow, jerky and seems a little dangerous. If one NEEDS a lift, this is not the place I'd recommend, unless you want to spend your time in Paris waiting for an elevator. 2) But what really ticked me off is on the morning of check out, I put a do not disturb sign on the door and went out for a bit. When I returned, the maid was in my room and all the food and water I'd bought for the train ride that I'd put in the minifridge were gone. WTF. PS: the website said breakfast was included but they charged me for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice.”
Reviews.Author: romford99
Reviews.Content: Like many others chose this hotel from the reviews I read. The staff are 1st class. Very friendly and helpfull. The bedroom was small but really well furnished, clean with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was modern with a walk in shower and again very clean. It is close to 2 Metro stations making it easy to get around and visit the sights of Paris with trains coming every few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: DK-NO
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here mid November. The room is clean and nice (just like in pictures) however our room is extremely tiny, it's probably because it's located in the corner (by the elevator). Apart from that, our stay was fabulous. We got 2 (small) bottles of wine along with the wine glasses and a greeting on bed when we arrived (although we arrived very late) and that the receptionist (day and night) are very helpful. The place is extremely close to Metro station Rue des Boulettes and within walking distance to big metro Nation (but if you're new to Paris and arrive after switching to other metro station, get another metro (M9?) to Rue des Boulettes instead of trying to figure out which exit from Nation that goes to Boulevard Voltaire. Little bit complicated

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: plaza8204
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel on the basis of other reviews, it is in a great location away from the tourist traps but easy enough to get around the city, we stayed 2 nights on on returning to our room the hotel had left a box of chocolate and two bottles of wine on our bed, i tought this was a really nice touch and better than the usual chocolate on the pillow!! the receptionist was very helpful and jolly, would return and recommend to hotel to all. the bus from the airport stops at nation which is less then 10 mins away

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: JKEMtravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights. Expectations were met based on reviews read on this site. Initially hesitant on the location given that it was not in city centre, but was not a problem at all given the convenience of the 2 metro stations w/in 5 minute walk...made for a great base to explore the city. We were upgraded to a Superior Room free of charge, which was much appreciated as rooms are quite small (can't imagine how tiny a Double Room would be!). Although rooms are rather small, it was very clean, and modern/updated. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good starting place to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lamafrookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in this hotel for 7 nights. I found the hotel room was really small, but i've heard that's the norm in Paris. The hotel was not located in a tourist area, but was very conviniently located between 2 metro stations. It's less than 10 minute walk away from Nation station, which will take you to anywhere in Paris, even Disneyland. Staffs were very polite and friendly, and they were more than happy to give us pointers about the city. They also provided us with a map of local restaurants around the hotel, we tried some and loved them. We had a great stay, and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: figment7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris and had one of the best experiences we have had while staying at the Grand Hotel Francais. The staff was excellent even when using our broken French and made excellent suggestions for eateries in the local area. The hotel is close to 2 metro stops one is within 2 or 3 minute walk and the Nation stop which is a major metro for RER and the 2 and 6 lines of metro is about 5-10 minute walk. The rooms are standard compared to european standards, however the bathroom was quite spacious. Our room had a step out balcony which was excellent and greatly appreciated. If in the area again we will stay here without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: goodstays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here at the end of October to celebrate our anniversary and can recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience a little of "local" paris. It isn't in the middle of the touristy parts but in a lovely residential neighbourhood and well served by the Metro. Our room was lovely, the bathroom was well designed and very chic and the staff, especially Ziyad (I m sorry about the spelling!) who was a veritable fountain of knowledge and helpful in every regard, were great. He recommended fabulous restuarants for dinner each night and we thoroughly enjoyed eating where the locals do and having the most awesome food. We were greeted with a note and some champagnein our room on arrival to help celebrate our anniversay which was a lovely touch. It is all the thought put into making each stay special that really makes this a great place to stay. Our room was comfortable, transport links were great and coupled with the help and friendliness of all the staff make it easy to see why the Grand Hotel won a Travellers Choice award. They deserve it! We would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Another 3 Starts in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LustForTravel
Reviews.Content: Paris is an expensive city and the hotels charge you a lot for the quality they offer you. I say this because it is important to put things into the right perspective. You might not find a much better quality hotel in the same price range. The hotel is close to a subway station, but not near the main city attractions. The neighborhood is good and pleasant to wander around. The breakfast is fine too. The bedroom had a few serious problems: the quality of the mattress is not good. So, sleep quality got compromised. The bathroom door didn't close and overall feel of the room could be compared to a motel 6 level. There's nothing special or oustanding or even memorable about this place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel , pity paris not as hospitable”
Reviews.Author: bigrab
Reviews.Content: hotel did exactly as all travellers have said. room 63 was small but had everything needed and breakfast was ideal start to the day, a lot better value than anything outside. first time in paris and extremely disappointed. paris shuttle taxis a disaster, 1 1/2 hour wait at airport. paris is full of homeless , beggars , conmen and overpriced low quality bar /restaurants.. museums and sites excellent. people(even when trying to speak to them in french) were pretty ignorant. new york 100 times better, staff at hotel were superb, pity rest of paris not so.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: loucos
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a little early for booking-in. Nicolas at the reception made us feel at ease staright away. He kept our suitcase and we went off to explore Paris. On our return the room was ready. The room was I must say spotless. The room was very comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. The breakfast was of very good quailty. I would recommend this hotel and would happily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noslackgrl
Reviews.Content: This was our very first time in Paris. Zyad, the owner/manager of the hotel, was the most friendly, knowledgeable and helpful hotel hosts we could have asked for and makes great coffee. From the time I started calling for information on rooms and reservations to the time we checked out, Zyad did his best to help us have the best 25th anniversary trip possible. He made suggestions for local restaurants with true French food that were reasonably priced and directions on how to navigate Paris. We had room 62, the suite, which was a not too small. The bathroom had a great shower and was nicely renovated with very modern fixtures. The breakfast had alot of variety for 12 euros, but there was a bakery close by with great breakfast, lunch and pastry selections. It was very nice to be outside of the noisy center of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon Hotel Francais!”
Reviews.Author: GoingSouth09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Hotel Francais for 3 nights during October, 2011. This is a small boutique hotel with a great French atmosphere. The place was clean and the rooms, though small (as is the case in most Paris hotels), were well appointed and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast offered many choices. It was conveniently located near a Metro stop. We booked this hotel based on the many positive reviews, and we were not disappointed. Five stars for everything!

Reviews.Title: “So happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: westie1015
Reviews.Content: After doing research online, I chose this hotel based on the reviews and was not disappointed. We arrived before our room was ready, but Zyad was ever the host already. We had cold beverages and gathered directions to head out to the Metro to pick up our Paris Pass. When we returned our room was ready(#23) and there was champagne waiting to toast my birthday. A thoughtful touch. We loved our room - a corner one with 3 windows and balconies all around. The hotel decor is modern and is very well appointed. There was plenty of space, and the housekeeping does a marvelous job. All hotels should be this clean! The night staff, Eddie was also very helpful answering our questions, and what he didn't know, he looked up online for us. This hotel and its staff were a memorable part of our trip. We'd stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Area!”
Reviews.Author: Vince P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel based on the many favorable comments. It was our second time in Paris, last time having stayed near the Arc de Triomphe. Our first thought as we drove into the neighborhood was that it was very busy and loud; more so than our last visit. That was probably due to having a car, which is not recommended, and trying to navigate to the hotel. After dropping off the luggage at the hotel and turning in the car, we checked in and were immediately impressed by Nicholas, who was working at the front desk. He was very polite, welcoming and accommodating as the room was not yet ready (we were early). The hotel is compact in every respect, but very nicely appointed and decorated and very comfortable. Later, we met Zyad and, like Nicholas, was very helpful and informative in everything we needed including arranging transportation to CDG. Be sure to ask about the hotel restaurant recommendations because, if you like Italian food, they will direct you to an outstanding place, "Cefalu", just around the block. The friendliest husband and wife run the place and the food is "squisito"! The Metro is close-by with several lines available. The location is a fair distance from many of the major sights, but the Metro brings them very close. In addition, there is a better feeling of living among the Parisiens as opposed to other tourists. Count the people carrying baguettes versus cameras. Our first thought about the area was wrong. For us, this hotel checked all the boxes and we would love to visit there again. Thanks Nicholas and Zyad! Stay here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Jen J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Grand Hotel Francais, and we could not have been happier with our choice. In many ways, the hotel has exceeded our expectation: the price was within our budget, breakfast was included, and the staff was friendly, helpful and fluent in English. As other travelers have mentioned, the hotel is close to the Nation Metro station, which makes it easy to get around. The room size was just enough to fit two people, but we had a comfortable stay throughout. Overall, the hotel lives up to its high Trip Advisor rating. We would love to stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and the staff was very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: JR_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Paris for one night. We liked the reviews we saw here on TripAdvisor for the Grand Hotel Francais. The price was very comparable. The hotel is 3 blocks from the Nation station that's served by the 1, 2, 6 and 9 metro lines and the A RER line. The closest station which is 1 block away is Rue des Boulets which is served by the 9 line. The hotel is not centrally located to the major tourist sites in Paris, ie. Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame. You will need to take public transportation to visit these sites. There are a few markets near by to get some food and drinks. There is also a few bakeries/pastry shops around the hotel. Check in was easy. The receptionist spoke perfect English and seemed fluent in Spanish as well. He gave us directions to the metro and asked if we needed any recommendations for dinner. Our room was on the 6th floor, room 64. The elevator was a little cramped and slow. The room was small by American standards, but a decent size for European standards, but we did not mind as we were not going to spend much time in our hotel room. The room had very good free wifi that supported video skype. There was a flat screen tv a safe large enough to store a dslr camera and laptop/tablet. There was a mini fridge that we did not use. The room also had a desk/table and a mini balcony. The bathroom had a standup shower and there was no bidet in our bathroom, just a toilet. We had a minor mishap when the standup shower got clogged and overflowed into the bathroom floor. We called the front desk to inform them of the situation and to bring up additional towels as we had used ours to dry the floor. We told them that we would be going out and that if they could take care of the situation while we were away. When we returned later that evening they had repaired the clogged drain, had replenished our towels and provided us complimentary mini wine bottles for the mishap. Would definitely stay here again. Rooms were modern, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Peter_G017
Reviews.Content: As other guests mentioned before, very lovely place to stay. Not very central, but with the Metro easy accessible. Very friendly and helpful staff. I can absolutely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “I'll Definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: fireflywoods
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Grand Hotel Francais. I felt at home very quickly during my 4 night stay there on my first visit to Paris. My room was compact, but very nicely decorated, comfortable and reasonably priced. The hotel's manager and his staff were friendly and helpful with all the guests (including those who spoke little or no French). The hotel is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood which is a bit away from the main tourist areas. However, it is less than a 10 minute walk from the Nation metro station which offers connections to several Metro lines and it was nice to be away from the craziness and crowds of the tourist sections. There are also laundromats and a PNB ATM nearby (as of this writing, BNP charges no ATM fee for Bank of America customers). I will definitely be back when I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: swissmiss001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the end of a 4 night stay in Paris. The city was very busy at the time and I needed an extra night on my own after staying with a girlfriend at another hotel that was completely booked for the extra night when I needed a single. After reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to try this hotel. I found it to be a good value with a very clean, quiet, and comfortable room. There was free wifi in the room, something that I always look for. It was a close-by, convenient location for my visit to PÃ¨re Lachaise cemetery, but other than that I found the location a bit far out. It is close to metro and RER, but it's not one of my preferred locations when staying in Paris, a city that I visit quite often. If you are just looking for value and don't mind staying a bit further out, this hotel would be a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueKach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a long weekend, the room was small (typical for Paris) but REALLY clean and nicely updated. The bed was very comfortable and the room was suprisingly quiet, since we were on the 2nd floor on the main street. You can't beat the price! So close to the metro(s) and didn't take more than 20 minutes to get to any major sites. The neighborhood was nice, safe, non-touristy and had very good restauarants for dinner that were in walking distance. Breakfast was included and had a nice variety to get your day started. Front desk was very helpful and happy to assist. We would highly recomend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: eric l
Reviews.Content: Researched Paris hotels recommended by Tripadvisor. Grand Hotel Francais was rated one of the top hotels. We booked it through Booking.com. It was exactly like what our fellow reviewers wrote. Fantastic hotel close to the two metro stations that can take you everywhere in Paris. Day manager was superb. Smart, friendly, knowledgeable. All staff were extremely kind and attentive. Rooms were perfect. What more can I say? STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lilmatley
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at this gorgeous boutique hotel in Paris. It was nice to be out of the tourist areas and fun to navigate the metro. It was so easy to get to all the little neighborhoods via the Nation metro stop. The room very clean and the shower was very nice. Breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet and pleasant hotel - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sol_gr
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet and pleasant hotel, well positioned close to Nation metro station, crossroads of central metro lines guiding to all the important sights of Paris. Breakfast is excellent. The manager of the hotel was most of the times in the reception, always with a smile and a solution to our needs, including Internet where we faced connection problems. The room was quite small and the sheets and towels (clean and seemed like new) were replaced every day. The lighting of the room was strong, a dimmer is required especially for the lights close to the bed. The bathroom was like recently renovated and clean. In general, by taking in account the enormous prices of Paris' hotels (in another touristic city, when you pay 140 Euros per night, you expect a higher rated hotel and in a more central position!), we are happy with our decision to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star treatment - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Twilight2Twilight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GHF for 8 days. We could not have picked a better hotel. From the moment we made our reservations to the moment we left, we were treated incredibly well. Zyad, the hotel manager is outstanding ! Here's a bit of info for people researching and wondering if they should stay at GHF (YES you should absolutely stay there) STAFF: Zyad the hotel manager is extremely helpful as were all others on staff. Always smiling, pleasant, saying hello and extremely helpful no matter what you ask or need. HOTEL: Completely renovated with modern decor. There is an elevator, a small bar in the lobby and the breakfast room in the basement. Hotel is located in a quiet neighbourhood away from all the tourists & noise from central Paris. Yet is it conveniently located near a Metro station (Les Boulets) very close by and also the Nation station (bigger hub) that has both metro and RER lines which is a 5-10 minutes walk away. There are many shops close by for groceries, patisseries, boulangeries, pharmacy, flower market, restaurants and lots more. ROOMS: Air condionned, completely renovated. Bathroom shower was absolutely amazing with great water pressure, large shower head with jets on the wall for the back. Heaven !! The bed was comfortable, there was room for storing clothes. The room was very small but that is the norm in Paris. Everything was very clean, nothing was damaged. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms and never had any issues with connection. There is a kettle with coffee & tea as well as a small fridge. Small flat screen TV mounted on the wall as well. There is a safe in the room as well as in Ipod docking station. The towels are large, not the small little thing you can't do anything with. They also stock the bathroom daily with shampoo, lotion, shower gel. They even provide slippers and a loofah ! BREAKFAST: We had breakfast included in our rate so we ate breakfast every day at the hotel. The food was always good & fresh. They have cereals, yogourt, fruit salad, rolls, croissants, pastries, jams, cheese, cold cuts, fresh orange & apple juice. The coffee is amazing, be sure to drink their coffee it's really really good ! And the staff always smiling and ready to help. Yes it is a bit off the beaten path but it is also nice to come back at night and be in a quiet neighbourhood after being in the crazy busy city all day long. This hotel is an excellent choice. The price is right, the service absolutely outstanding, modern, clean & a great value. I would definately stay there again without any hesitation. Do yourself a favor and read all the reviews, you will see that the same things stand out: excellent service & completely renovated & clean facilities. We chose this hotel based on the many reviews we read and we were so glad we did, best choice we could have made ! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KnThrak1982
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Reasonably priced, good breakfast. Very friendly staff, with good English. Close to Metro No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: WiganKebab
Reviews.Content: Likes Lovely hotel staff, very friendly helpful and knowledgeable (and they are not afraid to speak English too). Hotel was quite nice and quiet, set in a nice quieter area of centre of Paris away from the main hustle and bustle, but still within short walking distance of many bars, cafe's, restaurants and shops, and also close to main the main metro (Nation a particularly good stop 5 mins walk away) and bus links to that will take you to all the main places to see in Paris. Hotel was very clean, quite modern, and despite being small it had all the amenities you'd want from the type of hotel for a city break, including a lovely comfortable bed after a long day. Breakfast was good (not many seem to offer in Paris), always well stocked with typical continental type things. Also quite reasonably priced hotel compared to many others I looked at. Potential Dislikes Be wary if you don't like compact rooms - I knew what to expect - and you have to remember that this is Paris and space is at a premium (plus how much time are you spending in your room anyway â€“ this is Paris, get out and see it). Apart from that, nothing. Oh - the lift is a bit slow - lol!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvptravels
Reviews.Content: We spent four amazing nights at the Grand Hotel Francais during our September, 2011 trip to Europe. It was the perfect finale to our twelve night journey that included Italy, Paris and London. Our flight from Berlin to Orly Airport arrived at around 8pm. After getting our luggage and purchasing metro tickets, we took the Orlyval train from the airport to the Metro station in Antony for our first connection on the way to the hotel. We arrived at the hotel just before 10pm. Using the metro was great for us. We got off at the Nation metro station and walked less than ten minutes to the hotel. On arrival, the front desk gentleman checked us into our room. We took the lift up to the first floor and entered our room, only to find women's undergarments strewn all-over the bed and a shower running in the restroom. Either we were about to receive a warm welcome to Paris, or we got the wrong room. After returning to the front desk, we were given a different room on a higher floor. The front desk attendant said he did not know if we would be moved the next day. He also told us that breakfast was available for a fee in the morning. I informed him that our reservation included breakfast. He said we could work it out with the manager in the morning. So we headed up to our room. The room was fantastic. It had a comfortable bed and plenty of wonderful amenities including a refrigerator, coffee pot, television with a few English channels, plenty of room for our backpacks and luggage, and a safe. There was even an iPod docking station. The bathroom was nothing short of spectacular. The deep, tub had an amazing showerhead, plenty of soaps, shampoos, lotions and even a loofa. There was no shortage of towels. The hotel even provided slippers. We had a view of a courtyard outside our room. With the windows open, there was hardly any noise outside. The stay was quite comfortable. After our first night, we met the manager Zayed in the morning. He informed us that we would be staying in our upgraded room for the duration of our stay. He also confirmed that due to our Expedia status, we would indeed be able to enjoy our breakfast for free. Breakfast included a nice selection of meats, cheeses, breads, fruit, coffee, tea and juices. The breakfast was buffet-style, and a staff prepared our hot beverages for us. All-in-all, we had a wonderful stay at this hotel and will gladly return on our next trip to Paris. The hotel is several miles from Paris' major sites, but thanks to the metro system, everything form the Eiffel Tower, to Notre Dame, Arc de Triomphe and The Louvre are just a quick train ride away. The neighborhood surrounding Grand Hotel Francais has a nice collection of small restaurants and shops as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: bucketlist6045
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our recent trip to Paris for our honeymoon. Somehow the hotel manager knew about the honeymoon (maybe we mentioned it when making reservations). He had champaigne waiting in our room at check in. What a nice touch! Since my husband and I do not speak French and had never been to Paris before we relied upon the hotel staff for a lot of assistance and advice. The staff was very helpful and patient. As other travelers mentioned, the hotel is near two Metro stops, as well as a grocery store, bakery, and laundromat. It's not particularly close to the touristy attractions, but that may not be a bad thing. (Btw...if you have an American credit card without the new chip the Metro machines will not accept it. You must have change, not bills, and there likely won't be a human available to assist with the transaction. It took us 2 hours to buy Metro passes.) Rooms are compact, efficient, and clean. Breakfast is available each morning. However, we were charged 12 Euros per person per day for the breakfast. Had we known it was not included in the cost of the room we probably would have made a different choice. Overall this hotel is a good value and I would stay there again. I can't say enough about the helpful, friendly staff. That is what makes this hotel stand out from the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: alang2nevada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for seven nights. The staff was outstanding (especially Zayed and Nicholas) - helpful, accomodating, friendly, etc. The room was small but clean, recently remodeled, and comfortable. Breakfast was nothing special. Plenty of casual and reasonably priced restaurants within easy walking distance. Especially enjoyed Les Galopins (tradional French) and PO.ZA.DA (wine bar, with good food). Even though this is on the far eastern end of Paris, there are two metro stops close by, including Nation so getting anywhere was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SuziB_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night last weekend. The room was very modern, much nicer than I had expected. Spacious (for Paris), very clean and great bed. Staff were super friendly and helpful - going above and beyond the basis level of welcome. I can't recommend this place highly enough. It isn't in a particularly cool or trendy location - the area felt very safe though, and the hotel is close to Nation metro so very central for getting around. I had read the positive reviews on this site, but was still pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was and consider it good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: vinmaz44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in June and were very impressed by the friendly welcome we received upon arrival. We had not expected this as it had not happened on our two previous trips to Paris, so were very pleasantly suprised. We were also upgraded to a very nice deluxe room on the topf floor with a wrap around balcony with two sets of french doors leading out onto it. The view was wonderful. Also we had mentioned we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the management had left in our room a bottle of champagne and glasses. A very special touch. Our room was nicely modernised including the bathroom and was extremely clean. Breakfast was included and was very enjoyable. It set us up nicely for the day of sightseeing! Location wise, this hotel is close to the metro and has plently of restaurants around it. So we would recommend it to other travellers. If you haven't been to Paris before and are considering it, you are in for a magical experience. There is no other city like Paris!

Reviews.Title: “We would return to this lovely little hotel in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Felice3
Reviews.Content: It was well located in a very safe Parisian neighbourhood only 500 metres from the Metro. The rooms are small but very funtional and nicely decorated. The shower was fabulous with plenty of fresh towels each day. All the staff was pleasant and helpful but our favorite was Zyad who was not only super knowledgeable and helpful but outrageously funny; he really should be on stage. There were lots of wonderful restaurants nearby with very few tourists; this means they really work at friendly service. If you want to avoid the tourist trap areas of this amazing city, stay at this hotel. You won't regret it! (By the way, we are a mother and adult daughter from Canada.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely long birthday weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterDeborah
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely four nights in the Grand Hotel Francais in Sept 2011. The staff, especially the manager are very welcoming and helpful with regards to finding your way around Paris and the local restaurants. On hearing it was my birthday, the staff made every effort to make our trip even more special and enjoyable. The hotel itself is situated in the Bastille area with two metro stops just minutes away, making it a good base to access the tourist attractions of Paris whilst feeling a little calmer. Our room was very comfortable, and the modern ensuite bathroom was spotless. There are good restaurants nearby, and we especially enjoyed the traditional French fare in Le Chardenoux and Au P'tit Panisse.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here and loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: maria_barrett
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic to stay at, yes the rooms are rather small but at least the bathroom is a decent size and it had the best shower we have had since leaving home, everything was spotlessly clean and the staff on reception and at breakfast were fantastic, very friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough to help us, we were very impressed, and would return here to stay if we return to Paris. Metro station Nation was great and easy to get to and find your way around and the local bars and supermarkets were fantastic. We found a lot of people could speak good english and never found the language to be a barrier at all, the restaurants recommended by the reception staff were fantastic, we loved the food and drinks and didn't think it was expensive at all, very good value. We went to Moulin Rouge and that was magnificent, a must for all who visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: heywood417
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a trek across Europe for our honeymoon. The room was a little small (the smallest of all the hotels we stayed at over 12 days), but that's our only complaint. The front desk staff was friendly & helpful, breakfast had a great selection of pastries, cheeses, eggs, meats & breads, plus standard things like cereal & juice. Americano style coffee available as well as espresso & cappucino. We used the hop-on hop-off buses to tour the city, & the hotel was about a 15 minute walk from the nearest pick up point (Place de Bastille). Hotel offers a locked storage room for guests to leave luggage before or after checkout so you can continue touring without hauling your luggage all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: awfullybigadventure
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but this is Paris. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. There are some extra touches like chocolates on the bed when you first arrive and slippers to make you feel right at home. There is a flat screen tv with basic tv cable package. I slept like a log and heard no noise from outside the window or within the hotel and no light poked through under the door. It is not the closest to the centre of Paris but I've stayed in Paris a few times so was relaxed about that and there is a metro step within 3 minutes of the door.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not close”
Reviews.Author: SirEdthe1st
Reviews.Content: A little dissapointed given other reviews. We were checked in by a guy who seemed focussed on highlighting that we couldn't speak french. The rooms are clean but neither huge nor do they offer anything other than French speaking Tv. Not really close to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, thank you Ian and Nicolas”
Reviews.Author: tbeard24
Reviews.Content: We (my girlfriend and I) spent four nights at the hotel in room 13. The room was clean, with a TV, ipod dock and Wifi, two small balconies, a big comfortable bed and a view of Boulevard Voltaire. The room was small but then they all are in Paris. It was stylishly decorated and very quiet considering the location. The bathroom was really nice, with a rainforest style shower head and unlimited hot water. The location is excellent, the hotel is across the road from Rue de Boulets Metro Station and within walking distance of two others, Nation and Charonne.
