As you'd expect there are lots of nice cafes and boulangeries nearby and a couple of convenience shops also. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. The reception is manned 24/7. Whilst we stayed there we mainly saw Ian and Nicolas. Both were extremely helpful, funny and made you feel at home. They speak several languages each and were conversing with guests in Portuguese, German, English, Arabic and French. They recommended good restaurants and also checked my choices to see if they were in good areas. They also booked the restaurants on our behalf to avoid any mishaps with my poor French. They recommended Les Galopins, which is nearby and was excellent. They arranged free laundry service and on checkout were happy to hold our considerable luggage while we enjoyed out last afternoon in Paris. We plan to return to Paris and would choose Grand Hotel Francais again. (The professional photos are accurate, our room was the one that comes up first)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: k_6725
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in August. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the metro. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, and very well equipped (with even speakers that you can plug your iPod/iPhone into). Air conditioning was functioning well, which is a plus in the summer. Staff were friendly as well, with many recommendations on nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Upalong
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to Gare de Lyon. We trusted the other TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Rooms were a bit small as expected, but very clean and well equipped. Staff was very helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent given Paris' overpriced nature”
Reviews.Author: MooBarkley
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, generously proportioned rooms, modern bath/shower, and TV with French and English channels. Tasteful decor and fine views of the charming boulevard below. Also spotless, and yes, it has an elevator. If you are looking for what can easily be considered a 4-star property in a city that is famously overpriced, here's your ticket. In addition, it is very close to the Metro and, for those that don't mind a medium-sized stroll, walking distance to many attractions. Dozens of nearby cafes, shops, and restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent service, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Jon H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and found the receptionists to be very helpful and friendly. The room was very modern and comfortable, maybe a little bit small, but that was not a problem. To get to all the tourist attractions is very easy. There is a metro just down the street. Really nice place, very friendly people. Made our weekend very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend for any couple on Paris city break”
Reviews.Author: CWDilworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the first weekend of September for our 1st wedding anniversary and were upgraded to a larger room (albeit still quite small) and found a small bottle of champagne in our room on our special day! The hotel staff were very helpful and the location is literally next to Rue des Boulets metro (also close to Nation). Everything is accessible on the Metro from here! Paris is an expensive city but this hotel is good value by comparison, clean, modern and comfortable. We went to a couple of restaurants recommended by the reception guys - Les Galpins & Les Chardeneux (pricey!) for our anniversary and both were excellent. If you are into fitness/jogging there is a converted railway line which is now a park called Promenade Plantee which is pretty and a great 4mile approx run including to and from hotel! We would recommend this to anyone wanting good comfortable accommodation without being completely ripped off by Paris prices!

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant”
Reviews.Author: davicio
Reviews.Content: Slightly based on the outskirts of Central Paris - but don't let this be a burden as I think it's possibly reflected in their price. In fact, I walked back from Notre Damn, so not that great a distance - or it could have been actually thinking about what I consumed in alcohol. The staff are lovely, the room was pleasant and this is all I really used it for. It's also close to two Metro stations - one of them being mainline (Nation). Absolutely no complaints (apart from the lift didn't work on the first night - but really not a big deal).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: sydneyflitter
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights here on a round trip of Europe this year and it was very clean and comfortable with good facilities. The room we stayed in was small but I understand that this is usual for hotels in Paris and it was not uncomfortably so. This hotel is located about 50m from Place de la Nation on the right hand side of Paris and is therefore a long way from the main tourist attractions of the Eiffel Tower side. However, the metro is close and it's not a very long ride to the attractions. Having said this, the area it's in is a side of Paris that most tourists don't see. There are markets, excellent (reasonably priced!) cafes, and great restaurants nearby. The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke good English (to complement my pidgin french!) recommending a good restaurant and helping with plans. Overall a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff in Paris”
Reviews.Author: maggynorden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with a friend had traveled all over France by car for 3 weeks and spent our last 2 nights in Paris here. It was the perfect way to end our trip. The hotel lobby and rooms are beautiful. The staff is very friendly, they speak English and had a welcome letter (in English) and a gift box of chocolates for us on our (incredibly comfortable) bed. They made restaurant recommendations and reservations for us and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. The buffet breakfast was included and plentiful. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TRJRM
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great find for our European trip. We stayed here for 3 nights while enjoying the sights of Paris. The front desk staff and owner were all very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. We felt like we were staying at their house! The rooms are modern, clean and functional. We were a party of 5 so we got 2 rooms next door to each other and that worked out perfectly. It is close to 2 metro stations so we did not have any trouble getting around. They even offered to do our laundry for us...at no charge!!! Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps we should all keep quiet about this gem”
Reviews.Author: bienterry
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything that other guests have not said before. This Paris hotel punches way over itâ€™s weight and is the best we have stayed in for several years. They have just got everything right. Thank you Zyad, we enjoyed our stay and it was a pleasure meeting you.

Reviews.Title: “Just a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joerg K
Reviews.Content: In August 2011 we stayed four days in Paris, and the Grand Hotel Francais made our stay wonderful. We received a warm welcome from the receptionist, who also speaks German and English. All staff members are very friendly, polite, and helpful. We booked a superior double room (including breakfast) for two persons and got a room with balcony, which we had asked for. The room (particularly the bathroom) was small, but very clean and nicely decorated. Due to limited room sizes corpulent or also older people should perhaps rather book privilege rooms or suites. The hotel is very quiet and despite street view, we could sleep with open windows (okay, it was August and many people obviously on holidays). The included breakfast was good and contained much more than a croissant and a hot cup of coffee. Moreover, getting around Paris from this hotel was very easy because the hotel is located almost across the Metro station (Rue des Boulets) at Blvd Voltaire and in walking distance to the Place de la Nation. Overall, we can highly recommend this hotel to anybody traveling to Paris and of course we will stay here again ourselves when back in town. Joerg & Sonja, Frankfurt/Main, Germany

Reviews.Title: “Excellence from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: Collegeprof
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and found the concierge Zyed and his assistant Angela to be extremely helpful for all our typical tourist questions. These two work so hard to make sure our stay is as pleasant as possible. Our updated modern room was small, but typical of Europe. We found the area to be quite safe, with many nearby restaurants to choose for lunch or dinner. There is a supermarket directly across the street with a fabulous deli a few doors down that sell freshly baked baguettes. You are literally steps from the subway and access to anywhere in Paris. Boulevard Voltaire is a main boulevard with shops and restaurants galore. When we return to Paris, we will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic84
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome at check-in which continued throughout our 4 night stay. The staff was very helpful making restaurant recommendations, giving us directions, etc. Our room was very tiny, but not uncommon for hotels in Paris. However, they made it as comfortable as they could from the complimentary bottles of water to the thorough daily cleaning and replenishments of toiletries. They even left me a birthday gift of champagne and chocolate. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk to the Nation metro line that brings you right to the center of the city - Hotel de Ville, Louvre, Champs-Elysses, etc. There is free wi-fi in the rooms. The only complaint is that at night the receptionist is not always there. We had to wait outside for a few minutes since the door was locked when the front desk is not available. If they want to take a break, they should at least put a doorbell outside so they know when guests are waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Euroguyz
Reviews.Content: From the welcome to the time we left we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. One of us speaks French and one doesn't and the staff explained everything to us twice - once in French and once in English so I didn't have to translate! They were really helpful throughout our stay - especially when the in-room safe crashed and the Hotel Manager fixed it really quickly. The rooms are quite small -as is quite common in hotels in Paris from our experience, but we didn't spend that much time there with all that Paris has offer. The bed was comfy and there was ample storage for a short stay. The en suite bathroom was well stocked with toiletries etc each day with a really good shower and the slippers were a nice touch (even though we didn't use them). Breakfast is typical continental fare with plenty of choice - cereals, pastries, toast, cold cuts and cheese, yogurts, juice and fresh fruit salad - more than enough to fuel you up for a day sightseeing. The hotel is quite close to Rue des Boulets Metro station (Line 9) but Nation (Lines 1,2,6 and 9 and RER Line A) is only 5 minutes walk away and the RER Line A stops is much quicker for getting into central Paris. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephy66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum in late August. We booked two single rooms and got two double rooms - not sure if they have actual single rooms but we were very happy. The rooms were very very clean, well decorated and had everything you need. Tea and coffee, fridge with complimentary water, slippers, nice toiletries. It had it all. We were on the top floor and had a little balcony which was nice to look out over. My room didn't have masses of floor space but it was ok for just me, my mum's had more room to move about. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice - the boiled eggs confused me but maybe i'm just a little bit stupid. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and the restaurant list was very useful. We went to two and they were both great. The location was good. Very near to the metro and the RER at Nation. It was very quiet and a few places were shut due to being August so I'm not sure what its like when everything is open. We found it very quiet at night. I will definitely be back, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: eric m
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais is a superb hotel. I felt spoilt by the staff and the owner from the moment I checked in to the moment I left. It is well served by the metro system and not far from lovely Marais. I recommend this hotel to anyone that want to have a special stay In Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice, thanks to TripAdvisor's reviews”
Reviews.Author: Yesichula
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Paris, my husband and I were there for 4 days... I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and I am glad I did. I have been to hotels in Spain, Italy and France before and I will have to say that this is the best hotel I have stayed at in Europe... I will think that if you compared it with others in Europe it could be 4 star not 3... the hotel is smaller than what we are use to in North America but its large enough for two people. We paid a bit extra to be in the priviledge room, please do that, you will be happy you did... The room was very clean, I loved all the small details such as the decor, the fridge and the flat screen TV... we were not in our room a lot but we were happy to arrive there after a day of walking and touring Paris. The people at reception are very helpful 2. Overall I recommend this hotel, please keep in mind that the hotel in not close to all the touristy areas but the metro is probably 5 minutes walking...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, friendly and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: SenZen
Reviews.Content: After reading most reviews on this hotel I had some misgivings, but I have only good things to say about it: - Modern, comfortable rooms with good beds, good showers (mine had a jacuzzi bath tub), free fast wifi internet access. - Efficient, friendly staff; the day manager in particular impresses as he helps all guests going through the reception. - Good location, near the Nation metro / RER station. - Good breakfast. Coffee, croissants and Caprice des Dieux, what more could anyone want? There's also fruit, eggs and cereal for those set in their ways. Room 1 next to the reception can get a little noisy (well it would, in spit of the hotel's best efforts to soundproof that part), but as this was a last minute reservation and we were really looking forward to a comfortable bed and a good shower after sweating for a week in Provence I honestly can't see it as a negative.

Reviews.Title: “manager/owner extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: nzli
Reviews.Content: The room was small and noisy but the bed was comfortable i should say. the manager was so rude,I asked him about some hair conditioner and he said you are paying 125 euro per night what do you expect!!!!!! and he expect me to clean his hotel room az he mailed me that may room was not clean enough when I checked out!!!!! I can't believe that any one says this hotel has friendly staff!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AniaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel! The rooms are a bit small - but exactly the size that I would expect for central Paris. The rooms are very modernly decortared and very clean. The breakfast the hotel provided was great - there was coffee, tea, and juices; a variety of breads, cheeses, and meats; fruit, and cereals. The hotel's location was great for us - so close to the Nation metro stop which serves quite a few Metro lines as well as the RER. The neighborhood is relatively quiet for Paris, but there is no shortage of cafes nearby (especially around the Place de Nation). I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High tripadvisor ranking well deserved”
Reviews.Author: Frankay1ists
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed and the GHF for 4 nights in late July/ early August. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was wonderful from Zyed to the gentleman from Lyon working the night shift. They were very helpful, friendly and down to earth. The last two nights of our stay were we upgraded to a suite which was a very nice touch. The room the first two nights was quite small compared to North American standards but that is the norm for Paris. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the little things are what makes this hotel a gem. We stayed 2 nights then travelled to Dublin and then went back to Paris for two nights and they let us store some of our luggage there for two days which really helped us. The front desk let us use their wine glasses so we could sample Parisian wine without using plastic cups, they lent my fiancÃ© a voltage adapter because she forgot hers and they also lent us a wine opener to use for our entire stay. The slippers that come with the room are also a very nice touch as is the shampoo that is in the bathrooms, you can actually use it unlike other hotels I have stayed at. The breakfast in the morning was outstanding, simple yet everything you need to start your day in a meaningful fashion. The location to me is probably the best part of staying at the GHF. Some people might look at being outside of the main part of the city as a negative but to me it allowed us to get away from the hassle and bustle of sightseeing, it allowed us to enjoy suburban Paris and also let us see another part of Paris we normally would not have seen. GHF is a 5 minute walk to Nation station, which gives you access to EVERYTHING in Paris from the Eiffel tower, to the airport to Notre Dame, everything can be accessed from this station. The metro is very easy to use, it looks overwhelming on a map but is actually very simple to use. If you are planning a trip to Paris, this is the place to stay; we hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: GirlfromtheNorth
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about this hotel we weren't at all apprehensive in booking a 3 night stay for our trip to Paris. It was great to be welcomed by a very friendly receptionist, who was very happy to speak English (even though we tried hard with our school french !), check us in efficiently, then provide us with maps and information on where best to go for our evening meal. Such a different 'reception' to the last hotel we stayed in when visiting Paris some years ago. The area is great; it is a non-touristy area, with some great restaurants (Les Galopins!) its only a few minutes walk to the metro which will take you to the main attractions. When you have done all the hustle and bustle during the day, you can come back to the hotel and it's non crowded streets. That's what we did because we prefered to eat our evening meal in this area, away from the tourists and the tourist prices. Our room was a standard double and was very small, very clean, with brilliant air conditioning. The breakfast was nice, with a good selection of pastries. Great start to the day! We enjoyed seeing the show "How to become a parisian in one hour" http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Attraction_Review-g187147-d1853199-Reviews-How_to_become_parisian_in_one_hour-Paris_Ile_de_France.html Which is at the Theatre de la Main d'Or, a 15 minute walk from the hotel! We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would certainly recommend it - we would say though, if you can afford the extra, get a larger double room!

Reviews.Title: “Freindly and helpful staff. Rooms small. Metro nearby.”
Reviews.Author: theogri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a random getaway. I didnt spend too much time looking for a room but the place met expectations for all the reviews on TA. Nice clean rooms but rather small. Had breakfast in the basement which is also a bit small. I would stay again, knowing the size of rooms I might try for a bigger one. Metro 2 mins away. The hotel gave me a list of local restuarants, we went across to a fish restuarant across the street it was great. Forget the name but the staff would point you in the right direction. View from 5th floor room was of across street chimney pots. OK but not exactly picturesque. Doesn't matter as Paris has enough pretty views elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Service, well located, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: patristain
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very good and kind service from all the Staff members (really outstanding compared to other hotels in Paris), nice room (recommend the "Privilege Room" with 2 balconies, nice bath with good amenities, ipod speakers), free internet service Cons: the elevator did not work during our stay (but they were so kind to carry our loggage to our room) it really worth, and we will come back shortly.. Prices 110-250 euros

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel; Great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: coolteacher_2000
Reviews.Content: Spent the last full week in July here; our first trip to Paris. As others have described: the bedroom and bathroom have been nicely renovated and they were absolutely spotless. Room size appears to be within the norm for Europe. Rooms have all the amenities: air, safe, fridge, wall-mounted flat screen tv, phone, wardrobe, desk, luggage rack, hair dryer. While there wasn't an ironing board and iron, they will do your laundry (we had ours washed and dried for free - please do remember service like this deserves a good tip). Although the hotel is physically nice, it is the STAFF that makes it exceptional! The front desk is manned 24/7 and the people there couldn't be nicer...they truly understand the concept of customer service. They want you to enjoy your stay; not only in their hotel but in their city as well. Restaurant recommendations, metro routes, anything; just ASK and they burst forth with information. Example: Tired of the sightseeing crowds, upon returning to the hotel one afternoon, I said as much and asked Ludivine (who is absolutely stellar!) to recommend a neighborhood we could just wander around in the next day. Well, she gave us a map and said we would like the Promenade of Plants (I think that's what the translation is). We spent most of the next day walking the neighborhood and discovering this wonderfull park that goes on forever and certainly wasn't in the guide book. That walk and the Musee D'Orsay were my favorite Paris 'to do's" of the entire visit. (Merci, Ludivine!) The Hotel is located on a main boulevard. The wide sidewalks are lined with businesses and cafes, and patisseries abound alongside ATMs and pharmacies. (Please do try Cafe Bonal one block up the street toward Nation station. The English there is limited but quite sufficient, the food very good, prices reasonable, staff friendly and helpful; all in all, a nice place to have a bite or a glass of wine or beer and just enjoy the neighborhood.) Close by are two metro stations, one of which is a major hub. Traveling by Metro is easy to do and the staff at the hotel desk can explain it if you have any questions. We found buying a "carnet" of tickets (10 tickets) as needed worked the best for us but you may want a metro pass. Taking Zyad's advice (I believe he is the manager and who also advised my husband about returning to the airport and then made the arrangements for us), we bought tickets for the BAtobus which travels up and down the Seine with on-and-off privileges. From the BAtobus stops you can visit the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre, etc. Would highly recommend this vs the expensive dinner cruises. Oh, the breakfast at the hotel is varied: meats, cheeses, croissants, rolls, toast, eggs to be boiled, coffee, tea, juices, cereals, yogurt cups. Patience (the woman who takes care of both the breakfast room and you) keeps it well stocked so that it doesn't matter what time you come down to eat, nothing has "run out". (Another example of the great staff: On our last morning there we needed to check out before breakfast started and the young man at the desk went down and brought up croissants/rolls and orange juice for us and offered to make us coffee. When I asked for some napkins to wrap up a couple of croissants in, he went back downstairs and brought back another two already tucked into the napkins.) So, did I mention how GREAT the staff is? You can not come or go without being greeted by them. And I mean in a sincere way (as opposed to a "want fries with that" way). My husband mentioned I wasn't feeling well one day. The next day when we passed the desk, they asked after my health. On another occasion after getting metro directions to Monmarte, they inquired about our trip when we returned much later that day. It was that way during the entire stay and no, we weren't their only guests nor did we stand out... I noticed them treating/speaking to all the guests that way. One last mention. If you come across a free public toilet booth/kiosk along the sidewalk don't be afraid to enter. It is completely automated and is sanitized after each use. ( No latrine smell!) During our stay we came across four different ones that we used. All were clean and, thankfully, stocked with toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: Amiralij
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Hotel Francais for 3 nights. The rooms are small but very well equipped and clean and have been renovated recently. comfortable bed and no noise. The breakfast is good. On the minus side; I think the location of the hotel is not the best as it is like 30 minutes walk to Place de la Bastille. Wherever you want to go, you should go by metro, bus... therefore not very suitable choice for the ones who would like to be in the center of everything. When I was reading the reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor I noticed that many reviewers have written highly about the Gentleman on the front desk (day shift) which occurred to me a little far from the reality. To be fair he answered all of our questions and was helpful but not in a way you expect from a hospitality professional. may be he was in a bad mood!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, value, and location...”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais was our second Paris hotel, (our first lodging was the Mercure Porte Orleans for a workshop). From the onset, we were pleased by the staff's professionalism and friendly manner. Unfortunately, our French is very basic, but that was not a problem. (In fact, the staff and management gave us some lessons with humor!) Our room was not large by North American standards, which was no big deal as we were gone for the majority of the day. We enjoyed the complimentary chocolates and red wine, the bar fridge, comfortable bedding, and the large shower head in the bathroom. We were also able to connect with family members without a problem on the internet back in Canada. An important travel bonus is the close proximity to the Paris metro, particularly the Nation station, where we could go to places like the Pere Lachaise cemetery, the Louvre, the Arc de Triomphe, etc., etc., in less than a half an hour. The hotel is located in the 11th district, which is not in the centre of Paris. However, it is fascinating to watch the locals pick up their food in this area, (the boulangeries are amazing!) One last thing to mention is that the hotel does offer breakfast for 12 Euros, which includes dell meats, cheeses, fruit, toast, yogurt, croissants, etc. You also have a choice of cafe noir, or cafe au lait. The cost is reasonable, considering this is the same price one pays for a croisssant, juice, and coffee at a cafe. We would love to return to Paris, and would not hesitate to use this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly, Comfortable, Well-Located, Clean Base for Paris Exploration”
Reviews.Author: RandoPolo
Reviews.Content: We started our recent honeymoon at this cute and comfortable mini-hotel. We were totally happy with our stay and it was exactly as the reviews on Trip Advisor had led us to expect. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful (not typical Parisian qualities!) and our room was small but very clean, well-appointed, organized and comfortable. Ours was the "privilege double" and it had a great corner balcony looking down onto the street. It's small, for sure, but my wife and I each had a medium-sized suitcase and a handbag and we found the room totally functional. Flat screen TV, safe, great shower, perfect air conditioning. The hotel even set up a chilled bottle of champagne on our arrival because they knew it was our honeymoon. Nice touch. The hotel is located outside the hub of touristy Paris which we liked a lot. There are closeby subway stations and since the Paris underground is so well-developed, it was very very easy to get anywhere we wanted quickly and smoothly. Subway is definitely the way to get around Paris. There is not really anything to see or do and not much to eat very near the hotel, so expect to only be in the area to sleep and rest. The only thing we weren't too excited about was the breakfast option. It is served in a tiny room in the basement and it is quite expensive. We didn't even try it and found breakfast away from the hotel once we started our day. We would certainly stay at this hotel again without hesitation. We didn't have a single complaint and felt the Grand Hotel Francais was a perfect start to our vacation. For the price you will have a very hard time finding anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but rude concierge on July 13 night”
Reviews.Author: beverley_atkinson
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice, clean and close to the metro. Very few restaurants in the area so if you stay here I'd reccomend a Paris Metro visitors pass. We scheduled our holiday to be in Paris for Bastille Day, July 14th. We asked the concierge on the night before what time we should eave to see the parade. In French he answered what parade, I know of no parade. I asked him about the events for the next day. He very rudely stated again in French, I know of no events. luckily an English guest sitting in the lobby gave us directions and the time tables.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: jpesh2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and it was great. Very friendly staff and the rooms are clean & good. Certainly will return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but great location and spotless”
Reviews.Author: JaneKirby
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel great value for money in the height of summer, with good customer service. The location is good, just minutes away from the Metro to whizz you quickly to all the sights of Paris. There are lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood if you just want to stay near the hotel on a couple of evenings. Rooms are tiny (this is Paris after all) but are well kitted out with proper duvets, flat screen TVs and spotless bathrooms. The shower is v small, so not much room for splashing, but so what? Breakfast was good, with very helpful staff. Plenty of hot drinks, cereals, fruit and choice of breads/croissants. They also did boiled eggs and yoghurts etc. We would definitely recommend this hotel as a good value base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Best price, best bed, best view, best breakfast, best location in the last 7 trips to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Irishwannabe
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the folks that run it. What a great price and really the best breakfast you can get in Paris, at least that we've found. The rooms, we stayed there coming in to town before our adventures in France and we stayed there again for a couple of days before flying home, we so clean, the shampoos, soaps, slippers, everything was so well thought out, and the size was surprising to us - we're used to much smaller rooms. So much character, but you didn't have to sacrifice clean and modern upgrades to still have the character. Thank you so much to the helpful people who work at Grand Hotel Francais. It was like coming home to people that cared about you every day. Oh and the neighborhood! Loved being out by Nation. A great metro to go in any direction from there - so many lines. We were using Gare de Lyon coming and going from Paris so this was just perfect. The only hiccup was Friday evening EVERYTHING in the area closes down because of the Jewish sabbith, but it's a bustling and thriving community on all other days. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is the best in Paris!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidRLSMO
Reviews.Content: When I booked our trip, I used the ratings of fellow travelers to determine where we would go. This hotel exceeded our expectations. Everyone on the staff truly went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The room was very clean, the breakfast was fresh, very European, and plentiful. The rooms are small compared to where I have stayed in the United States, but extremely efficient. The bathroom modern and the shower was impossible to get out of. The sample picture is actually the room we stayed in. This hotel is an 10 minute walk to the Nation underground station and 1 minute to rue des Boulets on the #9 underground. Less than 20 to gare de Nord. Across the street is a grocery and plenty of places to eat moments away.

Reviews.Title: “A good well run hotel slightly out of the centre but well connected by Metro to central paris”
Reviews.Author: MASWScreenwriter
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews. We did not have the budget for a 4 or 5 star hotel so this seemed among the best of the 3 stars. We did not know Paris well so it was clear this hotel was a little away from the centre of things however it seemed well connected. First impressions were good. We were greeted warmly in excellent English. Our standard room (we did not get upgraded but the hotel appeared to be full) was extremely small but did contain everything. The safe was located on the floor of a corner wardrobe and you had to be a bit of a contortionist to use it. The bathroom was tiny but functional. Some hairs from previous occupants were concerning but overall the standards were ok. Front desk staff were unfailing polite and helpful (unusual for Paris?). Breakfast in the small basement room was extremely run and had a reasonable range of food (in a French context...this would not score well on an international scale but it was much better than simply croissants and coffee). The waitress beamed at our meagre attempts to speak French. It was good to feel appreciated. Our room was on the side of the hotel and not too bad re noise. A room on the front might have been much noisier as Boulevard Voltaire is busy. Explore the local streets for relatively non touristy and reasonably priced shops and restaurants. On balance, then, pretty much as we expected. Well connected by Metro and RER, just as described. But it does not say much for Paris hotels that this one is currently ranked 21 out of over 1,000 hotels in Paris. In many other cities it would not have have done as well. Nothing was dreadful (thought the bathroom could have been cleaner) but the room size left quite a bit to be desired even for a large city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Italyl0ver
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the service, location and accommodations. Would return without question. The room was in a great, convenient location. Safe, quiet, the room itself was first rate. Clean, well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: AliJo23
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here. The hotel itself is modern, clean, and well air conditioned. The breakfasts were delicious - tasty pastries, hams, cheeses, boiled eggs, juices, good coffee, etc. We asked for a quieter room and were placed in a room not on the street and was in fact very quiet for the 4 days and nights we stayed there. The room at first felt small, but once we settled in the size really wasn't an issue. The shower is small, but has amazing water pressure - perfect relaxation at the end of a long day of sight seeing. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The front desk staff were also fluent in English. The location is very convenient to a major metro station, but away from the highly touristy areas. It is also near a couple of different groceries and pharmacies. My only complaint is that they do not have an early check in option. After a long red-eye flight from the US, we could've really used the earlier check in, even if just an hour. But that's a small complaint. If this is your price range, I think this is the BEST hotel you'll get in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and rooms, exceptionally helpful and friendly staff, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: fotogeek
Reviews.Content: Our stay has been just over a week, and as crazy as the metro, the RER, and the attractions have been, the GHF has been a quiet, safe and very comfortable refuge to return to at the end of the day. The staff have been chatty, helpful, and very friendly. The rooms are clean, breakfast was great (the lady working in the breakfast room was fantastic), I can't say more than to highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We'd absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jenksoccer21
Reviews.Content: We'd stay here again because... -literally right across the street from the metro, which will take you almost anywhere in Paris -3 minute walk from Nation, the metro that will take you everywhere...including the airport (25 minutes) and Versailles -friendly, English-speaking staff (who will advise you on which metro to take & where to eat, etc.) -perfect-sized room w/ free wi-fi, tv, fridge, & air conditioning -clean -a short walk from the grocery store By the time we got to Paris, I was really sick with a cold/congestion/overall feeling pretty crappy. I knew that I would not be able to explain this at the pharmacy b/c I don't speak any French. The man working at reception was very kind and wrote down in French what I would need to tell the pharmacist about my symptoms. I feel like we got treated really well at this hotel and that they know exactly what to do to make you feel like an important guest. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to be sure they're staying somewhere nice and not in a tourist-trap area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Friendly Hotel Great”
Reviews.Author: DingDongBells
Reviews.Content: Just returned from exhausting weekend in Paris, the hotel is very clean, very friendly, and ideally situated for tube stations, easy to use and 3.40 euro anywhere for 2 people, beer and drinks/coffee in paris is very very expensive, if you want a tip use Macdonalds, nice coffee and cheap. Head receptionist was very friendly and helpful, would stay there again. Another tip, don't sign anything that looks like a petition as they ask for money afterwards, and don't accept any "free" newspapers as again they ask for money all are cons. Train from airport is the cheapest the RER to Gard de Lyon 18 Euros for two people very easy to use takes approx 1 hours with change. Book Eiffel Tower and Louvre on line to avoid huge queue's other tip is go round th back of the louvre and go in through the Carousel de Louvre, you go straight into the bottom by the ticket machines no waiting outside in long queue.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: MSplit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a group of friends. The hotel is small, but reasonable for Paris standards. Room was clean and comfortable. It is the staff that makes the difference for this small little hotel. Very welcoming and helpful, from recommending restaurants and sites to calling cabs and just general pleasant conversation. Area is also pretty central. Subway is a couple of minutes away. Hotel was completely booked during our stay, so reserve ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Any hotel that would take such drastic measures to correct their guestâ€™s problems is worth its weight in gold.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1331
Reviews.Content: Like all of our hotel bookings, my husband and I booked this hotel for 4 nights based solely off TripAdvisor reviews. I emailed the hotel several times with questions and was promptly answered by a friendly staff member each time. We booked several months in advance but were told a balcony was not available, however when we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to a double balcony suite. Like every hotel room in Paris, the rooms at the Grand Hotel Francias are small yet very nicely decorated. On our bed awaited a welcome note, two small bottles of wine and chocolate, a very nice touch! After settling in we noticed our room felt very warm. We happened to be in Paris during a massive heat wave, temperatures spiked over 40 degrees C. The first night in our room was spent waking up several times to douse ourselves in water. We notified the front desk of the uncomfortable temperature level in our room and were told that they had just installed a new air conditioning system, they checked the breaker box on the main level and assured us the system seemed to be running normal but called a repair man just in case. Unfortunately, due to the rare heat wave, a repair man was not available anytime soon. The next two nights, with temperatures rising even higher, our room became almost unbearable. On the third morning we went to talk to the front desk again, upon greeting us, at first, the gentleman met us with marked hostility. Without really letting me get a word in, he informed my husband and I of the following: 1.) They had never had a complaint about the AC system from our room (which is not surprising as we were there during a rare heat wave) 2.) They just installed this new AC system. 3.) His Dr. told him he shouldn't be working in his profession anymore because of the high stress levels. 4.) He would refund us for the previous night 5.) We were welcome to move to another room. All of this as he was dialing the repairman again and banged the phone down in duress. At no time were my husband and I ever mad or upset with this man, in fact we felt bad for him, it was obvious he was extremely stressed and had all sorts of job pressure. My husband and I informed the gentleman that we were not trying to cause any problems, and were not looking for any refunds. We simply wanted to see if we could walk into another room in the hotel to feel its temperature and see if this problem was just in our room, or if every room in the hotel felt that hot. He promptly walked us up to a room on the first floor, as soon as we walked in we were welcomed with a rush of cool air, it was clear our room had a faulty AC unit. We jumped at the chance to move to this room. Later that night upon returning to our new room a note waited for us on the bed informing us that the hotel had refunded our ENTIRE stay with them for our inconvenience. My husband and I were absolutely blown away. At no time did we ever request or expect and type of a refund. The hotel completely took it upon themselves to go above and beyond to correct this problem. My husband immediately walked downstairs and shook the gentleman and to front desks hand to thank him. I would recommend this hotel 100 xâ€™s over to anyone. Any hotel that would take such drastic measures to correct their guestâ€™s problems is worht its weight in gold! On another note, the hotel is slightly out of the main areas but there were two metro stops easily within walking distance. In addition, being slightly further away from the main attractions, you will find some fabulous restaurants near by that arenâ€™t as â€œtouristyâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great. Would stay again. Friendly staff too”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowgirltravels
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here in August 2007. It was my first introduction to Europe and i loved it. It was located centrally for transport. There was a lovely place across the road where we bought yummy pastries. The rooms were clean and comfortable and i can see from the pictures, the rooms have since been updated. The breakfast was nice and everything felt just right. The staff we very helpful and friendly. I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: dweeb123
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais served us very well. Very pleasant staff in this relatively small hotel which was excellent value for money. Although not centrally located, local Metro (Nation) is nearby. Breakfast is serve yourself continental down in a small basement room, but there is more than enough to choose from and a delightful lady keeping it clean and well stocked. There are small grocery stores about â€“ a boulangerie opposite and several good restaurants within easy walk. Look forward to staying here again during future Parisian visits.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Reisby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and very comfortable. We enjoyed our stay. The hotel manager was a great help and offered some much needed advice. The staff were friendly and the breakfast filling. It is located close to Nation station that offers access to the train and several metro lines. Voltaire were it is located is beautiful. It is close to all the major sites. If I am in Paris again I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to Explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: jennyettim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for three nights at the end of June 2011. The biggest plus about this hotel is its location - it is in a low key part of Bastille, away from all the tourist traps and exorbitant prices, yet thirty metres away from the Rue de Boulets Metro station. Staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast (which was included in our booking) was of excellent quality. Unlike a number of other reviewers on TripAdvisor, we were not fortunate enough to receive an upgrade. We were in a standard double room and found the conditions extremely cramped (to the point that I could not open my suitcase easily). We would strongly recommend booking a larger room if staying for more than one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: catguava99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights and could not have been happier with the breakfast, location, sight-seeing/restaurant assistance, cleanliness of the rooms, and easy laundry help. It was quiet, too! We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No fault to be found!”
Reviews.Author: lizcat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights a few days ago. We were accompanied by our adult sons, so booked two rooms (superior type). We were pleased to be upgraded to their 'Privilege' rooms, which were pleasant corner rooms with three windows and a very large bed. We tested the soundproofing by opening one window - from silence, we went to very noisy - so it works! Reception were always smiling and helpful. They stored our luggage as we arrived at lunchtime. We appreciated the free wi-fi in the rooms. Breakfast was good. There are actually three Metro stations nearby - as well as Rue des Boulets and Nation, you can use Avron. Reception kindly booked us a taxi to Gare du Nord, which turned up on time.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: CorkOwl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great- we booked directly on the hotel's website after reading all the great reviews on trip advisor. We were due to stay for 4 nights but unfortunately our flight was cancelled and we had to cut the trip short by a night. I contacted the hotel by email straight away- afraid that if we didn't turn up the1st night the whole booking would be cancelled. They emailed back very promptly and ensured us our room was reserved. I presumed we would still be charged for the 4 nights due to the late notice but they only charged us for 3 which I thought was very decent of them. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small, but not tiny. The bed was very comfortable and the room has a safe, fridge, decent sized wardrobe with plenty of hangers and a small flatscreen tv with about 30 channels. Bathroom is also small but very clean and modern. The shower is fantastic. We were on the 1st floor so we did hear the rumble of the metro but got used to this very quickly and had no trouble sleeping. The breakfast is lovely- fresh fruit salad, yogurts, meats, cheese, cereals and a variety of breads and croissants. Perfect to set you up for a day of sightseeing. The hotel is located less than 2 mins walk from a metro station - Rue des Boulets and about 7 mins walk from a more central station - Nation. Both can be used to get into more central Paris, and we made good use of our 5 day Paris Visite ticket- for â‚¬50 it includes transport to and from the airport, disneyland, versailles and all city transport inc the metro. The street the hotel is on is lovely with plenty of supermarkets, boulangeries and patisseries nearby. The Pere Lachaise cemetery is about a 10 min walk away and well worth a visit to see the graves of Jim Morrison, Chopin and Oscar Wilde. Next time we go to Paris we will def choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & lovely compact room”
Reviews.Author: josii11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during our honeymoon for 3 nights and from the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome by the lovely staff. They were all very friendly and had excellent English. We were upgraded to a corner room with 2 small balconies which though was quite small had all we needed with high quality decor. Welcome drinks were provided with a bottle of champage and some bottles of mineral water. The bathroom had a bath and shower with lovely toiletries and great water pressure. All spotlessly clean and looked like it had been recently upgraded. The breakfast was served downstairs in the basement breakfast room by friendly ladies who spoke a little English. We ate delicious pastries, baguettes, cheese, yogurt and had freshly brewed coffee and tea. A perfect start to a day of sightseeing in Paris! The hotel was in a good location slightly out of the busy tourist centre but easily accessible by metro. It was walking distance to 2 different metro stations and close to many restaurants, supermarkets and little cafes for even more pastries! We felt quite safe walking to and from the stations even returning at night. Overall the hotel is of excellent quality (if you don't mind quite small rooms) with a very high standard of customer service and we will definitely stay here again if we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJsav12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in mid June for three nights. We chose this hotel based on the numerous positive reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. All of the staff we spoke to were great, and they answered all of our questions. Our room, although small, was actually more spacious than we expected! It was very clean, modern, and comfortable. Our room also had a refrigerator and safe, which was nice. We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning, and we were happy with it, although it was a bit spendy (12 euro per person). For cheaper breakfast, there is a market directly across the street which is convenient for breakfast food, snacks, and drinks. I would say the location is good, but not great. It's relatively close to the historic center of Paris, but not really within walking distance. However there are two metro stops that are very close. The hotel also offers free laundry service, which was great! We dropped our laundry off in the morning, and it was folded and sitting on our bed that same afternoon. This saved us from doing laundry the rest of our trip. I would highly recommend the Grand Hotel Francais to everyone, as long as you realize you will not be able to walk to many sights and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickleed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais in Paris from June 1 â€“ June 6th, 2011. We had a wonderful stay there. The front-desk service was very friendly and helpful. They spoke to me in French and English â€“ whichever I preferred. The nearby restaurants they recommend were wonderful. The bed was very comfortable and spacious. The room was small but thatâ€™s to be expected in Europe. We had a balcony on the 2nd floor above the street and one of my favorite meals in Paris was eating cheese, sausage, and baguettes on our balcony and watching the Parisians parallel-park and double-park below. I read one review where they said it was noisy, but we were on the 2nd floor facing the street. When the balcony door was shut we did not hear any street noise at all. This is very much a local neighborhood w/patisseries, charcuteries, and bakeries nearby. The breakfast buffet is very tasty and the staff incredibly friendly. The only possible downside we saw was that the hotel is a long way from most of the tourist sites. However, the metro is only a block away and it is incredibly easy, efficient, and inexpensive. We were easily able to get everywhere we wanted. I would highly recommend this hotel and if we ever go back to Paris we would want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....”
Reviews.Author: Gary4444
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a very good location literally a minute to a Metro station,and very close to a variety of shops,including bakeries,supermarkets and cafes. The staff were extremely friendly and helfull with travel,tips, on where to eat, and what to say if your French is limited..The room itself was quite small, but that is typical for Paris i am informed,despite the size, we had every convenience including a great shower,complimentary soft drinks etc,but oddly there was no access to an iron,the staff though arranged for my shirts to be ironed for me free of charge....the room was spotless and was also soundproofed, and the bed very comfortable,the towels were good quality as was the bed linen.. The staff though are a real pleasure to deal with and very attentive,the management even gave my wife complimentary champaigne as it was her birthday. If you are looking for a good clean friendly and comfortable hotel with easy access to the metro..which is a must.... this is it !!! We will be back.....hopefully soon...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katiebugtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. Traveled to Paris with my three teenage daughters. The rooms were clean and lovely. The location was perfect. Close to great shopping and the Metro. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel staff recommended some incredible restaurants. The hotel staff was able to get reservations at some impossible to get into restaurants. I was surprised at how friendly everyone we met in Paris was. I heard the French were generally rude to Americans. That was not the case in this hotel or anywhere else we went. I loved it and would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: saoire1
Reviews.Content: Would definitely use this hotel again- its super clean with well maintained rooms and in our superior rooms, lovely hydro showers- the rooms are small but that's Paris hotels for you. Its close to the Metro and everywhere is easy to get to. As someone who used to live in Paris, I think somewhere like the 11th is much better to really get a sense of the city while still doing the tourist things and you also get much better french food at better rates and surrounded by other french people very easily. On top of all that the staff were very friendly and I felt if you needed any help itinerary planning they would have quickly assisted- In a city where reasonably priced quality accommodation is rare- this is the one to pick!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisTraveller07
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here with my parents and girlfriend. We had two rooms both facing the street. Both rooms had balconies. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, especially the manager (well, I think he was the manager). The rooms were very clean and modern (very nice bathrooms, in particular). With the balcony doors closed we heard virtually no noise. Yes, the rooms are quite small, but they have all the essentials. The breakfast was good. When we arrived the receptionist provided us with a list of restaurants. We want to two: Les Galopins (good), and the Vin & Maree (excellent). I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be! Take a 3* and have a 4* !”
Reviews.Author: Parejaenviajes
Reviews.Content: Short text: Friendly, clean, stunning rooms, bravo! Long text: I asked for a special room for a special weekend with my partner. We had the best and nicest room abouve the city, with balcony and the moon shining into our room. It is very nice furnished, flatscreen-tv, a brand new shower, brand new bathroom. the bed is a true bed! We even had free high speed internet acces and a ipod/iphone-charge-Station with loudspeakers for free. The hotel is on a Boulevard but the whole building was done in June last year and: We selpt on clouds! They are absolutely friendly, kind and nice, breakfast ist downstairs in a very fresh and friendly room with a good choice of food. That's why we put "exellent" at the item "restaurant". As i know, there is no restaurant inside, but hey: Its in Voltaire Boulevard, in three to five minutes you have a tapas-bar, a wine-bar, a restaurant, a pizza-corner, a kebab-corner and the metro station ist on your right side when you drop out of the door. Thank you, we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends!”
Reviews.Author: flrose
Reviews.Content: We arrived from our overnight flight very early in the morning, so of course our room wasn't ready, but the kind person at the desk checked and tagged our luggage and locked it up for us. We took a walk around the neighborhood and found it to be busy and safe. Two Metro stations, Rue De Boulets and Nation are very convenient and can get you anywhere in the city fast and easy. The room was clean and well appointed as well as quiet and comfortable. Slippers and loofa too!!! The Manager Zyad was incredibly accommodating and so much fun to talk to! Everyone is greeted upon entering and departing the hotel, which is really nice. The breakfast is perfect to start a long day of touring. Mr. Zyad offered suggestions and directions to get everywhere, in perfect English of course! There are lots of places they recommend for dinner...Les Gallopins was wonderful! We have friends that are planning to visit Paris in the near future and we've heartily recommended this hotel to them, primarily because of the cordial and warm treatment by Zyad and his staff! My husband and I are already planning to return and we definitely will return to the Grand Hotel Francais!!! Paris was the highlight of our trip...thank you Zyad for all your kindnesses!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location and helpful people”
Reviews.Author: JoggingScots
Reviews.Content: Very clean and quiet hotel close to Place de la Nation with bars and restaurants close by. Two metro stations just a short walk away so it's easy to get all around Paris. Reception staff spoke English - very helpful. Good breakfast - pastries, fruit, cereal, etc. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploration”
Reviews.Author: Khalie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at the Grand hÃ´tel franÃ§ais and we were very pleased. Staff is awesome, and so is the breakfast. Excellent rapport qualitÃ© prix.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Good Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheBrainiac
Reviews.Content: Mrs B and I found Grand Hotel Francais thanks to the many good reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to book it in large part due to the price. By the time we arrived, the Euro/Dollar rate had reached $1.60+ at some exchange points and we were dreading getting our charge statements on our return to the States. Fortunately, by the time we checked out four days later, the exchange rate had dropped down to $1.40. So we managed to keep our hotel bill at the Grand Hotel Francais at around $200/night. The hotel is located on Blvd Voltaire and is quite close to two metro stops: one to the north a half a block and a major hub (Place Voltaire) about four blocks to the south. Blvd Voltaire can be pretty busy with traffic and the ubiquitous motorcycles can be irritating, but the hotel soundproofing is good. We had a room on the fourth floor facing the street: a nice balcony, a relatively nice view, but a teeny tiny room. The bed filled it up; the TV is on the wall, and a desk was wedged into a corner, so there was very little room even for our two suitcases. The bathroom is modern and the shower was a pleasure. Tip: if you can't fit into an airline seat easily then you won't be able to get through the shower doors! Staff were quite kind and friendly and restrained their laughter when we spoke our choppy French. Unusual for Paris: they didn't lapse into English (which they speak fluently) with a sneer on their face at our first grammatical error. They also had recommendations for Paris sights that many miss -- so ask for a bit of advice if you want to get off the usual Paris tourist track. All in all, we liked Grand Hotel Francais very much, though we prefer to stay in the center of town for the opportunity to spontaneously stroll the streets and drink in the cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookatkatie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in February for our first wedding anniversary - we picked it on the strength of the reviews on TripAdvisor, and were not disappointed! The hotel is really small, as are the rooms, so if you are planning to spend a lot of time in your room this probably isn't for you, but if you want a good base for exploring the city, this is great! Probably not enough room for more than 1 suitcase though..... The hotel manager was very friendly, and speaks perfect english. I spoke in French to him during our stay, which he really appreciated, but if you get stuck they all speak english! The breakfast was simple but great - the dining room is again very small, and in the basement so can seem quite claustraphobic, but has speedy service and nice food. The bathrooms are very small, but done to a really nice standard and are very clean, and the power shower was superb! This hotel is situated between 2 metro stations, and so is a great location for hopping onto a train to go out exploring. I would recommend this hotel to other couples wanting to explore the beautiful city of Paris. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Paris Break”
Reviews.Author: Metterst
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend in Paris and this hotel was excellently placed. Very close to a metro station made getting around easy. There was a warm welcome on arrival and the manager, who seemed to be on all weekend was superb - he recommended a great restaraunt close by http://www.restaurantlechardenoux.com/en which despite being really busy served great food at a reasonable (for Paris) price The hotel was clean and comfortable - fairly recently decorated in a modern style and the deep gloss red ceiling gave an interesting twist on a mirrored ceiling. Yes the room was a little on the small size, but you don't go to Paris to sit and admire the hotel bedroom!! Only down side on the room was that it was on the ground floor and had a small window which was high up due to the road outside rising up behind the hotel making it feel a little dungeon like The hotel only has a small breakfast room , which can be a bit cramped if you hit peak traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: MiztyOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grand Francais for just over a week in May. We are very glad we picked this hotel and it was because of the great reviews on TripAdvisor and reasonable price. The hotel is very small, quiet, clean and well decorated. The desk staff is terrific: friendly, helpful and interested in their guests and they speak fluent English and helped us with our attempts at French in a very friendly manner. The hotel is close to two metro stations. We usually went to Nation but sometimes the Rue de Boulet worked out better for us and it is just a minute or so walk to the hotel from there. Nation is about 5 minutes from the hotel. We had a small room with breakfast included and were happy with our choice. The room was very nicely decorated and clean. Thought had gone in to the organization of the room and this helped so we never felt cramped. There is a safe for any valuables, a small refrigerator for storing any drinks or food items. There was ample closet and cupboard space and the bed was very comfortable. There is free WIFI and the phone call we made home was reasonably priced. Our room was back from the street and very quiet. The nicely appointed breakfast room is downstairs and they have an elevator or winding staircase between levels. The tables were set each morning and they served a quality orange juice, cereal, pastries, fresh fruit salad, yogourt and cheese and meats. We were very happy with the breakfast and a lady was there to assist you and bring hot drinks to the table. When I asked about laundry services, we were told to give our laundry to the woman who looked after breakfast and our clothes were clean and folded on our bed when we returned at the end of the day. There was no cost for the service and we were happy to tip her for doing this task and allowing us more time to visit Paris! The hotel is in a busy neighbourhood and there are lots of little shops, food stores and restaurants in the area. We were able to get some idea about how the people of Paris lived. We met some of the other guests and found out they had picked the hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. Although we needed to use the metro each day to take us to the tourist venues, we were happy to have selected this hotel. The desk staff is very helpful with travel plans, selecting restaurants, etc. The young lady who worked at the desk, even mailed my postcards for me on her way home from work. There were many little personal touches that made this a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Second time is even better”
Reviews.Author: monkeyFUZ
Reviews.Content: Ok, So I can't say enough about this hotel. When we checked in they remembered us from our stay a year ago! They are so nice and friendly and helpful! When we entered our room there was a half bottle of Champagne and chocolate and a note welcoming us back! Great food recommendations too. Le Galopin is great! I'm already think up ways to go back to Paris next year and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - but Americans, be advised that this is NOT like our hotels.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMelissa04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in celebration of our 15th wedding anniversary. The location of this hotel is not bad - not right in the heart of things, but less than half a block from a metro station, so getting around is not a problem. The building is beautiful on the outside, and modern and sophisticated on the inside. I would recommend this hotel. However, I would like to disclose some information so that travelers are aware. Breakfast is included, but coffee is NOT. And it is like $2 a cup, no refills. Not awful, but not what some might be used to [like Free coffee - all day long!! Or at least refills!!]. Americans, we are used to hotels with large rooms and amenities galore. This is not such a hotel. This is a historic building which has been renovated beautifully, but the rooms are very, VERY small. I am 5 feet tall, and even I found them small. The shower stalls are teensy-weensy, to the point where I [at 5 feet tall, mind you!] was knocking my elbows at every turn. My 5'11" husband managed okay, but he is skinny and agile. Anyone overweight would have serious issues with the showers. The blowdryers are very weak - bring your own. Also, note that, late at night when the streets are quiet but the metro is still running, you can hear the metro rumbling underground. The sound is not loud, it is subtle, but it is there. Note that they do not provide irons. I made the clerk upset by requesting one and, when he said they did not provide them but did provide ironing on request, I inquired why. Basically, it's a fire hazard and some people didn't turn them off. Though I understand this, it is not in my nature [middle-class American] to have other people iron my clothes and I certainly did not want to have to tip someone to do something I would happily have done myself. I went along with it and did not tip. We were on a budget, and to me, an iron is a very basic amenity. At any rate, the night before checkout, the clerk kindly helped me print out our boarding passes, but for some reason there was a problem with one and I had to try again the next morning right before leaving. The next morning, there was a new clerk, one I hadn't seen on our 5 day trip, and he was pretty huffy about my request to try to print our other boarding pass. Instead of looking it up on the super-speedy desk computer the clerk was using, he handed me a very old laptop and plug. He did not tell me where to plug in, etc. He did not apologize for not helping me, nor give me any information or pointers. I handed it back to him and said forget it. Overall the service was great, but this particular older gentleman was not very kind.

Reviews.Title: “I'm so happy to have discovered this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ToastAloha
Reviews.Content: Believe all that you have read about it in the posted reviews. It's a lovely, small hotel located in a quieter section of Paris. The metro (Rue de Boulets) is a 2 minute walk out the door which links you to the rest of the city very easily. The rooms a spotless and typical for European sized room/toilets. Breakfast is very adequate to start your day and convenient. Others might want to eat elsewhere for less however I found it to be just enough to get me going until mid day. The staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating. We arrived at 7:30 in the morning after a long and exhausting plane flight. We were offered breakfast right away and even though check in time is at 2:00pm, we were in a room (which they upgraded to a superior) by 10:00am. We were so appreciative in being well taken care of from the start. The surrounding Avenue Voltaire has a number of cafes, bakeries, grocery store, pharmacy, ATM machines, Metro access, and small boutiques within a very, very short walking distance. It's so convenient. We had planned doing some laundry prior to leaving. When I asked about a laundry facility I happily discovered that thet do it for you....without a fee. How surprising is that! It was great to return from our last day touring Paris finding all of our clean clothes folded neatly on my suitcase. Would we come back to this hotel again? Absolutely. It has been a wonderful stay with all we needed provided perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Rescue”
Reviews.Author: jamesholman
Reviews.Content: Upon getting into Paris we were guided to our hotel that was recommended through Laterooms.com....It was utterly dreadful. We phoned up a few hotels and all were either overpriced or full. We went onto tripadvisor as a last resort on the phone and found this little gem of a hotel. The Manager and receptionist were VERY helpful and even gave us a discount on our room. The room was clean and well presented with all the necessary mod cons. The shower was awesome as were the little slippers we got with the room. The breakfast was ideal although a bit repetitive but it was just what you need for a day out in Paris. If you need anything there chances are they can help you out. We will be staying again :) Oh yea the mattresses are good too that and the black out curtains make you sleep like an angel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: Island-Guy-47
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights. Location is about 15 minutes from downtown (by metro or RER). As can be expected in Paris, rooms are quite small, but comfortable and very clean. Very friendly staff, always keen on assisting you with any information you may be looking for. The hotel is set on a relatively quiet boulevard, and windows have double-glazing: nevertheless, you cannot prevent some motorcycles to race down the boulevard, and you may hear a bit of noise (nothing major, do not worry).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a lovely traditional Parisian area.”
Reviews.Author: meg_m2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel, was wonderful, yes it was small, but it was very comfortable. The bed was one of the most comfiest beds Ive slept in, and the power shower (emphasis on the word power) was supberb. The hotel staff were one of the nicest Ive came across, always a smile on there face, always willing to help. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel, so cant comment on that. We did infact, go to a lovely bakery just a few minutes walk from the hotel and had pastarys galore, very cheap prices. The station 'Nation' is one of the main stations in Paris and had access to many different lines including 'RER A' which gets you to disneyland. The metro is very easy to use, we found we used Line 1(yellow line) the most, this will get you to many of the main stops in Paris. I will most definitly return to this hotel, when I next come back to Paris. I loved the traditional feel to this neighboorhood. I read on a recent review about homeless in the gazebo by Nation. Yes, I seen this, but they did not bother us atall. I did not once feel intimadated here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: medicmandy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel after a long trip in Europe. The hotel is renovated beautifully and the staff are so very friendly and helpful! It was very refreshing to stay in a beautiful and comfortable hotel that was afforable. Extremely close to two metro stations and the breakfast was fantastic. I would recommend anyone travelling to Paris to stay here! Free WiFi as well!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Paris Delight”
Reviews.Author: cajones
Reviews.Content: For us, the Grand Hotel Francais could not have been a more perfect fit. Superb and friendly service, spotless accommodations and a neighborhood locale that offered a real glimpse of Paris. As for the reviews commenting on "small rooms" - Sorry, this is silly tourist talk. It's Paris! The rooms were not large, but very comfortable even with a prodigious assortment of luggage. They are contemporary in design and very, very clean. As for the neighborhood, it's an ethnic area with everything that one could ask of the Paris experience from restaurants to bakeries to sidewalk cafes and men playing bocce. I read one review about "homeless" and "dog poop" on the sidewalk. Again, it's Paris! Ever been to New York? Not once did we feel intimidated, uncertain or scared. Far from it, we enjoyed the decidedly non-touristy feel of a true Parisian neighborhood. If you want the plastic tourist stuff , I'm sure you can find it elsewhere in Paris and at a much higher price. Whether you need the Metro or a bus, everything is very close. But, you may want to spend more time close to your hotel because whatever the managers recommend, do it. Their restaurant picks were spot-on. In all, if you want manufactured ambience and Sheraton "style" go elsewhere. We found a real jewel in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: PHFerreira78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at Grand Hotel Francais. It was a perfect experience. The hotel is great: very friendly staff (thank you Ziad and Co.), delicious breakfast and nice location (near to 2 metro stations, with a charming neighborhood). The room and bathroom are modern, cozy and extremely clean. They have a excellent free wi-fi conection, free laundry service (amazing!) and they suggest you some good restaurants in the hotel area (you must try Le Galopins). Well, if you have a chance to stay at Grand Hotel Francais, in Paris, do not hesitate. They will give you a perfect experience in hotel service and you will enjoy Paris even more. My wife and me highly recommend this hotel and certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Moderately Priced...But...”
Reviews.Author: Louis14221
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais is very friendly, clean, well-appointed with storage and new baths with shower stalls. The staff was great. The breakfast was good, especially since it was included in the price. All in all, a great choice....but..... The neighborhood is safe, yet there are homeless living in the gazebo at the exit of the metro at Place de Nation. There was lots of litter on the sidewalks in this neighborhood and we saw several incidents of dog waste left on the sidewalk. There is also more graffiti on the buildings than you would see in other neighborhoods around the Champs Elysee or the Rivoli/Lourve or Trocadero areas. For the seasoned traveller, especially a traveller who had been to Paris, this hotel offers a clean, comfortable stay. The restaurant recommended by the hotel in the neighborhood were great! I would not recommend to a newcomer to Paris, or a single woman. The metro/rail lines are terrific but if one of the lines is down, the traveller may need to take another line that stops in an unsafe area. We did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: OronoStewie
Reviews.Content: A little off the beaten path, but provides a great list of local eateries within walking distance featuring locals as staff and clients. Great food and lots of fun to be had, especially at Galopins. Elevator is slow and the stairs are too steep to climb or descend for most older folk. Rooms are not large, but adequate and very quiet. Staff is helpful and friendly and very tolerant of our poor French

Reviews.Title: “fantastic pick for our paris weekend”
Reviews.Author: Travelmoremadam
Reviews.Content: You do go to paris knowing that rooms are known for being tiny. Albeit tiny though, our room was nice with a very comfortable bed and fantastic showers. The hotel owner was extremely helpful in both english and german to our many many questions and the local restaurants he recommended rounded off the visit well. I would very much recommend it! And a little tip if arriving charles de gaulle - on the way back to the airport we took the local bus 351 from 'nation' which took just under an hour and made the journey very straightforward, i would advise checking it out for bringing you to the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished, clean, convenient for public transport”
Reviews.Author: lianajsteven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a special Mum & daughter (teenager) trip to Paris . We had carefully chosen hotel and it was nicely refurbished, rooms not huge but lovely view out of balcony- very parisien. We were in room 23. Hotel was very clean and bathrooms very fresh. The female receptionist (apologies we can't remember her name) was very friendly and helped us choose a restaurant so my daughter could try escargot (snails). Good helpful advice & map on using public transport. The only bad point was a very heated argument between staff whilst having breakfast. This upset my daughter.
