Overall would recommend if you want a good looking building, with nice clean rooms and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Francais-- where you can find the friendliest Parisians ever!”
Reviews.Author: flipflop2403
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the easter holidays after checking out Trip Advisor reviews. And we were not disappointed. On our arrival, we found a bag of delicious chocolates on our bed as a welcome to Paris easter treat. The room was modern and sparklingly clean. The continental breakfast is lovely. The area was very quiet, not in a touristy area but easy enough to reach the Seine and other famous places on foot. Also very close to a metro station, which is handy. But most important of all, the staffs of this hotel are the nicest, most thoughtful, most helpful and friendliest Parisians I have ever met and for that alone, we will come back to stay in this hotel again. Thank you Grand Hotel Francais for our wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for 4 days and right from the initial email communication until we checked out, everything was excellent! I've stayed in a few hotels in Paris and this has been the best so far. The hotel location was great because it was not in a touristy area but yet was really close to the metro making it simple to get around. All staff were pleasant and very helpful. Breakfast was really good and the rooms were really nice - relatively spacious, recently refurbished with flat-screen tv. Would I recommend this hotel - absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinghubby0
Reviews.Content: Was here just last weekend, and stayed for 4 days. Lovely place and the staff was great. The neighborhood has nice bistros and restaurants near by. Definitely an area where locals live. Nation Metro stop is a 6 min walk away and can get you to the tourist areas in 20mins max. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CaraTaylor
Reviews.Content: I booked the Grand Hotel Francais, after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, to celebrate my birthday. We were not disappointed at all. The hotel is in a lovely area of Paris within easy reach of the metro. There are plenty of very good restaurants/bars within walking distance, not least Le Galopins (amazing !!). The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff are welcoming, friendly and very helpful. The hotel manager was extremely kind leaving wine and chocolates in the room and even giving us a complimentary breakfast for my birthday. All much appreciated. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and am very much looking forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average Parisien 3 star”
Reviews.Author: WillOnTheHill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the Friday and Saturday night just gone, the May Day weekend, in a room at the back of the top floor. Having stayed in Paris quite a few times over the years, whilst we agree with many reviewers that it is certainly a lot nicer than the average three star, we may have been a little bit disappointed after so many fantastic reviews. So certainly donâ€™t let us put you off staying here as it is very nice, but it isnâ€™t a â€œwowâ€� destination per se. The front desk were always very friendly and check in was really friendly. We didnâ€™t need to ask for special advice, so canâ€™t comment on that. The room was very small, and having stayed in lots of European capital citiesâ€™ hotel rooms that have been pretty small, this room I would say was really very small, with very little room either side of the bed or in the bathroom, which consists of a shower cubicle, basin and WC in a small, thin room. Having said this, the bathroom finish and fittings are really quite high-end and the shower was particularly luxurious and above three star standard. However, whilst not terrible, it wasnâ€™t â€œspotlesslyâ€� clean in the bathroom. There is a metro stop right across the road, although if you use this one, you will need to change for most of the lines that go more central, so we found it was easier to the take the five minute or so walk to Nation, where there are heaps of lines to choose from. It wasnâ€™t however a bad journey from Gare du Nord if you travel on the Eurostar, to the stop across the road. We agree with many reviewers that it was nice to be somewhere quieter and less touristy, but for some reason all of the cafes and restaurants in the are seemed to be shut on Friday and Saturday (but open from the Sunday) and from my dodgy French from the signs I think perhaps most of the local places had shut for a period over Easter, so we didnâ€™t really get that same nice local feel (which we got for example when we went to some other parts of Paris, we were on a bit of a â€œnon-touristy parts of Parisâ€� mission), just a bit dead really, but again I imagine this is not normally a problem. Wifi was fine and easy to connect to, and the continental breakfast had higher quality cheeses and selections of bread/pastries then you would normally get in a 3 star, but again, I wouldnâ€™t especially rave about breakfast. Overall, friendlier and nicer than the average three star, with a better than average continental breakfast, with reasonable transport links, small rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: Welles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for eight nights and wanted a home base, with breakfast, that was clean, safe, relatively inexpensive, and convenient to transit. We got all that, and great service from the manager. He was very friendly and had lots of terrific advice on what to see and where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris Away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: rhyenblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night here on a stopover from London before taking the night train to Venice. The cute hotel is located on the Boulevard Voltaire close to the Nation Metro/RER stop. Upon arrival we were greeted in French and English by the accommodating host. She welcomed us, discussed the area, and made some recommendations for dinner. The hotel has a nice lobby and there is an elevator that accommodates two people or one person and a large bag. We stayed on the second floor which had a wrap around balcony. The dÃ©cor is very modern and the rooms were very clean. The room and bathroom were on the small side but designed thoughtfully and accommodated all of our needs including two large suitcases. There is a grocery store and a bakery directly across the street. Bercy train station is about a 7 minute taxi ride away. There is an optional paid morning breakfast offered downstairs. In the morning the gentleman upfront kindly stored our luggage securely upon checkout as our train did not leave until 6pm. The Grand Hotel Francais is a great hotel with a great staff. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Zyad, 5 star hotel manager!”
Reviews.Author: rbux
Reviews.Content: If you want the absolute best Paris has to offer, try the Grand Hotel Francais. Many other hotels in Paris may be adequate, but what makes this particular establishment so terrific is the manager.....Zyad. He is the friendliest, most welcoming and all around helpful person, and he speaks about a dozen languages. He helped us with a serious IT issue (we couldn't log on to the internet due to a difficult problem), he provided endless advice on where to go, what to see, how to get there, where to eat (even making us dinner reservations); as we were reluctantly checking out of the hotel, he was making an espresso coffee for a couple just checking in. He is a bundle of never-ending hospitality and energy and he will make your stay n Paris an exceptional one. He also wants people to know (despite his lovely wife and adorable children) he considers himself the S-E-X-I-E-S-T man in Paris! You will be extremely satisfied if you choose his hotel, and we recommend that you do so...you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look further - this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SDPoulin
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel and fabulous staff. First visit to Paris and we could not have been more satisfied with this hotel and its location. Rooms were clean, comfortable,and well apportioned. Staff gave us tips on local culture and local dining. The neighborhood was quaint with exceptional bistros and cafes. Hotel was also very convenient to main line of metro system. I would return to this hotel without reservation. I am indebted to the hotel and its staff for making my visit to Paris with my wife all that we hoped and more - romantic, convenient, polite, and simply joyous. Don't miss this hotel - you'll regret not staying here. This hotel has my strongest personal recommendation - and I can be pretty high maintenance according to my lovely bride!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jceby2002
Reviews.Content: Zyad at the front desk and Patience (sp?) in the breakfast room are two reasons Iwe will come back to Grand Hotel FranÃ§ais!. Great room (we were upgraded from Superior to Privilege). For the price, probably the best hotel in Paris! Zyad was very helpful making sure we knew where we were going, how to get there, and when to avoid lines. It really is a great way to start your vacation when you walk into your room and smile! Near a moajor metro stop (Nation) and a lesser stop (nice to have line choices).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Polly-Anna56
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor I was looking forward to my stay at the Grand Hotel Francais. My husband and I travel to Paris regularly and usually stay at another small hotel but I decided to make a change this time. And I am certainly glad I did. The hotel staff were most welcoming and exceptionally helpful. The rooms (I stayed in March for 2 nights and returned in April for 1 night) were a good size for a small hotel and provided all the amenities for a comfortable stay. Located on an attractive wide Parisian boulevard, the hotel is very convenient. Only a few minutes to the Metro and to Place de la Nation. I would not hesitate to recommend Grand Hotel Francais. All in all a most satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a real treat!!”
Reviews.Author: jenben66
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8pm after travelling and sightseeing all day in Paris. The gentleman at the desk looked genuinely pleased to see us, and was just very welcoming. He upgraded us to a junior suite and the room was just lovely overlooking the street, with luxuries like slippers, ipod docking station. The bed and bedding was super luxury, clean and was wonderful to fall into. the power shower was fantastic. We were recommended a french restaurant 2 streets away so we could walk. "le Gallopin" - what an amazing authentic place to go. We had a "slab" of the most tender beef we have ever had in a vibrant friendly atmosphere. the sleep was great, after our french wine, and we have to give this rating 5 star plus. we will definitely go there again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: antrimman
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean and top-notch attention from front-desk staff. Rooms are small as mentioned but perfectly fine for a short stay. It is more like a small four star hotel, than a three star. Fast wifi. We were able to leave our bags for the final day of our stay while we explored the city and were kindly offered toilet facilities where we returned to pick them up so we could freshen up before leaving for home. Would happily recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tink944
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have both been to Paris a number of times and stayed all over the city. This place defies nearly every stereotype that I can think of about Paris hotels! The staff are amazingly friendly. In a Parisian hotel less than 200 Euro per night, I usually expect staff that grunt when you come & go and get very annoyed if you come back late at night and expect to be let into the hotel. All the staff here were quick to greet us and the guy on reception at night wasn't annoyed that we came in late - he even offered us a coffee! The shower here was better than expected. I've stayed in hotels in Paris with little or no hot water and a trickle of water disguised as a shower. The shower here was hot & had good water pressure. We were in one of the smaller rooms and had only a shower, not a bath but the shower was fantastic so we never noticed the lack of bath. This hotel not only has a WIFI connection that worked every time we logged in - it was included in the room price! A great selling point for a hotel in ant big city. Breakfast was served until 10.30 - later than lots of other places I've stayed. The food was standard continental - breads, cheese, cold meats, cereal, yogurt, fruit. Everything was fresh and was replenished as needed. The sheet of local restaurant recommendations from the Hotel is good as well. Le Petit Panisse has great food and was good value for money. Not sure if they have menus in English though! This was on the hotel's list of recommendations and our friends who live in Paris knew it and booked a table. We didn't want to stay in the heart of tourist land and this location was great in that respect. Nearest metro was over the road - about 1 minute walk. About 5 minutes in either direction you could get to either Nation or Faidherbe Chaligny metro stations - it took us about 20 minutes to FDR metro station for the Champs-Elysee so it's easy to find the tourist spots if you want them. The worst thing I can say - not that it's bad - is that the room was small. Paris is notorious for small rooms and this is the one stereotype that applies here. That said, we had enough room for 2 people & 2 cases - but only just! Overall I'd definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and Comfortable in good location”
Reviews.Author: scLoves2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights of our honeymoon at the start of March. I booked based on reviews I had read on Tripadvisor and certainly wasn't dissappointed. The rooms, although small, were very clean and comfortable and very modern looking. Free wifi was fast. Front desk staff were very friendly, and the location, although not in the middle of the more touristy areas, was very convenient as it had two metro and 1 RER station within 5 minute walk. We quite liked that the area was a bit quieter than other parts of paris, and had a more local feel... although this meant we struggled to find a place to eat breakfast (cause we wanted more than a coffee and croissant). Overall we really enjoyed this hotel and would definately stay again if we are ever in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay - felt part of the local paris scene rather than a tourist”
Reviews.Author: lizzie3010
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay in Paris. Room was small, boutique feel. Breakfast enough to set you up for the day. Lots of local restaurants near by. Two metro stops within in easy walking distance. No tea/coffee making facilities in room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MHTO72
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights; could have not been more pleased with the choice! In the past have paid the same or more for a decent enough hotel but Grand Hotel Francais was a real find. The hotel is well located (metro line 9 takes you to all the sights or within a walking distance); the staff were very friendly; the rooms were clean and comfortable but like in any big city, space is at premium so do not expect large rooms. Breakfast was included which was bit basic but left more room to sample the delights of culinary Paris and it was enough to set you for the day. Lots of places to eat near-by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheSternTom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was OK. The staff very very nice and helpful and the rooms nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, but Great Service = Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SpikeMeister226
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for 3 nights during the volcanic airport shutdown in April 2010. I had intended to travel to the Loire Valley, but a two-week long rolling train strike prevented me from traveling there. Returning from a couple of dayes in Lyon, I needed a place to stay in Paris while I waited for the airport to reopen. I chose this hotel based upon recommendations on the TripAdvisor site. Overall, I am extremely pleased with my stay. The hotels is located about 50 meters from the Rue des Boulets metro stop in an untouristy, everyday part of Paris. Although the double-bedded room I had was tres petite (and I do mean very small), it was clean and had modern furnishings and decorations. But what sets this hotel apart is its customer service. When I requested at the front desk about the location of a laundertte, I was told to leave my laudry and that the staff would wash it while they were washing the sheets and towels. I figured that the charges would be added to my bill, so I left it and headed out for a day of shopping and walking around town. When I returned that evening, I found my clothes neatly folded on top of the bed in my room. Later that evening, the front desk manager asked if my laundry was acceptable, and when I enquired as to the charge for the service, he informed my that it was free. I was pleasantly surprised by this, and amazed by the level of service I received. The next day, a colleague told me that the charges for his laundry service (a similar amount of clothes) at the airport Hyatt came to 160 Euros! The service at breakfast was similar. Each morning, the ladies in the breakfast room asked several times what I needed. The price for all of this service was very reasonable: 130 Euros per night including breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable night's sleep and great service at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: tepidhobbes
Reviews.Content: The wife and I recently made our first ever trip to Paris and we booked a week at the Grand Hotel Francais based on the strong reviews of Tripadvisor. Having never been to Paris before, proximity to the metro was a must, and friendly staff was a huge help with the little details of our trip. Upon arrival, we were told by the nice gentleman at the front desk that our room would be upgraded (nice bonus!), and provided us with a map of the city, along with a list of local restaurants that they recommend with descriptions for each. We tried one of those on our 3rd day there, and my wife and I both agreed that it was the most authenticly "local's favourite" restaurant we ate at during our entire trip. The room itself was rather nice, although the view from the third floor didn't really show much other than the street and the building next to us (sort of anticipated that from most places in Paris though). As an added bonus, there were slippers in the room, which was nice for us as we don't normally like walking around in our socks, nor do we like walking barefoot on bathroom floors generally. Also, the staff were very accomodating when we needed to print out our boarding passes (and even when I asked that they delete all of our files afterwards to protect our personal information and the like). The only small complaint would be that the blankets were a little warmer than we liked (it seems everyone in Paris finds the temperature colder than than we think it is... maybe it's the Canadian within us.) Overall, an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Paris”
Reviews.Author: Majess320
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three days in Paris as part of our honeymoon. We arrived at the Grand Hotel Francais earlier in the morning expecting our room not to be ready. While we did have to wait until 2 PM for our room, the manager was more than willing to put all our (large) luggage in a locked storage room so we could go see some of the sights. The staff spoke very good English (our knowledge of French is minimal) and were given a map of all the popular sights and some local restaurants in relation to the hotel. It is conveniently located close to Rue de Boulet metro stop and one stop away from the Nation station, which gives you access to the entire city. The room was more a bit smaller (as we expected) but adequate. It had a modern feel and was very nicely done. The shower was amazing - jets from top to bottom. We ate a restaurant recommended by the hotel which was close by and delicious. We would recommend the Grand Hotel Francais to family and friends alike.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, but GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kkandie22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while in Paris. The Hotel is right by the metro station so it makes for easy travel to all tourist sites. The guy at the front counter was super nice and very laid back. he spoke english very well and told us how to get to the Eiffel tower. The rooms are super small, but you only need it to sleep anyway so no big deal. The bed wasn't too comfortable, I like fluffy soft matresses, this one was thinner than i'm used to and a bit hard, but i had no problems sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, safe neighbourhood within good reach of metro and all sights.”
Reviews.Author: Jussi&Paul
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, clean and comfortable room with extremely helpful and professional staff. Breakfast is plentiful and fresh with an excellent choice to set you up for the day. The Manager is very helpful with lots of useful tips to help you enjoy your stay. We would recommend to family and friends and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “just right for short break in Paris, clean, good location super service.”
Reviews.Author: Mackers69
Reviews.Content: Booking was easy, location near to Metro ideal. Room just right size, breakfast very tasty and owners delightful and very helpful. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Revival”
Reviews.Author: HAIRYRUGGER
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris and I was not disappointed. I arrived at the hotel at about 1800 and was warmly welcomed by the lady on reception and the check in was swift and efficient. My room - 115 on the first floor was compact but more than adequate and the ensuite shower room was very well appointed. The room was exceptionally clean and throughout my stay was cleaned daily to a very good standard. The shower in the ensuite was particularly good - powerful and ample hot water throughout the day. The bed was very comfortable and I had four uninterrupted nights sleep. The mini bar fridge was appreciated, as was the safe - a very good size, large enough for laptop and all my valuables. I would have appreciated a kettle and complimentary tea and coffee - bit a minor point. The hotel's location is noticeably quiet for a city location. The only audible noise, which at worst was intermittent, was of traffic, but to be expected in a city hotel and I did not find it intrusive, resulting in a good nights sleep on all four nights. The hotel is situated out of the city centre but the walk into the city is on the level, pleasant and can be made varied passing sights of interest on all the routes I took. I passed through some interesting cosmopolitan districts and it's about 45 minutes at a gentle pace. Alternatively the Metro is accessible from two stations; Rue de Boulets, serving just one line is a 3 minute walk from the hotel and Nation less than a 10 minute walk, serving a selection of lines. I would recommend taking the Metro as opposed to taxis as the roads are often gridlocked. The Metro was never too busy , always clean and I preferred the experience to the London Underground. The staff in the hotel are excellent and no request was too much trouble and without doubt is a particular credit to the hotel, especially if your French or knowledge of the city is lacking. Staff speak fluent English. I didn't take breakfast for no other reason than I wanted to explore Paris and its many culinary treats. In summary, the hotel is an excellent choice for exploring all of Paris and I think I'd be challenged to find a similarly priced hotel offering the same level of service and comfort. I've enjoyed my stay so much I've booked a room prior to my return home. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LoRoad
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was perfect. The room was lovely and pristine, and the proprietor went out of his way to welcome us and ensure that we had everything we needed. As an example, when the restaurant we had resuested for dinner was booked, he spent a great deal of time and found us just the right place, on very short notice. The hotel's location, near the "Nation" Metro station, makes all the big sights easy to access. We're already planning our return!

Reviews.Title: “Cool reception guy”
Reviews.Author: Peripanos
Reviews.Content: Nice and friendly hotel! Near to a metro station (Rue de Bullets).Tiny little rooms (that's Paris after all), continetal breakfast, and the stuff quite gentle i have to admit! Last but not least the reception guy who makes you feel like being in your home!!!! I would personally recommend this little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel out of touristy area but close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: APP470
Reviews.Content: I use Tripadvisor all the time to help me plan my hotel and site seeing adventures both here and abroad and I have to say some of the reviews do not do this lovely hotel justice. My wife and I checked in on a Saturday and were greeting with a smile and were instantly made to feel comfortable and more than just a guest. My only regret is I did not learn the name of our lovely host who was consistently their to greet us and provide any assistance that was asked. The hotel itself is centrally located to anything and everything and we enjoyed the fact that while we only 20-30 minutes by Metro to practically everything we had the opportunity to experience more of a local feel on the Boulevard Voltaire. The Hotel was clean from top to bottom and there was not one moment of disappointment from the lobby to our room to even the basement where a lovely breakfast is served each morning. We opted for a slightly larger room than the standard at a reasonable additional cost I think of just $20 which gave us a little more room to lay our bags and made us feel like we were not staying in a closet which sometimes is the case in European hotels from our experience; we enjoy much larger accommodations State side. We enjoyed a very firm queen size bed and a full shower which also sometimes not to be expected in Europe. We started each morning of our three night stay with a lovely continental style breakfast that included nice bread and rolls, yougurt, fruit salad and nice assortment of cheese and cold cuts. it was nice to start off with a nice meal which saved us the time and effort of finding something out and about and let us start the day and get to all those wonderful Parisian sites. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone for any reason. As mentioned it was close to two Metro stops, one local station one larger more regional stop where many different Metro lines can be accessed. We feel it represented a reasonable value and we would surely stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem-expect fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: CPR901
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay following my customary research on Tripadvisor as it was where I wanted to be (away from the tourist sights but within 15 minutes of same by Metro) and enjoyed #12 staus out of 6000+ hotels in Paris which is some achievement! Before I arrived, as I was planning to celebrate my wifes birthday and had several other questions, I contacted the hotel by telephone and email. In the first instance whoever I spoke to on the Reception Team were extremely helpful, courteous, knowledgable and spoke excellent English. Nothing was too much trouble and I patted myself on the back for finding this hotel! When we finally arrived late Friday Evening, we were greeted by name handed a registration card to complete and our room card. We were asked if there was anything else we needed and it wasn't just a standard question, it was a real desire to 'serve' and very refreshing in a world where today service is considered a chore rather than a pleasure. Further to previous reviews, and as is quite the norm in Paris, we were warned the rooms were small. I am 6'3'' and 17 stone and when I first stepped into the room I felt a bit like Gulliver in Lilliput!! However after a long days travelling we settled down and enjoyed a peaceful nights rest. Although we were next to the lift (Room 44 on the 4th floor) there was absolutely no discernable mechanical noise, or any street noise throughout our stay. The next morning when we unpacked our bags it was very noticeable a lot of thought had gone into the design and furnishing of the room and bathroom to fit a lot into a litle space and we re-named it compact, not small! If there was one criticism it would be it would be the room was too warm unless the AC was switched off (which I did and it was then fine). Breakfast is served in the basement and offers a selection of cereals, breads, pastries, cold meats, cheese, yoghurts, fruit juices, teas, coffee and fresh fruit salad all served buffet style other than the drinks brought to you by very pleasant, smiling staff. When we were ready to hit the sight seeing trail with our Paris Visite Travel Cards (Essential and teriffic value purchaseable in advance which I recommend doing) the desk manager quickly pointed out the simplest way of getting there. The Metro is easy to use and the Rue Du Boulets (Line 9) station is a minutes walk from the Hotel Entrance which, can, if you wish, get you direct to the Eiffel Tower in about 20 minutes or so. A 5-10 minute walk away (or about a minute from the Rue Du Boulet station by Metro) is Nation Terminal which gets you anywhere by Metro or RER including CDG Airport (we had booked a shuttle from the airport but next time in Paris we will use the train and metro, it is quicker, easier (if you only have light luggage) and infinitely cheaper (8.5 Euros per person each way). Real plus points if you want to spend your last day touring is that the hotel offer a left luggage facility which is free of charge, which you can return to after you have seen some more of the city and collect before you leave for home. I had developed such a deep trust of the staff by the end of my first 24 hours of staying at this hotel that I left everything from Passports, to Jewellery to Boarding Passes and my wallet including cash and cards in an unlocked case which I would NEVER normally consider doing! Overall if you want a super little hotel to stay in whilst visiting Paris for a few days, look no farther than the Grand Hotel Francais, but due to the size of the rooms, cleverly designed that they are, I would probably say 5 days is max. If the hotel staff read this review I would like to say a big, big thank you to everyone especially front of house for a lovely stay- we will definitely return! PS you were even gracious in defeat in the 6 Nations 17-9 victory by England!! Thanks again Christopher & Michele

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: tillbill
Reviews.Content: After trawling through trip advisor for hours trying to find a half decent hotel to stay in in Paris on our budget I somehow stumbled across Grand Hotel Francais and what a great find it was. After reading all the reviews the hotel lived up to my expectations and more as I am never 100% sure that reviews are what they seem. Anyway the hotel was in an excellent location, Nation metro was a 5 minute walk away and took you straight to all the main tourist sites but it was far enough away from the main tourist sites to get away from the crowds in the evening etc. Our room was lovely and clean and the bed the most comfortable I have slept in in a hotel and the room was cleaned spotlessly every day. All the staff were very friendly and were able to give you advise on where to go and the easiets way to get there. The manager (sorry I can't remember your name) recommended a couple of places to eat in the evening and they were all good. Breakfast was very good and even if you arrived just before 10am they would still restock the supplies etc so you weren't just left with the crumbs. I would definately recommend this hotel and would have no hesitation in going back there. Just one word of warning, if you plan to get a taxi from CDG airport to the hotel be prepared to pay around 60 euros! We got the RER train back from the hotel to Nation which was a lot cheaper compared to a taxi but it was a bit of a nightmare with a suitcase as until you got to Gare du Nord station the train was packed and it was every man/woman for themselves on getting on and off the trains (perhaps it was worse than normal as it was around 5pm we were travelling). If you need a hotel to stay in Paris - go for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Room, great furniture, clean, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: crbunyea
Reviews.Content: The room had everyting, but it is very small for American standards. It is close to the subway and the service is good. The hotel is renovated so the fixtures are new and everything worked. The bathroom has a stan up showers, very very small, but it worked for the 3 nights we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor, pretty good location, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea0214
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms are nicely updated and modern but SMALL. But that's to be expected in Europe I guess. The elevator could fit 2 people tops, which was a squeeze for us and our bags. The bathroom was actually a decent size and very clean but the placement of the toilet was kind of comical. It was so close to the door that you felt like you were sitting in the other room. And it was mounted a bit high...I'm 5'7" and my feet were dangling while seated! It was actually kind of funny. The hotel was situated very close to two major metro stops, which was very convenient, and many restaurants and cafes were within walking distance. Free Wi-Fi was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Room, Quick Access to Subway which will take you everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Bella R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really very nice- it's just all scaled back a little. The rooms are beautifully appointed, comfortable, and very clean and modern, but they are VERY small! If you are anything like my husband and I, this will not matter to you at all, as the hotel room really only serves us as a place to crash at night. We really don't like to spend too much time in our hotel room because we're always out seeing the sights. The room has all that we really needed- a mini-fridge, a desk, a very comfortable bed, a little bit of storage for our clothes and stuff, and a clean, beautifully done-up private bathroom, with a toilet, sink, and tub/shower combo. Floor space- not so much! We had signed up for a deal where we got breakfast included in our rate. Although I would definitely stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat, the breakfast there is not something I'd do again. The quality of the food left something to be desired- not that it was bad, it was certainly edible and okay... it's just that in Paris you really want to be taking advantage of the amazing cuisine at every possible opportunity, and this stuff just tasted... store bought? Fake? I dunno, just not good. Next time I will forgo the meal there and pick up something at one of the many little places nearby instead. (Plus they serve the meal in the basement- a little depressing.) Another thing worth mentioning is the location of this hotel. It is a little bit out of the city center, but there is a subway stop seconds away from the doors, so it is not really an issue. In about 15 minutes or so, you can be right down where all the action is (ie: Notre Dame, Louvre, etc.) The staff are also very friendly and helpful! They spoke English, but were also very supportive of our efforts to scape by with our high-school level French skills! They even gave us some mini French lessons before we went out for the day to help us get around better! Everyday that we came downstairs to leave, they'd ask if we needed anything before we left (directions, maps, etc.) and if we did, they would thoroughly explain everything we needed, even giving us a map and drawing on it for us. Whenever we came back at night, they would give us a warm greeting, and make us feel very at home. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be as close to the action in Paris as possible without spending a fortune. Summary: Good Value, small yet comfortable room with all ammenities, mediocre breakfast, friendly, helpful staff, semi-convenient, quiet location. I'd recommend this place to anyone, and I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: glen555
Reviews.Content: Just come back from there. A great hotel, very clean and modern inside. We would stay again. And the staff were very helpful and friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay at the grand hotel francais”
Reviews.Author: Teggers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for Valentines. The hotel was exactly as described on trip advisor. We stayed on the fourth floor in a fab room with a balcony. It had everything we needed - a double bed, wardrobe, power shower, hairdryer, toilet with soft closing seat! Complimentary slippers which were really nice after having a shower. A safe to put our important things in, a flat screen tv on the wall which had mostly French channels but also had CNN & BBC world news. The doors to the balcony were double glazed so we didn't notice the noise from the street when they were closed. Every morning the housekeeping changed towels etc. Breakfast was between 7am & 10am, as well as continental breakfast, we were offered tea/coffee & asked what room we were in, she'd also ask it in English if you struggled with speaking French. The hotel was open 24/7 so we could come back whatever time we liked. We went out all day & came back around 10pm. To go into Paris we used the the metro stop 'rue de boulets' which is a couple if mins walk from the hotel. To get to the cemetery 'Pere Lachise', we walked. From the hotel, it took us around 10/15 mins walk. You can also walk to the Bastille from the hotel, again only takes around 10/15 mins. It's full of restaurants, bars, cafes, takeout paninis/crepes, we decided to take a walk down there when we arrived as we didn't want to go far on our first night. Also on the way back is a mcdonalds!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel-have been telling everyone about it!”
Reviews.Author: Freckles26
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Hotel Francais, I had to write a review to sing its praises. From start to finish the wonderful and friendly staff made us feel right at home, from on arrival providing us with a map of resturaunts in the area (highly recommend Les Gallopins, just a short stroll away from the hotel) to helping me organise a birthday cake for my boyfriends birthday and having it placed in our room so he would get a nice surprise. Nothing is too much for the staff of this hotel and they will help you in any way possible. The rooms are small, but this is Parisian style so we weren't shocked-they may be small but they are perfectly formed, with extremely comfortable beds and excellent bathroom with power shower, and cleaned to perfection every day. Breakfast was delicious, with a range of croissants, breads, cheeses, meats, and cereals with fresh tea, coffee and juices. There is also a little bar area with t.v where we sat one night and had a drink and a chat with the very lovely night porter that was on duty. Location is excellent with Rue de Boulets metro stop a short walk from the hotel, and also Nation station which has a large selection of metro lines running from it, making the centre of Paris very accessible within 15-20mins. The RER A also runs from Nation to Marne La Valle for anyone wishing to go to Disneyland Paris. There are lots of charming resturaunts, bars, cafes and boulangeries in the area, as well as a small supermarket across the road from the hotel where you can purchase water, soft drinks etc. If I could rate this hotel any higher I would- its an absolute gem-thank you once again for making our stay so enjoyable-I am already planning my next return to Paris and I will be back to the Grand Hotel Francais for sure! Wishing the hotel and its fabulous staff continued success! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JaneCCC
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect option for a couple in their mid 20s for a visit to Paris before xmas. The manager is probable one of the most helpfull I've ever met (especially dealing with cancelled flights during the snow) The hotel is very clean, Room was cosy and warm and the location is very near two metro lines: 'Nation' being very convienent for most attractions. I would definately return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Almost Flawless little gem - the perfect stay for a Paris trip!”
Reviews.Author: CeriJade
Reviews.Content: I took my partner there for his 30th Birthday, after spending A LOT of time researching on the internet I was convinced the Grand Hotel would be the best place to stay due to all the fantastic reviews - and my decision was definitely not wrong! The great reviews are no exaggeration - it's spotlessly clean, comfortable beds, nice little extra touches in the room (like complimentary slippers and a loofah), the power showers are amazing, staff are lovely and helpful and great tips for seeing Paris, the breakfast was lovely, all fresh, constantly restocked, plenty of choice, cold meats, cheese, tropicana orange and apple juice, fresh bread, lots of jams, cereals and lots of pastries and croissant! The location is great - 10-15 mins from the Gare de Nord for Eurostar travellers, a very easy journey from Rue Des Boulets which is the station literally 2 minutes from the hotel. 20 mins from the Eiffel Tower, again 20 minutes from Rue Des Boulets stop straight into Trocadero station on the Lime Green line. The hotel is also only a few minutes walk from Nation station which is on four tube lines so very easy to get to most places! 100% Recommended - you would not be disappointed. The reason why I gave only four blobs instead of five for sleep quality was just that the walls are a little thin so you can hear people's comings and goings, but this is to be expected really and it didn't affect us that much at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trippy1968
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. We stayed for one night in October as a we needed one night's hotel accommodation before we were able to access our Paris rental apartment for the week. We arrived very late, due to the Paris transport strikes, and the front desk went out of their way to help us by looking up information so that we could return our hire car late that evening, to avoid an additional car day hire. Throughout our stay the owner/manager was extremely friendly and helpful - as we were leaving he insisted that if we had any problems during the strikes (whilst we were at our rental apartment) to make sure we called him for help . We loved our room, it was small but perfectly formed, beautifully decorated with the most comfortable bed we'd slept in for quite awhile. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cotterrell
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff and the very friendly owner / manager was excellent. A good breakfast, rooms beautifully cleaned each day, brilliant shower, plenty of towels and toiletries. When we go back we would pay for a superior room, simply to get a bit more space - we'd got a lot of winter clothes with us and it was rather cramped. The hotel is very near a metro and there are plenty of good restaurants within walking / tubing distance.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Staff, Very Clean, perfect for short stay.”
Reviews.Author: DebCor11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of January for one night while on a quick visit with my sister which was work related. All the interior has being newly renovated and was perfectly clean. The minute we entered we were made to feel very welcome. The staff had perfect english which was great as my french left something to the imagination to say the least! We were upgraded to a superior room which was surprise. The room even for a superior was tiny, but the bed was extremely comfortable.Unlike advertised there was no tea/coffee facility in bedroom. Outside to the right as exiting was full of cafes and restaurants. Directly across the road is a small mini mart with any essentials that you may need, water, toothbrush, shampoo etc... The only downfall to the area as it would not be in the height of the tourist walk was that no menus were translated. A little french dictionary to hand may be advisable. Lovely hotel for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at Grand Hotel Francais”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a six-night stay at Grand Hotel Francais. I was given room 15 on the first floor (second floor U.S.). While I enjoyed my last stay at the hotel in October 2009, this time I came to appreciate the wonderful staff at reception, especially Zyad and Ludelie(sp?). They were more than happy to make reservations for me at Robert et Louise, a fabulous restaurant in Le Marais. Zyad also assisted me in checking into my flight the day before departure and printed my boarding pass for me. The room itself was quite comfortable. I appreciated the slippers provided and the excellent shower head. The wifi was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bo-Dawdley
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Small and friendly. Staff very attentive and helpfull. Showed great patience with my attempts at French (learned at school 30 years ago - now very rusty). Small (as ever for Paris) but very comfortable and clean room - great sleep at the end of a day walking round the city. Great breakfast - all continental, but plenty of it and an endless supply of coffee, with a smile from the waitress. Great location - just yards from rou de boulets metro stop and a 10 minute walk from nation (bigger metro station for corresponding to other lines). My husband and I travelled with a couple of friends who had bever been to Paris before - they were over the moon with the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part of Paris - Seriously”
Reviews.Author: Theodora8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to spend NYE in Paris and as with all our hotel bookings), we used TripAdvisor. We were only in Paris for a couple days and had such a great experience with this hotel. We booked a few months in advance and I requested a room with a balcony since this was our first time in Paris. We were suprised with a corner room with a large balcony, a bottle of champagne and a wonderful note that welcomed us on our first trip to Paris. It's a small hotel so the staff knows you and is terrific with suggesting good places and helping with anything you need. Our room was always spotless and roomy (for Europe). The metro is close by and you're surrounded by bakeries, grocery stores and plenty of restaurants. On NYE, they left us a Happy New Year note and chocolates. This hotel is truly special and was definitely the best we stayed at while in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service and good location”
Reviews.Author: little_L86
Reviews.Content: Staff: Very pleasant, and in particular, the girl on reception was extremely helpful, without being overbearing. Rooms: Small, as typical for the continent, but not inconveniently so. Very clean, modern and contemporary furnishings. We were right beside the lift but it was quiet, and did not bother us at all. Good quality shower and products. Bed was comfortable. Quality of towels could be improved. Breakfast: Decent spread of croissants, pain au chocolats, different types of baguettes and rolls, yoghurt, fruit, meats and drinks. Location: Although not in the thick of a particular area, it is only a 15 minute walk to Bastille, and the closest metro across the street, Rue des Boulets, is only a stop or two away from two big connecting lines - Nation and Republique.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, well-run 3* hotel. Excellent value for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: amf-Northumberland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Well-situated for easy access from CDG (RER or 351 bus to Nation) and next to metro Rue des Boulets (line 9) and 56 bus stop (no bus on Sundays). A variety of local traiteurs and small supermarkets as well as an excellent local food market on Sundays, Faubourg Saint Antoine. Very good value (we paid Â£75 per night b&b in double room through Octopus), excellent breakfast, small but spotless room with modern shower room. Staff unfailingly helpful, courteous and cheerful. Some nice touches such as free mini-bar, free wifi, free newspapers and magazines - and being greeted on arrival with a list and map detailing a variety of recommended local restaurants. Not an area we normally stay in, but we enjoyed it and I am sure we will return here. (Hint; get the 351 bus to and from Charles de Gaulle for the price of 3 local travel tickets. You get to see areas you would not normally for half the price of the RER or Roissybus. It takes approximately 1h30 door to door.) Merci Ã  tout le personnel du Grand Hotel FranÃ§ais. Nous avons beaucoup apprÃ©ciÃ© notre court sÃ©jour chez-vous. On sera de retour! AMF/AFF

Reviews.Title: “very friendly, bijou and good transport links”
Reviews.Author: LondonAlexandra
Reviews.Content: From Gard du Nord (took the Eurostar) you will need to take 2 trains on the METRO (line 5 - Orange to 'Republic' then line 9 - yellowy green to Rue Des Boulets'). The METRO, we found, to be the simplest and easiest way to travel through Paris. We paid about 41 Euro's for 2 adults for 3 full day zone 1-3 Metro tickets - very good value for money. The nearest station to the hotel is 'Rue des Boulets'. its literally 50 metres away. This station was ok to get to certain places but in the other direction of the hotel and a bit further away is 'Nation' station. This is one of the mainline stations and the one we used most of the time. the hotel is small but comfortable. The check in was easy and there was a left luggage room as we had arrived before the room was ready (2.30). When we eventually came back to the hotel we were given a room on the top floor - 6th - the rooms, as other reviews have stated, are rather small but if you are there for a long weekend, they are more than adequate. They are well decorated and comortable. The bathroom is modern and has a shower, no bath. There are no English TV channels ( nice to have news channel or something on when getting ready to go out for the day or evening). The lift is VERY slow!!!! The breakfast is continental - croissants, cereal, bread, jam etc and tea or coffee. be prepared to try and speak a bit of French as the lady in the breakfast room, lovely as she was, spoke no English!! had to muster up something resembling French from way back at school that didn't entail asking where the station was or saying that i had 1 sister and 2 dogs!!!! In the same vein, be prepared for very rude and grumpy staff at most of the tourist attractions. The staff, if they can speak English, refuse to do it and it was if we were putting them out all the time! especially at the Invalides. We were there for 3 days, 2 nights. all in all, would stay at the hotel again, friendly reception, warm cosy rooms, reasonably priced and good for transport links.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: jinty00
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband for my birthday. This was our first trip to Paris.On arrival the staff on reception were quick to recommend several restaurants depending on budget and explain when Parisians normally eat. A map of the city was also offered with advice of nearest Metro. The hotel rooms were small but clean and well decorated. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. Breakfast was continental style and plentiful. If you are a wine drinker then happy days but spirits are very expensive. so lookout. The Metro takes a bit of working out but once you have done so, getting around is easy. Wouldn't recommend driving as it seemed like mayhem. Wait till after 10am to sight see to avoid rush hour. Parisians tend to eat late i.e not before 8pm and are in no hurry to empty the table therefore we found it not necessary to find any real night life. We did discover though many restaurants in this area closed on a Sunday night and some shops. Beware the nearer you are to a tourist attraction the dearer it is to eat and drink. The Eiffel tower cost 9euro to climb the 668 steps to the second floor, this queue was much shorter than one for the lift. To be honest it was a case of had to go cos you were there. We found the Arc de Triumph and the likes of the Notra Damn much more interesting. Overall a pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel - far enough away from the tourist spots to bring down the prices yet easily accessible. A fair distance from CDG airport around 40euro by taxi, shuttle is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you need in a hotel for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: natalie1st
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in Jan 2011 for 1 night solely based on its reviews on trip advisor and I was not disappointed in any way. First impressions were great, the gentleman on reception was extremely friendly and helpful upon our arrival (which was before 11am, a long time before official check in). He took our bag for us so we could head off into the city without lugging everything around which was perfect. When we returned later we checked in quickly and was shown to our room on the 4th floor. Our room was small but we were expecting that and actually really liked it as its felt homely and comfy. Shower was great and everything was very clean. Breakfast was in the dining room in the basement, which to us had character, very Parisian. Great selection of tasty pastries and yoghurt, fruit juice and although not really our taste, a selection of cold meats and cheese. Just what you need to start the day and give you room for a tasty lunch (may we suggest Le Bistrot des CompÃ¨res - formerly Le Framboisy). The location of the hotel is near the end of the 9th metro line. The closest metro was Rue de Boulet which was across the road and we preferred to use that most of the time. The next closest is Nation which connects to a number of routes but Nation roundabout has a lot of roads coming off it which is a bit confusing. It takes about 20 mins including line changes to get to the major sights but as we are used to the London underground that was not a problem for us. I would definitely book this hotel again, the reception staff are extremely friendly and can give you recommendations on where to explore and the rooms are perfect for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Illzite
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in this wonderful hotel for a week in June.Staff were wonderful.great breakfasts,cosy and inviting,very close to the Metro in a safe area.Very clean.It was a joy to stay here.Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent friendly service, warm and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Ruthy
Reviews.Content: It's my third time in Paris. I chose it after reading the reviews here and was very happy with my choice. I enjoyed the great location, less than 100 m from the metro "Rue des Boulets" or a short walk from metro station "Nation". The staff is always there, very friendly, kind, helpful,efficient, with ready maps, list of restaurants in the area etc. Cozy rooms, free wifi good speed internet, a tasty good included breakfast, a beautiful quiet - snow covered - neighborhood//.

Reviews.Title: “Such Lovely, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTravellers4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in November 2010. We had needed to make some changes to our original July booking due to a medical condition, and the staff were most helpful and accommodating. When we finally made it in November, we couldn't have asked for a lovelier place to stay, with a warm welcome and extremely helpful front desk staff. Although getting to the hotel was initially a little tricky, we soon worked out the Metro system and realised that the Cite-Voltaire Metro Station was the most convenient for the hotel, and it really didn't take too long to get to any of the major Paris sights. The Nation Metro Station was also very handy, although we always felt disorientated when we came up from underground and tried to figure out where we were on the Place de la Nation circle. We had a lovely room with a comfortable bed. Breakfast (included) was more than adequate and a nice start to the day. One of the highlights was visiting the La Delicieuse patissier across the street from the hotel. We could never decide which treat to buy - there were so many to amazing delicacies choose from. If you are looking for a good value hotel, with wonderful friendly staff and a comfy bed, we highly recommend Grand Hotel Francais.

Reviews.Title: “We will Return!”
Reviews.Author: KittyKittybangbang
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel you get a very warm welcome from the staff, Zayed, the concierge bent over backwards to orientate us with our surroundings, make suggestions on where to grab a bite to eat (even had handouts of some of the more desireable places to dine) and gave valuable advise where to go with kids and how to get there, which truly enhanced our stay. The hotel was in a nice area of Paris, a good mix of businesses, shops,, entertainment and restaurants.I felt safe the entire time walking up and down these well lit streets in the evening (my daughter and I had dinner next door at the Italien bistro,the first night and it was good authentic northern Italien cuisine for about 40 euros) The Hotel room though bijoux was immaculate, new beds, bedding, pillows, curtains, carpets, and wall paper, very pretty......and a good size safe that will fit your laptop and all belongings...many safes in Parisian hotels only fit a camera). The bathroom and shower are modern and clean (good power shower). After visiting other hotels in Paris, this hotel subscribes to cable TV so you will catch a bit of TV in English which is great if you have to entertain smaller people while you are getting ready. We also discovered a cinema down the road that show movies in "version original" which is a bonus, with kids if you need to find mutual entertainment at night. The breakfast was continental plus (meaning it also had a variety of french cheese and fresh cold cuts) so we were full most of the day, the breakfast room is small so folks were eating and running but that was fine, so much to see and do. We walked to Bastille from the hotel and on into the Mirais, a really nice place to shop and visit the free museum Carnavalet (History of Paris)....we were sad to leave

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: JenMcTBrussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel for two nights in December, rooms comfortable, breakfast filling, really nice pastries. Only downside was that the restaurant was understaffed at breakfast and they had run out of almost every item available although these were quickly replaced upon request. Two things to note are that the hotel is about thirty minutes from the main attractions and the check in time is non-negotiable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFiliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel et the end of October and begining of November for only 3 days. It is a small hotel but very clean and newly renovated. We loved our room and it is definitely good choice for a short stay. The location was excellent! We could walk to the city's main tourist locations in the morning and if you are very tired from walking all day you can take a cab in the evening. That is what we did. The hotel staff was welcoming. I could say they were the nicest people we encountered in Paris. Thanks for the hospitality you have shown us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean and welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sahar09
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in Grand Hotel Francais for 4 nights in December and we found the room to be of a very good size (we had a superior), the bed was very comfortable, the room was clean the service at the reception was helpful. The location wasnt the greatest as it took about 25 mins to get into central Paris. The breakfast at first was ok, but after the 2nd day we found the choice limited. The TV channels were very limited. BBC world news or CNN were the only english speaking chanels. After a long day of exploring we had hoped to relax in our room before and after dinner, but the TV channels put us in a sombre mood as it was quite depressing listening to bad news constantly! We were recommended some fab restaurants by the hotel owner and the food was just beautiful. I would recommend the hotel but for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: mehicano
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in December 2010. We had read all the gushing reviews on Tripadvisor and decided to stay here even though it was a little pricey (we paid $200 USD/night). The location is not very good. It is near two metro stops, and one of them (Nation) is a hub for several different lines. However it takes about 25 minutes from the time you leave the hotel to get to the main attractions near the Louvre etc. The hotel staff (basically one person who mans the front desk 24 hrs) were nice. But it's not like they were incredibly helpful. They were just average. Although I do not know how this compares to other hotels in Paris. The rooms were small, but well furnished. The closet was very tiny. There was no ironing board in the room, and they don't even have any at all in the hotel to lend. The elevator in the hotel is very slow. Breakfast was 10 euros per person, but I would recommend eating elsewhere. There is too much good food in Paris to eat breakfast in the hotel, which was just ok but convenient. If I hadn't seen all the incredible reviews on Tripadvisor, I wouldn't have had such high expectations. In the end it was a nice hotel, but nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: SJ2310
Reviews.Content: Found hotel through Tripadvisor and booked on basis of reviews. Certainly wasn't disappointed - staff were super friendly and so welcoming. Hotel was extremely clean, very comfortable and contributed to a great weekend in Paris. Would have absolutely no hesitation in coming back and staying again! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jmatkinson
Reviews.Content: We found the service at Grand Hotel Francais to be exceptional. The desk staff spoke English fluently and was very helpful. There is a small, nice food market across the street and several good restaurants nearby. We had a corner room so it was more spacious than we were expecting. We especially enjoyed the deep bathtub. The location is quiet and a metro stop is 2 blocks away. It is not near the city center but that was a feature that we found appealing. It also has free wifi. Cons: slow elevator, little breakfast variety, check-in isn't until 3pm (which was hard when our international flight got in at 9am and we were exhausted!)- I'm sure this is pretty standard anywhere, though. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but might try another one next time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lanonymous
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, friendly staff, optional breakfast with charge, right near two metro stations, quiet neighborhood, modern look & feel, slippers, free internet. Cons: incredibly small room, I think even for European standards. However, our friends were in another room which was larger, so depends on room. I would have preferred a bathtub. Not all rooms have them. Breakfast could be better. Location is great in terms of metro, but not anything else. Overall, I can see why this is a top rated hotel. I don't think you'll be disappointed. I just put the title as "might try another" because I think I'd rather pay a little more for a hopefully larger room in a location closer to tourist trips. :)

Reviews.Title: “As good as we remembered!”
Reviews.Author: JandHDurham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second visit to this hotel, and were not disappointed. We really cannot fault it - modern decor, spotlessly clean, very comfortable, excellent staff and a more than adequate Continental buffet breakfast with English tea made with boiling water! What more could we ask for? Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, and the friends we travelled with were equally impressed. We have no hesitation in recommending this lovely little hotel and intend to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MONTY007
Reviews.Content: Clearly recently refurbished to a high standard. Metro routes nearby excellent for both Gare du nord and main attractions . Quality helpful service and excellent continental breakfast . Only down side was occasional smell from bathroom . Otherwise really lovely stay. Free wifi and room size compabale to other Paris hotels . Room quality far above average.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need from a Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MicahGTi
Reviews.Content: Our trip was so hassle free, we got off the Eurostar, jumped on the Metro at Gare du Nord and got off at Rue de Boulets and once we got onto the street, there was the hotel! Check in is at 2:30 but you can leave your bags there and go for a wander. I was impressed with the cleanliness and decor of the hotel, it was a well run establishment and everyone on Reception were very polite and confident. Every time we walked past they would greet us in French and English. We were upgraded and didn't expect to be, and the room was very clean, non-smoking and very comfortable. There's quite a bit of noise in the street at night, but after a day's sightseeing you fall asleep very quickly! we were lucky enough to get the offer with breakfast included, otherwise it's 10 Euros, and although the selection is limited, i felt the quality was very good indeed and we could eat as much as we wanted, though it wasn't a great amount as bread is very filling! I would advise to use the patisserie/boulangerie down the road (with the red canopy) to stock up on savoury items if you're going into the city just to save some money on lunch. Overall i found this hotel just what i wanted after a lot of sightseeing around Paris, due to the comfort, service and quality. I wouldn't stay anywhere else if i was to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in an interesting area”
Reviews.Author: Kittaycat
Reviews.Content: Friendly, efficient welcome: the staff was very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. Room rather small but modern and clean: some traffic noise, but with window closed it was well insulated and had a super shower. Good breakfast: choice of continental pastries, cereals/yoghurt, cheese, meat and rolls - all freshly prepared. Hotel well located on Boulevard Voltaire, 50m from metro in a neighbourhood which was not overly touristy with good selection of local bars, cafes and restaurants. Can easily walk from here to Marais, Pere Lechaise, Bastille etc. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Vive Le Grand Hotel Francais!”
Reviews.Author: Secret_Squirre1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov. 2010, and were tickled to discover upon arrival that we had been upgraded to a corner room (# 23) with wraparound balcony, tub, shower, and a lovely gift left on our bed. It was my first trip to Paris and we'd done extensive research on hotels in the city before finally deciding to book with GHF. Let me say this about that: It was fantastic. First off - our room was fabulous. Disregard room reviews that complain about the size; I think it is more a function of what people in the U.S. are used to, not a genuine reflection of space. Our room was not a closet, it was not cramped, it was LOVELY. I am finicky about rooms and don't like scratchy linens or places that have a funny smell. No worries - it was clean, it smelled clean, it looked luxe and beautiful. When we return, we want to stay here again. Second - the daytime manager at the desk deserves his reputation as a helpful, gregarious, English Speaking charmer. He was great to deal with. The evening staff, while less outgoing, was no less helpful or pleasant to deal with. Their English is wonderful and you never feel like a nuisance coming to them for help or with questions. Third - Breakfast was really delightful. Fresh croissants, pain du chocolat, juices, tea, coffee, cereal, yogurt, fruit, cheese, meats (ham and salami) were plentiful and of excellent quality. Even the room itself - a little nook - is charming in its simplicity, the china is cheerful, the silverware and glasses gleam, and the whole affair is spotless and relaxed. The hotel is impeccably tidy and fresh. I did not find a single spot where it smelled musty or mildewed or stale, there was absolutely no dust anywhere, and everything worked as it should . The lift WAS tiny, but it worked smoothly, and there was room in it for us, our luggage, and another person, so no complaints there either. The (free) wifi worked wonderfully and consistently, which is patently not true of other places offering free wifi. The shower didn't have powerful water pressure, but the shower heads are great, and the volume of hot water was wonderful. Unlike a lot of cities (New York, Boston) , the water has no funky, chlorinated odor. The amenities (shower gel & hand soap) smelled good; and you get a loofah, plus slippers to keep. Even the toilet paper was significantly better than the shiny, super thin stuff you find in most places. The bed was fantastic, a thick, firm mattress with a dense, lush duvet , and two pillows. We both suffer from back problems and have difficulty with inferior mattresses, but we both slept like logs and woke up free from backache. The television worked, the wardrobe was spacious, the draperies were heavy and wonderful at blocking light / noise, and the sheers behind the drapes were wonderful for privacy but allowing lots of light to flood the room. The walls appear to be soundproofed and while you can hear people moving around, there was no noticeable sound of toilets, showers, voices, etc.. I wish the hotel were somewhat more central. It is the only thing I found myself wishing were a little better, but in the big picture, it didn't matter. The hotel was a wonderful, comfortable haven for us at the end of our days in Paris, and as I said before, we will definitely be back. Regarding location - the hotel is a matter of yards away from the Metro stop "Rue du Boulets", and a short walk from the stop "Nation". (I preferred using Rue du Boulets, but that is because it was a shorter walk and my feet hurt.) The neighborhood is delightful and genuine. Everyone we met was cheerful and pleasant. I spoke tentative, nervous French and most people answered me in English or very understandable language. Most people do, in fact, speak English but won't admit it until you've tried your hand at French. The manager at the GHF desk will give you a map of recommended restaurants and wine bars in the area, which was helpful. We ate at one of these, and it was reasonably pleasant. (Be advised - lots of places do not take Visa / MC.) There are a couple of Boulangeries in the road, one of which served us delicious baguettes and another served the most gorgeous pastry / confections I've ever had in my life. Just writing this has made me long to return. When we do, you can be sure we'll be staying at Grand Hotel Francais. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel with warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Epices6
Reviews.Content: This is a small, family run hotel with comfortable rooms, well insulated from street noise (double glass). Reception is warm and helpful and the well-priced breakfast is ample and good. The hotel is located a stone's throw away from the Rue de Boulets Metro station (line 9), near Place de la Bastille. This is a much less touristy (the famous PÃ¨re Lachaise Cemetery is here) but lively area of Paris, with many restaurants and cafes. The hotel management takes pride in the property and in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Smilea
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, and it did not disappoint! The room was plush, absolutely pristine and the shower was amazing! The staff on the front desk were so friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast was lovely. The hotel is just a short walk from the Rue des Boulets metro stop, making it easy to get around Paris, and there are plenty of nice restaurants/cafes around the hotel too if you fancy eating nearby. I went here with my Fiancee for a 2 night break and we both loved it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrummyScot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, for a city break to see Paris. Having read all the other reviews, they are pretty accurate, and from these I kind of knew what to expect. We were upgraded to a 'Privilege' room on arrival (though I'm really not certain that it was any different from any other room). Yes, rooms are small. But they are very well finished with nice furniture and spotlessly clean. (Try poking the ceiling, it's made from a very interesting rubber material which makes it like jelly to touch!) We stayed in room 13, which was on 1st floor on the front corner of the building. The road outside was acually quite noisy (those Parisians sure love their car horns!!), even with the windows close you can here some street noise, this quietens down at night (may be quieter at rear of hotel??). But as we weren't spending huge amounts of time in the room, this didn't really bother us, and it didn't stop us getting a good night's sleep. The bed is very comfy, which added to the good rest. Reading other reviews, people mentioned the breakfast could do with a mix-up. I thought that was people being fussy, but I now agree with them. It's nice and all, but after a few days it would be nice to have a slight change. (They have fruit, cereal, bread, cheese, cold meats, yoghurts, pastries). Toast would've been nice, just my preference though. The staff were pleasent. As mentioned, they all spoke good English, though a greeting in French always goes down well. Lots of people have commented how great the staff were- we didn't have that much to do with them so can't really comment on that. Our dealings with them were fine though, and they seemed friendly enough. Hotel well located for travel, Metro & RER station 'Nation' only few mins walk away. We got everywhere in Paris we needed to from this station. All in all, a well placed hotel, very nicely decorated, pleasant staff, VERY clean. Only thing I would remind you is that there was no kettle in the room (for all you brits who love your tea) and no restaurant, so if you want to eat or drink, you mainly need to go out. Did the job very nicely for us, though if you're staying in Paris for longer than a week, might want somewhere a ilttle larger.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: IMGoldby
Reviews.Content: We had room 24, which has a diagonal wall, is adjacent to the lift shaft, and has a street lamp right outside the window. Judging from the fire plan on the door, it also has the smallest en-suite on the floor. It sounds unpromising, but we were actually extremely comfortable there. It is a small room, but they have made very good use of the space. The lift makes barely a murmur - we were never disturbed by it, and the thick curtain did a good job of keeping out the street lamp (although some light leaked around the edge). The en-suite is well-designed, but you couldn't fit two people in, and wouldn't want to risk flailing your arms around! The staff were more than helpful. Like everywhere in Paris, making at least a token attempt to speak French goes down well, but they were always more than happy to converse with us in English. Breakfast is buffet-style in the basement. As far as I could tell, no one is keeping tabs on how much you take. They have all the expected things for a continental breakfast. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: happiness_travels
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Grand Hotel Francais and throughly enjoyed it. Room was very small (but this is Paris) but otherwise all lovely. Great shower. Very friendly reception staff. Nice location. We paid Â£96 per night and at that price I thought it was good value (but that was at discount to the rate I have seen advertised elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Clean nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: suman_goli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and in fairly nice location and priced well. Only complaint I have is the room is too small. I have stayed in NYC these are smaller compared to what you get in NYC. The hotel location is closer to train station. The staff are very friendly and helpful, gave few good suggestion. I would surely stay in this hotel if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydney_travel000
Reviews.Content: Located within few minutes walk from Nation station this small hotel is a hidden gem. Our room was tiny, but modern and super clean, large bathroom, safe, good breakfast and friendly staff. It was a random choice from LastMinute site, but I have now been recommending it to friends who visit Paris. We liked the fact that it's small and is not located next to major tourist attractions, but still close to everything (just few stations on subway). Service was very friendly, food - pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but.”
Reviews.Author: Mdr1031
Reviews.Content: The area that the hotel resides in is perfect. The hotel itself is everything we wanted. Couldn't have asked for a better stay. But there was one little problem. Our room smelled of vomit. Not sure if the previous guest had gotten sick, or if it was the cleaner they were using. I find it hard to imagine that the cleaner was the problem, but every time we came back to the room after it had been cleaned it smelled worse. Could have been that they stirred up the smell every time they cleaned. With that being said we would still definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Ozzieinbc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights late September and had a great time. The rooms are very clean and cozy. Zyhad and his staff are very friendly and helpful and always eager to please.Zyhad gave us a room upgrade because it was our anniversary and we can't thank him enough for his friendly service.
