As others have said the htoel is close to a Metro and major RER station and does not take very long to get to all the tourists sites.Great restaurants close by and the area is very safe to walk at night.If you are planning a trip to Paris you won't be disappointed with this hotel. Thanks again MR Zee for a great time PS: Great breakfast as well

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service and friendliness in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jarimalla
Reviews.Content: I had already chosen another hotel, but after reading the reviews here decided to opt for Grand Hotel Francais. Great choice, absolutely! There's no point in repeating all the good stuff the people have already mentioned, it's all true. I just wan't to say big thanks to Zyad (concierge/owner) for his unselfish and genuine customer service that really made a big difference and added great value to our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great ammenities an overall excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Reenyh
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure we were given the best service possible! The staff were friendly and willing to help with any enquires or questions you had. The manager even organised our laundry to be done for free! The hotel is in Nation, which is close to the Yellow Metro line which goes to all the major tourist attractions. Room facilities were excellent and the view from the balcony was so beautiful. The area around the hotel has everything you need from restaurants to laundromats and the area is very clean and in a very good side of Paris. Will definitely be staying at Grand Hotel Francais for my next visit to Paris and I highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: natmer13
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip where my friend and I spent our last night in Paris at the Grand Hotel Francais. This place is great! Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Rooms are spotless with modern decor and are large for European standards. Bathroom was spotless. We had a bottle of champagne being chilled in the room upon our arrival (no extra charge from what I remember). The bed was so comfortable, it was better than my bed at home, and it was large. You get complimentary slippers, as well. The staff have a list of recommended restaurants in the area ready when you check in. Conveniently located w/ train station about 1 block away. Great shopping on Rue Fauborg de St. Antoine near the Bastille train station. I have only good words for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, pristine hotel, close to major metro stop”
Reviews.Author: kauai223
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and I was traveling alone. After reading reviews from others, this looked like the perfect place. It was definitely the right choice! Safe neighborhood, very clean hotel, newly remodeled, gorgeous rooms. Yes -the rooms are small but most likely you're in Paris to see the sights, so time spent in your room is minimal. The hotel staff was very friendly ---- and as others have stated, the dinner recommendation for the neighborhood restaurant Les Gallopins was perfect!! Also, you're within walking distance of a major metro station (w/ RER access) and also a smaller metro station. It's a perfect location for being able to take the RER from the airport --- much cheaper than taking a cab. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again! Excellent value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again next time we're in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieBG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful neighborhood just outside the touristy areas but still very close to a Metro to get to all the sites. There are cute restaurants and an AWESOME bakery nearby as well as a little market across the street. The rooms are small but very clean and modern looking. And the manager of the hotel is very nice and helpful. He speaks perfect English and knows a lot about Paris, places to eat, where to visit, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: maystravels_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in the hotel and it was pretty much what I expected based on reviews from Tripadvisor. The room was not large but at the same time it was more spacious than other hotel rooms we stayed at in France. I was particularly impressed with the service; Zyad the Manager lived up to his reputation as being very chatty, friendly and focused on guests' needs. He even offered to do our laundry for us free of charge so that we could spend our time in more pleasant ways. The hotel is not in the touristy area which is fine with me as eating out and buying a few groceries tended to be cheaper. It's very handy to the Nation metro station which is linked to virtually all the major attractions. The only complaint we had was regarding the breakfast. We had 5 breakfasts at the hotel and there is no variety. It would be nice to change one or more aspects of the breakfast every 2 or 3 days so that boredom does not set in. For instance the type of pastries, cheeses, fruit or cold meats offered could be varied. All in all, if you want a value for money, clean and comfortable place to crash whilst in Paris for a few days, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms, great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: silverwolf22
Reviews.Content: Located on Boulevard Voltaire and only steps away from the Rue des Boulets metro stop, the Grande Francais is a beautiful little boutique hotel with small, cozy rooms. Recently renovated, the rooms are furnished with good quality linens, comfortable beds, flat screen television and a modern aesthetic, with clean lines and simple furniture. All rooms are equipped with clean, modern shower facilities, with an option to upgrade to suite rooms with bath tubs. Check in went smoothly and the concierge was very helpful when it came to recommending local spots for groceries, breakfast or meals. We had no problems with our reservations being honored; however if you book a double room as a single occupancy, there will be an additional EUR20 charge if you want to change that to a double occupancy. The manager and staff are bi-lingual and go out of their way to help guests. The Grande Francais is not located within central Paris, but is a little further off the tourist track in the 11e, or 11th arrondissement. This adds to the local flavor of the neighborhood. There are numerous shops dotted around the streets and visitors can easily buy cold cuts, fresh baguettes or fruit. The breakfast offered, like most of Europe, is Continental-style and consists of pastries, bread, jams, coffee, tea and fruit. The food was adequate for the price charged. For a more authentic Parisien experience, eschew the hotel provided breakfast and hit the streets of Paris for a breakfast of croissants and coffee in a cafe instead. Unlike larger chain hotels, the Grande Francais does not have many amenities, such as a fitness centre or conference rooms. Guests are allowed to use the gym and pool of another nearby hotel for a fee of EUR20. There are also non of the vending or ice machines normally found dotted in the corridors of American hotels, though it is easy and convenient to pop down to the nearby shops for any items you require. Parisien hotels are infamous for their high prices, small sizes and not always clean rooms. For a comfortable, safe and clean space to rest your feet after a full day of sight seeing in Paris, the Grande Francais is a good choice for both business and leisure travelers. Prices are reasonable by Paris standards. The Grande Francais represents good value, tastefully decorated and comfortable rooms in an accessible location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small hotel with AMAZING service at GREAT price!”
Reviews.Author: kmp222
Reviews.Content: Wow! Where to begin... It was our honeymoon trip - 2 days in Paris, 4 days in Rome and the beau planned it in its entirety. A big THANKS to all on Trip Advisor for rating this hotel high enough for my hubby to choose this spot! After a long flight from San Francisco, we were exhausted and feeling a little delirious when we arrived. Though we had to wait a few minutes for our room to be ready, the incredibly humorous and overwhelmingly knowledgeable front desk gentleman was ever so gracious to jump behind their quaint little bar and pour me a glass of wine and my hubby a scotch. We were extremely excited once we arrived in our room - let me be clear, if you've done any research then you know Paris has small rooms, so it was no surprise, but the room was super clean and had an efficient use of the space provided. Not to mention the most adorable little patio - ask for a room on the top floors if possible so you can appreciate this beauty. Though most of our trip was planned, the concierge gentleman previously mentioned was such a tremendous help to us; he provided directions to the nearest metro, recommendations for a quick glass of wine and fromage, helped us to correctly pronounce certain words/phrases... all in all, he was phenomenal! He played a HUGE part in making our stay in Paris so perfect. I could not thank him enough for his assistance... I'm sorry I forgot his name - but he speaks like 5 different languages and brown curly hair with glasses. (This is so he get's credit for being an outstanding employee!) =) The hotel is in a great location; Voltaire is lined with amazing brasseries and cafes and you can easily walk to the metro, some great little shops. Two small flaws - almost not worth mentioning, but I will for those that are neurotic like I am... 1) The website says they have a fitness room. They do not. Instead, they guide you to the ClubMed gym which is about a 5-8 minute walk from the hotel. I got a little lost trying to find the place, but when I finally did I was surprised to learn that you have to pay 20 euros to get in, which I was unprepared for. Thankfully, the women at the gym were sympathetic and let me work out for free. I only mention this as a "flaw" as I am gym rat, so I work out everyday (yes, even on my honeymoon), so I had insisted we stay at a hotel with a gym and unfortunately, I feel this was misrepresented. 2) The housecleaning was great - except for un-deliberately ruining my new straw hat from Banana Republic. When we left one morning I had my hat on top of my suitcase. When we came back at the end of the day, my hat was squished between my suitcase and the wall. When they were cleaning they must have moved things around and in the process my hat became lodged in that position. Sadly, because it's paper/straw the sit/style of the hat was now ruined and it can not be reshaped to its original form. SO, there goes $40. After all is said and done, it was a superb hotel with the most welcoming and informative customer service ever. I would definitely recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Petite Hotel, Grande Enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: steven424
Reviews.Content: My wife chose this hotel based on the reviews in Trip Adviser, and it certainly lived up to its reputation. We were originally booked for the end of April but had to cancel due to the Iceland volcanic activity. Hotel management graciously allowed us to rebook at our original price without any restrictions. This set the tone for our stay. The hotel is located about 2mi due east from center city (Notre Dame) on a main but quiet tree-lined street a few blocks NW of Place de la Nation. This actually worked to our benefit because at night there was little or no vehicle traffic, and it was very quiet. Other tourists we met who stayed closer to the center city encountered evening noise issues. We were a little concerned about not being in the "middle of things" but after a day on the Metro our concerns evaporated. Hotel to the M9 metro station was a 5 minute stroll. As Brooklynites we were impressed with the whole Metro system and the extensive coverage and interconnection of all the lines. As you walk to the station you pass more patisseries than any area has a right to have. At one point we needed an eclair intervention. More about location. Being in the suburbs, the area is definitely not "24x7". The restaurants and shops in the immediate vicinity kept hours we could not reliably figure out. The small supermarket across the street was closed more of the 8 days we were there than it was open. This might have been due to the close succession of Jewish holidays (the supermarket had a large variety of kosher foods), but we were never sure. If you are like us and prefer to eat in instead of doing the restaurant thing every evening, the solution is to walk to the Casino Supermarche located at the Place de la Nation (a 10 minute walk). Stock up on the basics, which you can store in the mini-fridge in your room. This is also helpful if you get late night snack-attacks, since the hotel does not have any vending machines or convenience shops. The hotel itself is very much as others have described it. 6 floors, 3-4 rooms per floor. Small elevator with an over-sensitive leveling systems that caused it to bounce as people got on and off. The rooms are small by US standards, but very comfortable by European standards. The bed, pillows, and comforter are to die for (one of the best sleeps we've had anywhere). Bathrooms are very clean, modern, small, and have great showers. Ample clothing storage unless you are going formal every night. Modern heat/AC controls, but be aware of French conservation regulations. The evenings were chilly (low-mid 50's), but the hotel was not permitted to turn the heat on until the middle of October. Did I mention that the comforter was to die for? The same is probably true for the AC toward the end of Spring. Free WiFi, which allowed me to use my netbook and smartphone without roaming charges. Free mini-safe for valuables like jewelry and passports. One of the best parts of our stay was the breakfast room. Well stocked with freshly baked croissants and other breads and rolls, spreads, orange and apple juice, fresh fruit cocktail, yogurt, and sliced meats. Coffee and hot chocolate on request. If you are planning any sort of activity such as long walks, you must definitely eat breakfast. We were able to go for long stretches without food breaks because of this initial nourishment. The staff is very friendly and courteous, and very fluent in English. When we arrived there was a mix-up with our accommodations. The person on the main desk at the time, Zyad, went out of his way to make things right. Way out of his way... We figured out after a few days that he was a French version of John Cleese in Fawlty Towers. Dry, deadpan wit. If he says he will have to quit the hotel industry and leave the country because of some minor problem you bring to his attention, play along. Would we stay there again? In an instant. Between the location, the staff, the comforts, and the breakfast room, it was one of the nicest vacations we've had. We cannot guarantee you will have the same level of enjoyment we did, but you can be sure Zyad and the rest will try to make it right. Or they will quit the hotel industry and leave the country.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Asked For!”
Reviews.Author: geordy
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay in the 11th and read the very good reviews of this hotel here. I've dealt directly with hotels before asking for specific things..and got there and didn't, at least at first get them. Not true here..everything as asked for....large bed, bathtub, plus flat screen TV, safe, A/C, free breakfast, slippers(!), friendly service...what more can you ask for? Good Metro connections...the "Restaurant Row" of Paris of the Moment...Rue Paul Bert, a few minutes walking away plenty of local shops and such? What more to ask for? Great bed, duvet, bathroom.....perfect home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the guy from Missouri - don't get carried away with expectations.”
Reviews.Author: PeterFrance
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, but our room was extremely small. If you think that that's what you have to put up with in Paris - well, it's not. There are hotels with more spacious rooms, at less expensive rates, and in locations that in all fairness, are better. Tripadvisor's policy doesn't allow me to name them! Having said that, it's a nice place, with lots of positive points, and the people are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicki1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to celebrate our joint 30th birthday and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were quite small but really well decorated. The location was good - there is a metro station opposite and is fairly close to the big interchange at Nation. There are also some fantastic pattiseries close by and a supermarket for your convenience. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: hooray4hollydaze
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the end of 5 weeks in France. Chose the Grand Hotel Francais because of its excellent reviews on Trip Advisor, and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is clean and very well run, and concierge staff were very helpful, provided us with a list of local restaurants, called taxis and were very friendly and most charming. We were upgraded to a superior room, which provides all you need for a stay in Paris - great comfortable bed, bath (or shower) with plenty of hot water, plus great water pressure, tasteful decor and nice quality toiletries. Rooms are a good size by Paris standards. The hotel is located within steps of the Paris Metro, so all the major tourist attractions are minutes away. This is really good value for money. Ten out of ten!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: arosen52
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor for this hotel, we booked for a 5 night stay. We arrived very early before our rooms were ready. We were met by the manager, Zyad, who immediately made us feel welcome. Our room was small, but clean as was the bathroom. The staff was incredibly helpful and all spoke English. They were able to suggest restaurants and stores. One of the staff, Ludivine, was nice enough to call around and find us a restaurant reservation for a Friday night. The hotel is well located near the Metro. The neighborhood has shops, restaurants, and bakeries. There are also several kosher restaurants, stores, and bakeries nearby, if that is important to you. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Place to represent Paris”
Reviews.Author: durkatheleen
Reviews.Content: We came to The Grand Hotel Francais only for 4 nights. It stays in the Ideal neighborhood, right in center of Paris. It is near many cafes, bistros, groceries stores and metro stations which makes it perfect to our trip. Manager of hotel, Zyad and also other staff are the most helpful people i know. They are very informative and delightful person ever. They helped us with directions to various tourist sites, suggested restaurants close by. The room i got was quite small, not happy with that butl but comfortable and quiet. We had Internet access and a safe box as well. I am sure you will be happy with the cleanness the hotel does everyday with the room. Anyway, happy and book this if you consider visting Paris !

Reviews.Title: “We had a fine experience here, but don't let this hotel's high ranking give you unreasonable expectations”
Reviews.Author: jrf25
Reviews.Content: We had a good one-night stay here, the last night of our Europe trip and our 8-year wedding anniversary. The room was nice, if small, with two cute little balconies. There was parking (expensive, but hey, it's Paris) nearby for our car. Great little neighborhood. Ok Metro access (though not at your doorstep). We didn't think that much of the breakfast compared to other places we'd stayed on our trip, and this was the second most-expensive hotel we stayed at. Overall, we recommend, but don't let the high TA ranking give you false expectations. It's a nice, serviceable hotel, but not exactly the Ritz. Not a great value, but you don't feel you overspent.

Reviews.Title: “Even after my sixth or seven stay, Grand Hotel Francais still impresses”
Reviews.Author: RWAppleWannabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in London and travel to Paris two or three times a year for leisure. Since discovering the Grand Hotel Francais in November 2008, we've stayed nowhere else in Paris. Zyad is the most gracious hotelier, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and we love exploring the 11th, with food hotspots on the rue Paul Bert within walking distance, and Le Chateaubriand also close by. On Sundays, the Vietnamese treats in nearby belleville are a good option, too. The 1 from Nation takes you easily to the Marais and Right Bank sights, and from a nearby bus stop, you can travel quickly to the Left Bank on mass transit. I'm not a huge fan of the ground-floor rooms since they get very little natural light (the 'rainforest' showers are superb, though), but otherwise, GHF really is the perfect hotel and excellent value for money. Our last visit in early September reinforced this impression once again.

Reviews.Title: “super clean rooms & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pkk29
Reviews.Content: The room was very, very clean. I am very sensitive about smells, but I had no problems with this hotel. The bathroom was tiny but very clean and modern as well. My only issue was the size of the room, but I think that this is pretty typical in Paris. The staff was also very helpful. They had maps of the city at the front desk. The hotel is very close to the metro and is surrounded by tons of restaurants, bakeries, and supermarkets within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: borgir72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days. The breakfast was good and was included. The hotel was located conveniently, near Metro nation train station. Free wifi. The staff was very hospitable and we were warmly welcomed. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed. Everything ran well and the value was good. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My number one !”
Reviews.Author: Lojerey
Reviews.Content: I came to Paris couple times now and always stay in different places. And Grand Hotel Francais was very very good hotel in my opinion. The staff was fantastic as they are all very friendly, accomodating. If any questions, i am sure they can help as they always volunteer with lots of helpful information. They helped me with directions, new places to eat and new fairs as well. The single room i got was quite small but comfortable. In the end, i only need it for morning and late night sleep. One thing to note down is that i had internet there as well, useful thought from the hotel ! Anyway, i think this is a very good hotel and worth to visit and even come back for the second time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ZWheeler
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 7 night stay at this hotel. The staff members were friendly and eager to help, and room was clean and comfortable. The furnishings were modern and cool, and made good use of the small space. We never felt cramped and we had ample storage for our belongings. The bed and bathroom were fantastic--much nicer than you would expect for such an affordable hotel. The tub was very deep, and a little tricky to get in and out of. It wasn't really a problem for us, but if you have bad knees or hips, you should try to book a room with just a shower. We also loved the residential feel of the neighborhood. It was a bit far from some of the more touristy spots, but there were two metro stops nearby to take us anywhere we wanted. Overall, we had a wonderful experience, and we would recommend this hotel to anyone. (As a side note--We would recommend taking a cab to the airport, rather than using the hotel's shuttle service. We waited until 7:30 am for a shuttle that was scheduled to pick us up at 7:00 am. There was another couple waiting for the same shuttle, and we agreed to share a cab instead of waiting any longer. I could be wrong about this, but I thought I saw the hotel manager give the other couple 40 euro to pay for the cab, for OUR inconvenience. If this was the case, this would be an example of good customer service. Sadly, when it was time to pay the cab driver, the other couple still split the fare with us. So, thank you to the hotel manager if you tried to pay for our cab!)

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay at the Grand Hotel Francais”
Reviews.Author: RonJulia
Reviews.Content: We looked at the TripAdvisor reviews and selected this hotel as a result. It was certainly a very good choice. The room was clean, well serviced and the staff very welcoming. A good breakfast was included and the hotel was very close to the Rue des Boulets metro station. The hotel booked restaurants for us...La Cordonniere and Pramil - both excellent ,genuinely French restaurants. They also booked Aux Tonton Flambeurs for us: when we got here ...it was closed!! However we wandered into the bar/bistrot right opposite called 'a l'ami Pierre' (5, Rue de la Main D'or Paris-Bastille) and we had a tremendous evening....good food at a good price, enlivened by a very entertaining host - thoroughly recommended!!! We also went to Monet's Garden at Giverney...an easy day trip on the train....go on the metro from Rue des Boulets metro station to Paris St. Nazare train station and catch the train to Vernon where a waiting public service bus will whisk you to Monet's Garden at Giverney. It's a wonderful garden, very beautiful and at the end of your visit a public service bus will return you to Vernon station. We also chose Grand Hotel Francais as we were catching an early train from Paris Gare de Lyon and it is not far from the hotel - doable by the metro. All in all, GHF was a good stay for us and if we needed a hotel in that part of Paris again, we would certainly stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in an idiosyncratic part of town!”
Reviews.Author: crunchberry
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say.... overall a great experience! First off is Zyad. I have seen other reviews that refer to him as the owner, and if so, it definitely shows. The guy's on top of his game. You'd imagine him as the ultimate concierge at five star hotel. When I booked the hotel, I emailed to ensure that the room would be appropriate and quickly got a return email that another room would be better suited to me; QED on arrival. When I needed clothes laundered and missed my alarm; no problem, taken care of. When I needed clothes due to a wardrobe malfunction; monsieur, no problem. Amazing. Best front desk man ever! Not only that, the guy's funny. When I asked if I should keep my laptop in my room due to security reasons, the maid standing by the front desk looked at me, and Zyad looked at her and said as a parent scolding a child, "OK now, please do not steal the Monsieur's laptop!" Playful, mocking way, that was quite perfect. Second is 11th Arr. I have a good friend in Paris and asked what place I should see off the tourist destinations. His response was instantly - "Go to the 11th Arr." He was right. It's not downtown, not close to the major attractions, but what are you going to Paris for? More pics and tourist traps, or a real feel for a very real city that is simply beautiful in a number of ways (and a few not, like every corner being a fire hydrant for drunkards). The nearby pÃ¢tisserie was great for fresh baguettes and other baked goods. The nearby Metro station "Nation" takes you to all the major stops. The smell of the roasting chickens at the boucherie was fantastic... I could go on, but stay and find out. Third, and last is the price. What kind of fool stays for 3x the price elsewhere when s/he can be treated like a king at the Grand Hotel Francais. Yes, if you insist on not travelling by foot, bus, scooter, rental bike or taxi, but only Metro, you have to be in by 12:30a. Yes, if you don't catch Zyad, but instead the others at the Front Desk, the experience suffers some. But, assuming you can wheedle your way to have a normal experience, the experience will be beyond normal.

Reviews.Title: “Please book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: V1210
Reviews.Content: So, I am a bit late with my review, but I felt I needed to give Grand Hotel Francais the praise they deserve. This was my second time to Paris, the first time I stood in not such a great hotel. The second time, I made sure I did my research and I am glad I chose to stay here. It is a small boutique-like hotel. Very clean. The staff were great. The free wi-fi is a plus. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Location is convenient. (5 to 7 min walk to the metro). If I return to Paris I would without a doubt return.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: amex0410
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find from Nation metro station, and we were greeted by a very helpful and friendly receptionist, who, as we discovered later on, always said hello and goodbye as we arrived and left. She gave us a map and told us the best way to get around, and which metro stations were closest to which sights. They were also very helpful in enquiring at our next hotel as we were checking out, as our French wasn't really up to it! The lift is a welcome sight, and the rooms are beautifully decorated and we had a little balcony over the road below. The bathroom was extremely modern and clean with a power shower, coming with the hotel's own slippers, and various little bottles of things! There was a TV on the wall and a safe in the wardrobe, the room was very comfortable and air conditioned, and also came with a fridge and minibar, which was ideal for cooling bottle water our excursions. The breakfast was great, with a nice variety of yoghurts, breads, pastries and cheese and ham, which was more than adequate for the day! We would definitely recommend this hotel, and hope to return if we're ever back in Paris, definitely worth more than its three stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel12377
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Francais. When we booked in we were upgraded to a superior room. This was actually our last stop on our mini Euro-trip. The rooms were smaller than the other hotels we stayed at on our trip. The breakfast could have been better, we had better at our other hotels. It was included in our package so we went to have coffee and just some cereal. We picked this hotel because of the reviews. The service was one of the best. The rooms small but clean. I must say that I had the best night sleep at this hotel. I felt very comfortable asking questions. Whatever I asked I always got more than just my answer. Zyad is actually the owner of the hotel. He is there all day. He is very helpful along with his staff. He cares about his hotel, his staff and his guests. They also ironed my clothes and did my laundry(folded) for FREE. Wifi is also Free. We needed a charger for our IPod and they had that too. I think this hotel would be a 4 star hotel if the breakfast was better. I just feel there should be more options for breakfast if you are paying for it. Just had 2 kinds of cold meat, American coffee, 2 kinds of cereal, 4 or 5 kinds of Croissants, orange juice, apple juice, 3 kinds of cheese, and 2 kinds baguettes. Location wise, it was fine. The metro was really close. It wasn't right in the center of any sights but Bastille was about 20 min walk. We took the metro everywhere, and no matter where you are, if you want to see other sights you would prob have to take some type of transportation. Everything was easy to find. The metro lines we used were really good to get to anywhere we wanted. We took a cab from the train station for about 13 euros. The cab to the airport was about 40 euros since there was no traffic. My husband is a little more pickier than I am. He would prob want to stay closer to one of the popular sights but then we would prob pay more and get less for our money. Its all about what you prefer at the end. To us the number one thing to make our stay enjoyable is the Service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal, modern, conveniant Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinHB
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais was ideal for our trip to Paris. I did plenty of research on other hotels in our price range and thanks to Trip Advisor this one was the only one with NO bad reviews. All the reviews are true. The hotel is quaint and ideally located near many cafes, bistros, groceries stores and metro stations. The rooms are small but comfortable (and it depends on what you want, we went for the smaller one since we were going to be in the room that much) and quiet. We had Internet access and a safe for our laptop. The staff at the hotel are extremely helpful. They helped us with directions to various tourist sites, suggested restaurants close by and were overall pleasant to interact with.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pabajb
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for five nights. It was perfect in every respect. The management and staff were fantastic and helped us guide our way through Paris. The location is just a few blocks from the Metro and RER. Plenty of cafes and bakeries around. The hotel is very clean. The free wifi worked well in our room. Don't hesitate in your decision to stay here. There is no downside!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Considerate Hotel Management”
Reviews.Author: Gladwyneator
Reviews.Content: This is not a review about the hotel itself (which seems beautiful), but about the kind and considerate management of the hotel. My daughter and her friend were supposed to travel to Paris from the U.S. and stay at the Grand Hotel Francais. However, an accident at the airport caused them to miss their flight and consequently their reservation. We knew there was a clear policy requiring the cost of one day's room charge for a last minute cancellation and were expecting we would be responsible for it. Nonetheless, we wrote the hotel explaining the circumstances in the hope that they would make an accommodation as a courtesy. Shortly thereafter, we received back two lovely notes from a hotel manager who told us that the hotel would waive the cancellation penalty. The gentleman also went out of his way to write a kind and sympathetic note in view of the unfortunate turn of events. In sum, although I cannot provide meaningful input about a stay at the Grand Hotel Francais, any hotel run by such considerate and customer friendly individuals is truly a hotel I would want to patronize with my business.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel that I will EVER stay in when I go to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Colbere
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance of the metro, a convenience store, and at least 8 different restaurants, each with its own ethnic focus. Also within walking distance of one of the not-often-visited tourist sites, PÃ¨re Lachaise cemetery. Everyone was extremely friendly. We were actually bumped up to the Honeymoon Suite when we arrived at no additional charge simply because "they had an opening." They give you your own little slippers with the hotel logo, which is adorable. The shower was amazing with jets that sprayed from multiple angles. While the room was small, even for the honeymoon suite, it was nice to come home to someplace as beautiful as the rest of the city. We actually preferred not staying so close to the other tourist sites because it forced us to see other areas of Paris, and to be around actual French people instead of tourists constantly. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting the city. There's something to be said about the fact that it is ranked 14th out of over 1,000 Parisian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great little retreat for Ã  city that can wear you out with gorgeous sites!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnjonna
Reviews.Content: This is Ã  gem of Ã  hotel! We took Ã  multi-city and multi-country 4 Week tour of Western Europe and can honestly say this hotel ranked #1. It has it all: quiet, Great AC, cozy beds, excellent shower, wifi, great view of Boulevard Voltaire, good restaurants in the neighborhood (le Dalou is wonderful). We will book again. Thanks for knowing your job, Hotel Francais!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, convenient option for stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JamesJoy
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Francais was our first stop on a multi-city tour of western Europe for our honeymoon. It met and exceeded expectations. The staff was fantastic; very friendly, accomodating and volunteered helpful information without being overbearing. Just a very simple, clean and comforable hotel. The metro was convenient from the hotel, and the surroudning neighborhood had plenty to offer for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a warm welcome and comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Campbell59
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying in the Grand Hotel FranÃ§aisâ€¦â€¦ and itâ€™s as good as ever! These guys are trying really hard to provide a high standard of service. The rooms are modern and well equipped, and the whole hotel is kept spotlessly clean. On arrival we were delighted to discover that we had been upgraded to a charming superior room with a balconyâ€¦many thanks for that Zayed! As usual the entire staff were friendly and helpful (and largely multilingual it seems). Breakfast was fresh and tasty and served with good cheer every morning. Personally I love the hotelâ€™s location, the local bars and restaurants are great if you donâ€™t feel like going far and youâ€™re right beside Rue des boulets (line 9) metro and within 5/10mins walk of the large Nation metro and RER. If you can master the metro you can get anywhere in Paris quite easily and efficiently using only one carnet (tube ticket). Itâ€™s no surprise that this hotel receives such excellent Tripadvisor reviews, they are very well deserved. We wouldnâ€™t want to stay anywhere else in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Golfer88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights and simply loved the place. The staff, led by owner Zayed, was uniformly friendly, helpful, and effective. The people manning the desk always asked about our plans for the day, offering advice when they thought prudent, and always inquired when we returned about how things went. The breakfast room people were lovely, as were the cleaning staff, who also pressed our clothes for no charge. Small, but clean, comfortable, quiet, efficiently-laid-out rooms with very comfortable beds and excellent showers. Free wi-fi. Great breakfasts, made even better with the new bakery they've just engaged. The croissants were commercial until 7/19; now they're the real thing, and what a difference! We love the location, in a superficially uninteresting neighborhood, but close to the metro, close to many lovely restaurants, and quiet and calm. We loved coming back at the end of long days of touristy stuff. On top of all this, a great value. We'll stay here whenever we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Colferg
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, excellent hotel. I booked this hotel for my wifeâ€™s 30th birthday and as always on special occasions you worry about the hotel. Well on this occasion it turned out to be a real treat. The room was spotlessly clean and very modern, a little on the small side but this is Paris and for what I paid, through the hotels own web site, I definitely canâ€™t complain. On arrival we were upgrade, I get the feeling this always happens. We were given the wifi access codes and a map of good nearby restaurants. We tried one just round the corner and it was great. Its close to two metro stops which is exactly what you need when in Paris. It is a little out of the tourist hot spots but the area is very safe and has a nice village type feel to it. Itâ€™s worth having dinner nearby and just sitting out on the street watching the world go by. I get the feeling this little gem could be in line for a trip advisor good value award.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Location is good in some ways, just okay in others.”
Reviews.Author: AwakenTampa
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel. Friendly staff, clean, and safe. Easy access to metro stations. GREAT BEDS and well decorated room. Part of us wished we stayed a little closer to the main attractions and tourist areas, but it depends on the money I guess. As for the hotel itself, we were very satisfied. I'd give it 4.5 circles if possible. Pros: - Great bed! We stayed on the 3rd floor in the end room (301?) We LOVED the bed. - Clean and nice room. - Friendly multi-lingual staff - Easy access to choice of metro stations - Quiet. Cons: - Not a lot nearby really. Couple of restaurants and little food marts, but not much else. - Half shower door (pretty common in Europe I guess) Still hard to adjust to for Americans, but this is VERY minor.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel with very good transport links!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sukysandhu
Reviews.Content: We started the holiday with a negative experience due to booking our hotel room through www.1800 Hotel.com, who went bust the day we arrived!! However not one to cry!! We went to an internet cafe, and booked the hotel room through another website (www.booking.com). The hotel was fantastic, the service and the breakfast were very good as well. Definitely buy a travel pass, as we got our money's worth from the day we got there, to the day we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly and helpful staff! Very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: SusieGMerseyside
Reviews.Content: After our plane was delayed by a day we were upgraded to a lovely top floor room with views over Boulevard Voltaire. Warm reception and given a little bottle of bubbly to cheer us up after travelling through the night. Good location and very comforatable hotel which was spotlessly clean. Air conditioned rooms were first class which allowed us to have good sleeps for the 2 nights we stayed. Rooms are petit but cosy! Showers excellent! The hotelier arrange transport for us to go to a sister hotel since our stay was extended. His very helpful friend picked us up free of charge to take us to the new hotel and also arranged a taxi for me for my business meeting - ensuring that I was not over charged by the taxi driver. I would 100% recommend this hotel in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris with exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: samina96
Reviews.Content: We were nervous about staying in a hotel solely based on tripadvisor reviews, but the reviews are spot-on. The hotel is truly an affordable gem. The rooms, while small (but all rooms are small in Paris) are stylish, updated, modern, and clean. The shower has great pressure. The bed was extremely comfortable and the walls were soundproof. There is ample space to hang your clothes in a his and hers closet. The hotel provides slippers, soap and great smelling shower gel, and a hair dryer. Morning breakfast is a delight; we looked forward to the coffee, baguettes, croissants, fruit and cheese each morning. It was so nice to have breakfast in the hotel so we could just start our sightseeing right away. And what a pleasure--when we inquired about an iron for the room, the staff ironed our clothes and even did our laundry for us. The staff at the hotel are what make this hotel exceptional. Lubidine (sp?) at the front desk makes you truly feel as if it is her pleasure to help with everything. She made reservations for Moulin Rouge, arranged for city tours and was always pleasant and eager to help. As for location, it is a 5-10 minute walk to the Nation metro stop and it was a bit of a issue to get back to the hotel midday for a rest, but I found that all the sights in Paris are spread out anyway--it is hard to pick a central spot. For our needs, the hotel was perfect. It is so nice to see such a well-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: 7n1dwarf
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and I was very pleased with my choice. Stayed at a double room with a balcony on the 5th floor. Hotel rooms are generally small in Paris anyway so I was prepared for the size. While small, the room was cozy and very clean. It had a fridge, a desk, a small closet, and a safe. The bathroom was modern and clean. The shower was amazingly good, especially after a long day roaming around Paris during a heat wave. I like the built-in hairdryer and the slippers that were provided. The only thing I found a little odd was the absence of shampoo but it was easy enough to remedy since there was a grocery/drugstore across the street from the hotel. Breakfast was substantial - croissants, rolls (the French make the best bread!), different jellies, yogurt, cereals, ham, cheeses, juices, coffee, and tea. Definitely enough to prepare you for a full day in the city. The location was good as it was about a block away from the Rue de Boulets stop on the 9 line. It was also about a 5-minute walk (or less, depending on your pace, in which case ours was leisurely) to Nation. Nation has both the RER and the regular metro lines to choose from. We found ourselves using mostly the 1 line (heading to La Defense) since they had stops going to the Musee d' Louvre, Champs Elysees, and other major areas of interest. The service was excellent and the staff, especially front desk/reception, spoke very good English. They did their best to accommodate our needs and requests - from providing converters to talking to our shuttle service for our ride back to the airport. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem | value and views in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: drjunkie
Reviews.Content: An amazing find, I would highly recommend this hotel and will be returning here on my next trip to Paris. Itâ€™s located in east central Paris near to Nation metro which is very convenient if you are coming from Gare Lyon (south) or Gare de Nord (north). The hotel has recently been redone and the common spaces and rooms are very modern and well appointed. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a balcony room on the 5th floor which providing sweeping views to the West down Avenue Voltaire. Our room also had three French doors leading out to a massive, wrap-around balcony where you could drink champagne (kept cold in the in-room fridge) while watching the sun set. Other highlights: -Very good shower -Continental breakfast included (in a very cramped space) -Friendly concierge -Walking distance to some good non-touristy restaurants -Free French and British papers -Slippers in the room PS - Make sure to touch the ceilings in the room!

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: sashamom
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay in a hotel for one night before our rental apartment became available and chose this one because of the great TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Although our room was tiny, it was spotlessly clean with a comfortable bed and great shower. The manager could not have been more accomodating, from storing our luggage until our room was ready, recommending restaurants, making us coffee the next morning as we did not make it downstairs in time for breakfast, and calling us a taxi to get to our apartment. This does not always happen at American hotels. If you stay here, try Les Gallopins restaurant a few blocks away. Excellent food and service, and filled mainly with local residents. And there's a wonderful bakery across the street for a coffee and croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Tres magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: choosereasonHawaii
Reviews.Content: It sits over on the East side of Paris in a lovely neighborhood...so quiet!! Service was impeccable..Professional yet friendly. I stayed two weeks and I hated to leave. I've never had an hotel do my ironing! The staff helped with traveling, how to say certain French phrases, and listened as you told about your great day! "greengodess" slammed the fact that it wasn't near good transportantion. Je me permits de! The Metro station was a few steps away on two central lines and by the second day I didn't need a map, I could just get on and go everywhere! I even went to Roland Garros for the French Open tennis tournament and never changed lines. Lovely, quiet hotel with incredible ambience and the best hotel staff ever!

Reviews.Title: “Small but very well kept”
Reviews.Author: T-Buggy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for 7 nights. The hotel is very modern and clean. I'd consider it to be more than 3 stars. The bed was very comfortable, great shower, walls are almost sound proof. Awesome wifi connections. Our room was a reasonable size for European standards -small but very cozy. Breakfast consist of: croissants, danishes, french rolls, variety of yogurts, many cheeses, cereals, ham & salami, juice, coffee & tea. The servers were super friendly. The hotel is in a good location, 2 minute away from the closest metro station that allows connections to all major must-go-to places. Streets are very quiet at night so you don't have to worry about noise. There are small grocery stores, brasseries, cafes, restaurants, boulangerie, pharmacies - all within a block radius. Would come and stay here in a heart beat. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Trad Paris hotel with better than usual service”
Reviews.Author: thegreengoddess
Reviews.Content: Nice choice for a Paris weekend - great service, rooms well furnished, free wifi, superior room had windows on 2 sides so lots of light, not noisy, air con, not much else you could ask for. Only downside is its location on the metro routes, which is not ideal, but then again only a 15 minute walk to Place de Bastille, so metro issue not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - warm, friendly and a perfect location to reach all the sights of central Paris”
Reviews.Author: jazzangel
Reviews.Content: We trusted the previous great reviews and it turned out to be even better than we expected. The welcome and service is second to none. We even found complimentary champagne in our room with a beautiful handwritten note when we happened to mention it was my husband's birthday. The rooms are spotlessly clean, the bed is blissfully comfortable and the hotel is very peaceful for a good night's sleep. If you are happy to walk, it is possible to walk in to central Paris from there if you are happy to sightsee on the way. However, there are plenty of Metro & RER stations around. One tip - if making your way from CDG, take the RER8 to Chatelet and then the RER2 to Nation, its much easier to negotiate the RER's with luggage as the Metro's ticket gates are fairly savage and don't give you enough space/time with bags before it trys to chop you in half! Look out for scams and pickpockets - it really does happen everywhere so wise up before you go. Merci Grand Hotel Francais for making our trip so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick61
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be excellent value, especially for Paris where room rates are notoriously high. It is a little out of the centre, but close to the Metro, so it wasn't a problem. The rooms were compact but smart and had everything we needed. The bathroom was smart and clean with an excellent shower. I found the bed very comfortable and although we had a room overlooking the street, we were not at all disturbed by traffic noise. Breakfast was good with good quality fruit juice, a range of fresh rolls and pastries and reasonable coffee. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all, I would recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Hotel Find - We Agree With All The Other Posts”
Reviews.Author: RickMIusa
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris >20 times over the last 30 years and tried all sorts of lodgings. This is the best thing we've found for reasonable rates, extremely nice desk people, great service, maps, advice, etc., etc. Location is great, about 100 meters (yards) from Metro Line 9 Rue des Boulets or if you want to walk a bit further to the Nation stop. This means you can reach anything in Paris or the surrounding area easily. Taxi from De Gaulle was ~24 Euros. One of the best things about the location is there is great food over on Rue Paul Bert (about 4 blocks away - ask at the desk). Bistro Paul Bert gets all the rave reviews but we were actually more impressed with Lâ€™Ecailler du Bistrot, 22 Rue Paul Bert which is next door. There are several other nice places on that street and a bunch of regular type bars down at the end of the street where all the traffic is. Great neighborhood. My only comment - which applies all over Europe - the main thing in a hotel should be the bed.......a bit better quality mattress would get you a lot of credit......this hotel is comparable with good French hotels.......but there is always something to improve upon......not a bit deal in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT END to our Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: Barking-Dog-Ranch
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on listing the wonderful things about this hotel and its staff. They did our laundry for free and had it folded and delivered to our room in the afternoon. The breakfast area serves a nice continental breakfast. The area around the hotel feels safe and very full of life! Metro is maybe 100 meters away. The bed (we had a king size) were wonderful and comfy. WiFi and TV and stereo in room ... terrific! All these things are what makes a great hotel, but what makes this one of the BEST hotels is the staff. From the chambermaid to especially the front desk staff. Everyone is wonderful and there to help. Would I stay here again? YOU BET. As a matter of fact, if I knew when my next trip to Paris was coming up, I would book my stay right now! Look no further for a hotel..... STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Super Place and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mmac1824
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be a part of the culture, this is a good choice for a number of reasons. The staff is EXCELLENT and treis very hard to make sure you get what you need. Excellent price point for Paris and allows for a quick ride via metro to all points of interest with relative ease. Zyad, the owner is a character and is sure to make your stay memorable. Best coffee ever!!!! To all future travelers, tell the owner Mr. & Mrs. "Checking In" referred you ! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: agarciaatrccl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais from May 14 to 22 because of the Tripadvisor reviews. We wanted a quiet, clean and comfortable location. The room (although small as is standard in Paris), the service, and the assistance (staff spoke several languages, including English) provided by everyone at the hotel, was excellent. While it is true that the hotel is far from the major attractions (approx. 20-25 min. by metro-including walk or a taxi ride), it is just a block or two from two major metro stops. The neighborhood had a nearby market and restaurants, was safe and enjoyable, and was quiet at night with the windows closed. Why I loved this hotel and the wonderful service: 1) We arrived at the hotel before check-in in the morning and they were able to check us in within Â½ hour which was greatly appreciated after our 9 Â½ hour flight from Miami. During our wait, we were offered coffee which was very welcoming. 2) The rooms are wonderful. The room had a safe, mini fridge, extremely comfortable beds, was refurbished, and had a great bathtub and shower with plenty of hot water. The room even had its own thermostat which was helpful one hot day when we arrived after our tour and needed to cool down. Housekeeping is excellent as the rooms were always extremely clean when we returned and nothing was out of place. 3) Although Iâ€™ve read several reviews about the breakfast price of 10 Euros per person being high, I believe it to be fair as the hotel offers coffee, orange and apple juice, fruit salad, a variety of cheeses and ham, pastries/bread, 2 cereals and yogurt for that price. 4) The restaurant recommendations provided by the staff are excellent. We went twice to Vin e Merree (not sure of the correct spelling) and had a wonderful experience each time. If you like fish and/or seafood, it is an excellent restaurant within 2 blocks from the hotel with fresh food and reasonably priced for the quality and Paris standards. 5) The pizza restaurant next to the hotel is much better than it appears to be. The staff is warm and friendly and the food fresh, especially tiramisu (excuse my spelling) desert. In summary, I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larry888
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Francais (two superior rooms) for six nights in May of 2010. We selected it after reading TripAdvisor's reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel is near the Nation metro line which has several lines running through it. It is even closer to a smaller line. So it is easy to reach anywhere in Paris within 30 minutes or less. The hotel has been completely refurbished. Our room and bath/shower were very nice ... a bit small but no less so than most European hotels. Breakfast was more than adequate and well worth the extra cost. And the staff were very helpful. They answered all our questions and helped us book tickets to the Eiffel Tower. Their dinner recommendations were spot on. They even made an extra effort to call the National Library for me to determine if a particular document (codex) was available for viewing or only to researchers. Net, they satisfied our every request. I highly recommend the hotel. But book in advance as it has only about 30 rooms and was full when we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, modern fresh decor and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: s_swift_2001
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for a two night city break from the UK in the jacuzzi suite room. We found the hotel very easy to find using the rer and metro station at nation and this was also a perfect base from which to explore the city as most lines either transit through or terminate here. As for the hotel it is clearly recently modernised to a high standard. The room was well furnished if somewhat small. However room size is standard for the city. the jacuzzi is a jetted bath tub but the roo is excelently furnished and came with a coplimentary bottle of chilled champange. Also breakfasts can be ordered to have in the room as something a bit more romantic and offer a base from which to launch your days. The hotel manager Zyad was welcoming and spoke several languages fluently. If there was something he didnt know about the city or place to visit or see he would search and ring around endlessly to find it. We wanted a special specific make of jewellery and were stuck as to where in te city we may find it. Zyad spent 30 minutes whilst balancing his working demands to locate a store which stocked it. Further to this his restaurant recomendations are excelent. Around the corner is a family run traditional restaurant called Gallopins which was reasonably priced and the quality, quantity and authenticty of the food and wine was second to none. All in all this is an excellent hotel,The staff are some of the best i have come across in all the travelling i have done. Would i go back........Definatly!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Grand Hotel Francais. It is a close walk to the metro which made it very easy to see Paris. The hotel is settled in a neighborhood with restaurants, a supermarket, and other shops. Our room was on the 6th floor and we had a great window overlooking the city streets. The rooms were nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms are small, but that is expected in Paris so I was not disappointed. I was traveling with my 4 year old daughter and the hotel staff was very helpful providing suggestions for things to do and see. We arrived to the hotel before check-in and they were able to check us in which allowed my daughter to rest before we went out for the day. Overall it was a great stay and we are going to Paris again in July and hoping to stay at the Grand Hotel Francais again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: bigeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on May 6th amd 7th. When we arrived early in the morning the manager greeted us very warmly and made us each a great cup of capuccino to welcome us. He then proceeded to give us guidance on what we could do that day. When we returned they provided us with an upgraded room at no charge which was absolutely beautiful. The area is excellent if you want to see the real Paris. You are not that close to the tourist attractions but it is very easy to get anywhere using the metro which is very close to the hotel. Overall, we were very please with this choice and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for what you get and where you are in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PeugeotUsa
Reviews.Content: Its a 500m walk to the main rail line and a 15 min ride down to the "main attractions" in Pairs... Small rooms but clean with great wait staff... For the price, can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just fine.”
Reviews.Author: dannykessel
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's first trip to Paris so we weren't too sure what to expect when it came to hotels, but we were satisfied. By reading all the reviews my expectations were very high. Unfortunately they didn't meet my escelated expectations, but the experience was still fine. The staff was average, nice and informative, just like any other hotel. The rooms were small yet nice...you don't need a big room when you are in Paris...you should be outside except to sleep. They were clean...housekeeping was alright...no shampoo/toothpaste. They wanted to charge us 10 Euros pp per day for breakfast, so we just walked to the local bakery every morning on the way to the metro and saved a bunch of money that way. The location was perfect, as before mentioned, 2 metro stations within walking distance and the Nation stop can get you anywhere from Disneyland to the airport to downtown. I probably would stay here next time, but I would spend a little extra time seeing if there were any other options in town first.

Reviews.Title: “Can't even say how grateful I am to have been stuck here during the Volcano!”
Reviews.Author: KimEandKarenM
Reviews.Content: For my first time in PARIS I couldn't ask for anything better! The hotel is in a nice neighborhood, close to the metro. Great restaurants recommended by the hotel. Definitely take their advise, they know what they're talking about. I've never taken the metro and don't speak French at all! I was told by hotel staff exactly where to go on the Metro, where to get on and off, where to shop, eat, etc. They were so friendly and so helpful. I was stuck in Paris for 2 more days due to the VOLCANO! They were on it trying to get us a train to Milano when my flight was cancelled! France was on a train strike and the front desk was checking every few hours to see when trains were going again. Not only for me but other guests too! They even tried to get my refund for the cancelled flight! Finally they got us on the next train to Zurich then to Milano and told me how to print tickets at the train station, basically everything I needed to do. Europe was a mess and they made the best out of the situation! They made sure we had a cab to the train station and had coffee ready for us at 5am when we woke up. You will have a great experience here. They are funny, kind, honest, and care about the guests. The rooms are small but modern and very clean!! Nice area to watch TV, wireless internet, good breakfast, I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “At times it was like being in a Peter Sellers movie”
Reviews.Author: Nosnom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on May 4 & 5, 2010. This was a nice hotel, but our room was so small it was almost funny. We were in room 31. Ask for something bigger, if they have it. Pros: Wonderful, warm, friendly, and very helpful staff. The hotel was modern, very clean & contemporary. It had that "Ikea" look. Our room was very well lit, and was actually very quiet for being on a busy street. It is located very near a metro stop. The hotel includes a continental breakfast-- but no hot food. Cons: I don't know what all the rooms are like, but ours was VERY small. We had 5-6 ft. either side of the bed, and 2 ft. at the end of the bed. That's it. The bathroom really did have a great shower. However, sitting on the toilet would be a challenge for anyone over 5 1/2 ft. tall because one's knees would hit the sink cabinet. The room had a mini bar and a flat screen TV attached to the wall, but no clock or radio. The bed and pillows were very sturdy, not at all cushy. I would recommend staying here (at least in room 31) only to people traveling alone, or with one other person to whom they are VERY close and don't mind bumping into constantly. There was no place for luggage in this room. Anything more than carry-on size bags are really in the way.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: walvis32
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in april. It's clean and the rooms look nice and stylish. I didn't plan to write a review but when I red the review with the title 'Very average hotel' I decided otherwise because of the many errors in that text. + The metrostop isn't 30-40 minutes outside the main parts of Paris. You need only about ten minutes. + I spoke English with the staff. They were all very nice and helpfull, especially the manager Ziad. (As stated in the review titled 'Fantastic experience'.) + I found the neigbourhood very nice and didn't feel unsafe. If you stay here I can recommand the little wine bar on the first or second side street on your left when you walk to the metrostation 'Nation'. The bar is called Po.za.da. It's very authentic and they also serve good food for almost nothing. I have recommended this hotel allready to a friend and maybe I'll return this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ang3
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect for us. Spotlessly clean, very comfortable and in a lovely part of Paris although not that close to main attractions the metro's were very close. The staff were most helpful and very friendly at all times. The breakfasts were lovely and set us all up for the days ahead. I would definitely stay here again if I were to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: iheartusc
Reviews.Content: After reading all the raving reviews for this hotel, I have to admit I came with high expectations. However, I was quite underwhelmed by my experience. I wouldnâ€™t say that there was necessarily anything terribly wrong with the hotel, however, I do not feel it deserved quite the amount of praise that is has received. First of all, while the hotel is located close to a metro stop, the stop is a good 30-40 minutes outside of the main parts of Paris where many of the tourist attractions are located. You need to plan at least an hour for travel into the heart of the city. The hotel staff was either indifferent or condescending with the exception of one very friendly night clerk. They appeared to disapprove of our inability to speak French and did not seem to appreciate our meager attempts. While the surrounding neighborhood did offer a wide variety of eateries, I did not feel very safe wandering its streets after dark. Overall, there wasnâ€™t anything particularly wrong with the hotel. However, having traveled extensively across Europe, I donâ€™t believe I would put this at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine until last day - manager/owner extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: Juniegirl
Reviews.Content: First of all, my husband and I are middle aged seasoned travelers. We stayed in Paris at this hotel for 4 nights after being in Amsterdam for 5 nights. This hotel, although a bit out of the way, with, as expected, small rooms, was extremely clean and well cared for. We made out way around on the Metro to and from the hotel very easily. The front desk staff at the hotel during our entire stay were very pleasant except for the last day. On the day that we were checking out, a fire alarm sounded, not once, but twice in the hotel. I could not reach the front desk for any information (no answer to several calls), nor did any staff member of the hotel try and contact the guests with information. I had just gotten out of the shower, and did not know what I should do. Without any information being disseminated by the hotel staff, after the second fire alarm, I quickly dressed and made my way down the 5 flights of stairs only to finally come upon a staff member who told me there was not a fire in the hotel. Upon check-out, I happened to ask the manager/owner if they did not have a way of contacting guests in the event of a fire alarm, and his temper just took off. He started yelling at me "What can I say, we are a French hotel with bad service" When I tried to calm him down and say that is not what I was saying, but just trying to tell him that it was frightening not to know what to do in the event of a fire alarm sounding twice, and no response from the hotel staff, he continued on with his tirade. He went on about how he had two children and had not had a holiday in 8 months, he had not taken a salary last month etc etc. When I asked him why he insinuated that I was saying it was a bad hotel with bad service, he told me that "It was a joke". Believe me when I say, there was nothing funny about how I was addressed as a guest of his hotel. He then told me that since I was so dissatisfied that he was going to refund the entire 4 night stay to my credit card. I told him that I was not looking for that, and did not expect not to pay for what was otherwise a fine stay. In fact I tried twice to dissuade him from doing so. At this point, he was more interested in continuing his tirade at me, as opposed to listening to what I was saying. A simple acknowledgment of my concerns was all that I was looking for - that being that it was frightening to be in the hotel room alone (my husband had gone out for coffee), and having nobody answer the phone at the front desk to let the guests know what was going on. Instead, my concerns, and what could have been helpful feedback in the event that the fire alarm was accidently sounded again, was dismissed with a credit of 500 Euros. The last words out of his mouth were, "I've given you a credit, and you still are not happy - All I can do now is shoot myself in the head" I did not speak to him rudely, not did I raise my voice once, even though he was yelling at me in front of another guest for what went on for 5 minutes. It really made the end of an otherwise great trip awful and can honestly say that I will not return to Paris for a long, long time if ever, and never to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: thomassino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for a couple of nights in April 2010. I found the staff very helpful and he rooms were clean and well set up for a three star hotel. The breakfast was a pleasant surprise as I have received 'toast & jam' only as a continental breakfast. The breakfast at the Grand Hotel Francais was quite comprehensive and there was enough available to fill any stomach! There were two Metro stops within easy walking distance to the hotel. The Rue de Boulets was the closest stop - only about 100 metres down the road. Free wireless internet was included and proved to be very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly sleepy neighborhood but outstanding hotel experience more than worth it!”
Reviews.Author: jsbalach
Reviews.Content: We changed to this hotel midway through a two-week stay in Paris, and though the first hotel was a 4-star, this "3-star" hotel felt MUCH more luxurious! Location is decent, in the 11th arr. Kind of a sleepy neighborhood but one block from the Rue de Boulet (sp?) metro stop and a 10 min walk to the larger Nation stop. Also a very pleasant 10-15 min walk to the Bastille/ Marais location. Just on the other side of town from the museums, Eiffel, Arc, etc. But not really an issue because the metro stop is so close. Front desk is excellent- very helpful and cheerful. Rooms have great modern feel and though smallish (very good by Parisian standard) feel spacious. We were graciously upgraded from a standard to a superior room. Bed was REALLY comfortable and there is A/C in all rooms! Thoughtful free bottle of water and two cans of Perrier in the fridge, which is also nice and empty for the fruits and cheese you will probably buy (not full of crappy/ expensive liquor you won't drink)! and big plus- FREE WIFI in your room! (you just have to get the code to login to the password protected connection from the front desk)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Fantastic, Fantastic......”
Reviews.Author: JaneySue
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 3 day mini stay in this hotel and ended staying for 8 nights due to the recent Volcano activity, what an absolute fantastic hotel. The staff, particularly Zyad were brilliant through what was a difficult time with cancellations and extended stays needed at short notice. The rooms were perfect, the breakfast a fabulous way to start the day and the location near Nation and Rue De Boluttes Metro stations was excellent. We would recommend this hotel to anyone for either a first trip to Paris or a return visit. Thank you so much for the recommendations on Trip Advisor which helped us choose this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Even better value for money.”
Reviews.Author: hoosenpoon
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel at short notice following the cancellation of our flight home after a holiday in Southern Europe. Located on Boulevard Voltaire, the metro (Rue de Boulets) is a 25 metre walk. On the metro you can reach the main 'sights' in about 10-15 minutes without the need to change trains. There is a small supermarket opposite the hotel and there are numerous patisseries, boulangeries, cafe's, and bars all along the street. I recommend Nani's patisserie if you have a sweet tooth! The rooms are a reasonable size for a Parisien hotel and have clearly been renovated recently. They were clean and tidy and we received some complimentary drinks upon arrival. In our room we had two wardrobes, a desk, stool, chair and a fridge. Having travelled with some difficulty across Europe we were delighted to find out that the hotel offers free wi-fi internet access and also a free laundry service. The front of house staff were also very pleasant and dealt with our enquiries quickly and effectively. We thought that the hotel itself is great value for money paying just over Â£120 per night. I think we'd definitely use it again if we returned to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb”
Reviews.Author: ClaireyCro
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't possibly be able to praise this hotel enough to match up to the service received, the cleanliness of the hotel, the rooms and so on!! My partner booked this hotel for a trip to Paris for my birthday, it is right on a metro station literally a few mins walk away so even though some people may say that its slightly outside of the centre it really doesn't matter as the metro is so easy to use and it never took us very long to get anywhere, when we went into the hotel we were greeted by extremely friendly staff who accommodated all of our needs, we were given a room on the top floor which was absolutely lovely and the staff were so helpful!! The owner knew the answers to every single question we asked and even booked us a fabulous restaurant designed by Phillipe Starck overlooking the river for my birthday meal. Our flight was then cancelled on the Friday due to the issues with the Iceland Volcano and they were more than accommodating told us to ring them from the airport if it was cancelled and they will sort us a room out to return to the hotel, we did exactly that and they even upgraded our room for our additional 2 night stay. When our flights were cancelled again on the Saturday they allowed us access to their internet late at night as we didn't have a laptop with us to allow us to find an alternative route home. All in all an excellent stay and if only all hotels could match up to the standards of the Grand Hotel Francais there would never be a negative review on here!! If you are going to stay in Paris believe me stay here!! :)

Reviews.Title: “C'est formidable!”
Reviews.Author: NandDP
Reviews.Content: This Hotel should not be #7 on your top Paris Hotels list - it should be in the top 3! A really great little family run hotel. Extremely hospitable and helpful staff, spotless dining-room and bedroom and excellent breakfast. Book with confidence if you are happy to stay in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect minimoon!”
Reviews.Author: Chica_Escocesa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a mini honeymoon based on the other reviews from Trip advisor and was not disappointed! The hotel is located 2min walk from rue des boulets metro station which is great to use for seeing the sights. The rooms were small but you don't go toParis to stay in the hotel room! They have all you need: free safety deposit box, fridge, hair dryer, large flat screen tv... list goes on! Also, they were very clean. Breakfast was usual continental style and plentiful. The most impressive aspect of this hotel is the staff - very polite and helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephTravelin
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel out where the real Parisian's live. Or at least that is what we were told. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We upgraded to a room with two twin beds. Very much worth it if you are traveling with a friend. The room was tiny but had a charming little balcony. It is a little far from the touristy things if that is what you are looking for. But it is close to several metro stops, there is a chocolatier, a boulangerie, and a market right across the street. If you find yourself there on a Sunday head over to the outdoor market, Marche d'Aligre and the keep going over to Le Marias area. Le Marias is one of the few shopping areas open on Sundays. It is great for people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Weary Business Travelers - We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: vinyrdlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for a week in March. We were on business and were budget concious but still wanted a nice property. Based on other reviews we booked here. The GM - Si Zyad is a gem. And he runs a tight ship! We arrived prior to check-in time, but he welcomed us with a cup of coffee and delightful conversation (perfect English!) and our room was ready in no time. His staff people are excellent...from the desk staff to the housekeeping, everyone was warm, friendly and professional. We worked the entire trip putting in very long days and were welcomed each evening like we were being welcomed home. The hotel had been renovated recently and is a beautiful, cozy French hotel. Everything is very modern but with an art deco feel. Loved the shower! The location is not right in the heart of old Paris, but the Metro is a quick walk in either direction.
