When we called for a taxi it was usually waiting before we even made it out of the elevator. There are plenty of wonderful places to eat right around the hotel. Si Zyad and his staff are well versed at what is in the area. As a small business owner I was happy to find and patronize a family run operation and not a big chain hotel. Si Zyad's family have been hoteliers for three generations...and it shows. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Zhukov
Reviews.Content: Very well placed hotel for basing yourself for a city break to Paris. Nearest Metro station Rue de Boulets approx 50m from hotel. Very well appointed rooms with dark wood chrome and glass very much in the style of Apex hotels. Room and bathroom not overly big but did'nt spend that much time awake in it. Breakfast is continental but plenty of choice and eat all you want. The staff were excellent and dealt with all my queries regarding how to get to attractions opening times and recommended an excellent restaurant for our first night (see review for La Galopins). Very good value and highly recommended. Easy access from Charles de Gaulle airport by the 351 coach straight to Place de Nation 300m away or 1 stop by metro.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: neelsv
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week European tour and stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for 3 nights in March. It was perfect for our needs - very comfortable and great location. We were mainly sightseeing and it was the ideal hotel, easy to get to all the main areas in Paris and good value. We booked because of the reviews on TA and were not disappointed Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Albowitsch
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Hotel: the rooms were freshly renovated, the Staff is more than helpful and friendly and the location is ideal to visit all the sightseeing highlights. Metro is reachable in 5 minutes... We would stay there again- for sure..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMMScotland
Reviews.Content: Difficult to be totally objective as I was upgraded to a suite when I arrived. Wonderful! Good to know how the other half live! However, I don't think I would have been disappointed if this hadn't happened. Staff were welcoming and helpful - recommendations for good restaurants nearby were spot on. Location is great - a pleasant, elegant area - just a couple of minutes to the nearest metro . Good breakfast. Can't think of any reason for not going back!

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: shrbenne
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais took care of every need I had. Despite the amazing reviews that Trip Advisor had given to the Grand Hotel Francais, I still didn't believe that the room would be everything that I needed. I kept seeing posts regarding various hotels in Paris that noted how small the rooms were, so I was really expecting something almost unliveable for the seven days that I had planned on staying at the hotel. The room, however, was perfect and all my fears were laid to rest. I had plenty of storage to unpack two suitcases full of belongings. My room was emaculately cleaned everyday. The bed was extremely cozy. I never felt like the room was too small. It was really perfect for just me. The hotel is not near most of the sites, aside from PÃ¨re Lachaise cemetary. However, the metro is so easy to figure out that it really doesn't matter. The distance from all of the main attractions did not slow me down at all. I was very happy with the location. I thought it was truly perfect. The front desk clerks were amazing. They were happy to help me in any way I needed, and even though the friends that I travelled with did not stay at that hotel (except for one night), the hotel clerks graciously assisted my friends with all of their questions (which I thought was extremely kind of the hotel staff and very rude of my companions). Everyone spoke at least a little English, if not fluent English, which was very important since I do not speak French. The staff called a taxi when I needed one, they confirmed my shuttle to the airport, they answered questions about the metro and Paris in general, etc. The breakfast was also very nice. Having breakfast at the hotel allowed me to just ease into my morning before I started running all over Paris sightseeing for the day. The staff was truly amazing. I'm hoping to take a trip back to Paris next year, and when I do, I fully intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: jcrp
Reviews.Content: Before booking an hotel in Paris, we did extensive research. The reviews on Grand Hotel Francais were very good. It certainly was an excellent choice. The hotel is extremely clean. The breakfast was good. The staff were on the ball and filled up constantly which we found quite fantastic as this does not happen so often in hotels and certainly not so promptly. They had a good variety. The location is great as well. A few minutes walk from the metro station Nation. One can travel on a number of lines from here. On the weekends parking in the streets behind the hotel is free, but is not always available. The hotel also recommends a parking garage which is close by. All in all - this hotel comes highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Value for money, great location, clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: Neilg08050
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, stopped for 3 nights in late February this year. Room is big enough, really clean, well decorated and in quiet area. Staff are really friendly and the buffet breakfast is excellent. Would highly recommend as a base for a trip to Paris. Close to Bastille area for young people looking for a great night out. I would only stay here when I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: eglagowski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February. The hotel is modern and clean, the staff is very friendly and eager to help, and it's on a main road close two 2 metro stations and the RER station. The location is a little out of the main center of the city, so it feels more like a "local" area. Lots of great restaurants within a 2-minute walk, including the Italian place next door. The rooms are a little small, but average for a Paris hotel and very comfortable. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, newly renovated, great staff - quite a find!”
Reviews.Author: ProfessAW
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to hotel from CDG via the metro. Hotel was about .3 of a mile from the Nation metro stop, a major stop. Not close to the major tourist sites but easy to get to them via metro. Lots of bakeries and small restaurants on the street and close. In a safe area. Staff was very friendly, spoke English and was eager to help. Just great people! Rooms were small but clean, newly renovated and quite classy. Shower was glorious! Color scheme was even inviting. Elevator in the building. Plush towels. Good view from balcony. Curtains blocked the sun in the morning nicely. Very happy we stayed here. Would definitely stay again. Thank you to the front desk staff who helped us a lot!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bill1982Greece
Reviews.Content: excellent staff, clean and modern rooms. location is a bit far from tourist attractions but very close to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: beckaboo312
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Francais for three nights in June. Having booked the room online without any personal references, we were trepidatious about staying a ways out from the center of the city. Our minds were put at ease as soon as we arrived. It was about 8:00 in the morning- we weren't really expecting to be allowed to check in so early, just to leave our bags, but the man at the front desk insisted on having the house keeper clean our room next... sure enough, within about 30 minutes we were in our 5th-floor corner room. GREAT service! The room was very clean, spacious by city standards and on a quiet street where you don't feel so much like a tourist. I had packed the wrong electrical adapter and the front desk as again happy to accommodate, offering me one, free of charge to use. When we needed a corkscrew, we were given one-- oh, and they insisted we even borrow proper wine glasses instead of using our room's water glasses. We definitely felt at home! The hotel is just a couple blocks from the Metro and getting around town is a snap. With all the benefits of staying there, we didn't mind a bit! The restaurants around the hotel were great-- there's a wine shop in the square near the Metro where the owner spoiled us with tastings for over an hour! If you've heard Paris is an unfriendly place, stay here and visit the area-- the hospitality and warmth of the people will definitely impress! **PARIS TIP: Take a Night Tour with Fat Tire. It was hands-down the highlight of our stay in paris. Sunset ride through sparkling Paris and an evening cruise down the Seine, complete with wine from your tour guide! Probably one of the most magical nights of our lives!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and immaculately presented.”
Reviews.Author: Verm
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced. The hotel is immaculate and the rooms are tastefully decorated. The staff are friendly and helpful. The included continental breakfast is perfectly nice. Our room was a little small, but suited our needs perfectly. The en-suite was perfect with a superb shower. Located 100m from the Metro, with all the sights a short ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: daisygirltravels
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be of great value, with friendly staff that were always willing to assist you in any way they could, rooms were comfortable and clean and breakfast was good. There were shops nearby to buy food and any general things you needed. Metro was a 2 minute walk away, so very handy to access public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality, low price, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: steiny100
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Grand Hotel Francais. It's the quality and the great service from that staff that made it so nice to visit. The rooms are on the smaller side, but everything is high quality, very clean and very comfortable. We also had some special needs from the concierge that was taken care of very quickly. They remembered us throughout our trip, and seemed to predict our requests at time. The room itself had very comfortable beds with nice linens. Enough closet space for us, and beautiful bathrooms. The TV was definitely not as big as I'm used to at US hotels, but it had CNN and BBC that allowed us to catch up with the world. We were within a 5 minutes walk of many major Metro lines, and it was very convenient to get almost anywhere is Paris via Metro. The street the hotel is on has a good number of restaurants and cafes, and it was fun to stroll along the street. If you don't want to pay to stay in the heart of Paris, but want a great room with easy access to the sights, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: toolpot Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good position only 2 mins from metro station, near the centre of Paris, althogh the rooms are on the small side they are very well appointed with modern furnishings and spotless. The continental breakfast is a nice start to the day and the staff were very helpful. I will definatly stop here again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetbay
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in Paris for my 50th birthday and were delighted we chose this hotel. The staff were so welcoming, friendly, and ready to help. When the gentleman on the desk discovered I did not like lifts, he immediately transferred us from the 5th to the 1st floor without us having to ask. He also gave us a list of recommended restuarants and we loved the first one we tried (Chez Prosper) so much that we went there twice. The room, though very small, was spotlessly clean and comfortable. The free wifi was a bonus. Breakfast was lovely - we ate too many of the fresh apple pastries! Again the service at breakfast was cheerful and friendly. The location is slightly out of centre which suited us fine. The area was safe, lively and had a good selection of shops and restuarants, without being too touristy or over priced. We walked and walked, but the metro/RER station at Nation was just 5 minutes walk away, giving good connections to the centre of Paris, the left bank and La Defense. Ok - if you want to be in a short walk of the Eiffel Tower or the Champs Elysees, this is not the place for you, but this area has much more character and far more to offer. We have stayed in other hotels in Paris, but this is by far our favourite and we will stay here again next time we return to Paris. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable modern hotel with great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Smiler10London
Reviews.Content: Unfortunate disorganised and unhelpful arrival i.e. the receptionist could not find our booking on the computer - but did not tell us what was happening - eventually she said our booking was for the Grand Francais Hotel not the Grand Hotel Francais - so we called the hotel number on our reservation slip and she answered the phone - so yes we were in the right hotel! We had to do the ringing round to the internet travel agency to find out why our booking was not registering on their computer etc etc - finally we got through and it seemed the fault was with the travel agent the hotel use and the internet reservations company we booked via. Rather than waste anymore of our holiday time, we had a freshen up in the bathroom, left our bags and went for lunch on our return within 1 hour the agent had confirmed our booking. We felt the matter could have been handled better. Nevertheless, the other hotel staff were delightful including Zyad the manager, the very helpful cleaning and breakfast staff. The rooms are tiny but clean, comfortable and modern (although a little business looking) there were no extras like showercaps/tissues in the bathroom. Would recommend the ladies take their own hairdryer - i.e. silly hose thingy in the bathroom would not dry a normal head of hair any time soon. No minibar but an empty fridge which was very handy for our chocolate and drinks. The location was a little further out from where we normally stay as we like to go to restaurants in the latin quarter by St Michel but the choice of the RER from Nation to Chatelet les Halle just two stops or the Metro Roulet was very convenient. Locally we found a lovely bar Cafe Bonale enroute back from Nation to hotel from station on same side as Hotel which had a fab 4 piece jazz band playing on the Friday night - much cheaper drinks for a nightcap! (Tip: Even cheaper if you order and sit at the bar!) Recommend it for a b & b comfortable stay - must be nice to be welcomed by the lovely Zyad - who we met later and was very friendly, helpful and apologetic about our booking mix up - although not the hotel's fault. If want a peaceful quiet room ask for one at the back. We had a lovely time despite the mix up on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdinfl
Reviews.Content: You never know for sure what the hotel will be like until you're there. This charming family owned hotel, while a bit away from major stuff, is 200 feet from a metro stop which will lead to anywhere in Paris. The rooms look in person as nice as the hotel's web site photos. But what makes this place work is the charming, dedicated third generation hotelier who is the general manager/heart of the operation. He chats, advises,makes reservations and is just all around gracious. Thank you Si Zyad.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only hotel for your Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: Martycc
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be first on your list to consider when visiting Paris. I went with my wife for her birthday and we loved every minute. The location of the hotel is excellent. out of the centre but right next to major metro routes which will get you everywhere in the city very quickly. The hotel is very clean and modern, wonderful rooms, comfortable beds and the staff are very friendly and approachable. Upon arrival the manager was at the desk who was immediately aware of who we were an when we came from. He immediately offerred us free breakfast for my wife's birthday and we were given a room upgrade. Every time we saw the manager and staff the conversation was pleasant and fun I really cannot recommend this hotel enough. I will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great little hotel and fantastic value!!”
Reviews.Author: burnside43
Reviews.Content: I booked this for my wifes 30th birthday and we travelled with another couple, its very easy to get to from the airport (take the B line into Paris change at Chatlet de Halles onto the red line and get of at Nation). The hotel was modern and very clean, and the staff were wonderful and I truly mean that, they were friendly, helpful and polite. We asked for any restaurants that they could recommend near the hotel because I had read a review on here which had mentioned that they had done this and any that we visited were lovely. The rooms are modern but small (although this size seems to be the norm for Paris), our friends were also very happy with there room. The hotel is great and very well served by the metro with a major RER metro station only 5 min walk down the street (Nation) there are closer stations but we found that we used Nation most because it was on one of the major metro lines. The breakfast was very nice. All in all this is a wonderful hotel and fantastic value compared to the others I looked at, and we really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: jonedwards80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights for our 5th Wedding Anniversary at the Grand Hotel Francais. Could not have been happier with the hotel or the location. The small, but well appointed rooms were perfect for us and the included breakfast was just great. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. A special thank you to the manager who organised a bottle of champagne on our arrival to celebrate our anniversary! We shall return :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accommodations Away From City Center”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hotel Francais in October 2009 for the first three nights of my trip. I chose the hotel based upon its TA ranking and a good deal I found on hotels.com. Since this was my fifth trip to Paris, I wasn't so concerned about staying somewhere in the heart of the city. While the hotel is located a few steps away from Rue de Boulets stop on the #9 line, I found this was a location that required multiple transfers on the Metro. I was given a room on the top floor with lovely views of the streets below. All in all, this was a comfortable hotel with modern furnishings that I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to someone not visiting Paris for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobbyboy32
Reviews.Content: For a small hotel, the staff and the condition of the hotel are excellent. The staff from the manager down could not have been more helpful and made our short stay in Paris very enjoyable. We would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to other visitors to Paris and when we visit Paris again will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ImprezaGirl
Reviews.Content: We just got married in the beginning of December and decided to have our honeymoon in Paris. The hotels near the city was kind of pricey and after much research on tripadvisor, we landed at Grand Hotel Francais. We're glad we found this hotel. We arrived early and the gentlemen at the front desk was really nice. He allowed us to leave our luggage at the hotel until check in was available (around 2:30PM). We toured around the area and came back a little early and the room was already ready for us. We forgot to purchase foreign adapters for our laptop and the hotel provided one for us for the stay... really nice of them~! The wireless connect would work fine in the morning and afternoon, but towards the evening we would lose connectivity quite often. The hotel is conveniently located near a metro stop (closest metro: Rue des Boulets) and within' walking distance are many restaurants. We've tried out several restaurants in the area and I have to say the Pizza place next to the hotel was the best. Right across the street is a grocery store, but many places around the area close around 7PM (as with everywhere else in Paris, except for restaurants). With a couple (1-2) of transfers, you can visit practically everywhere in Paris. We ended up getting the all day RATP metro pass (for about 5.90 Euros per person) and traveled almost everywhere in Paris. Be careful when you travel into the city, there will be lots of beggars and people trying to sell you stuff. Just say no and walk away and they will leave you alone. The hotel is clean, but really small. However, we figured most of our time will be spent touring around Paris, so the small room didn't bother us. We had a nice balcony view on the 5th floor. There is only one elevator for the hotel, which is really small as well. So if you're on the lower levels, I suggest taking the stairs (be careful b/c they're really narrow), instead of waiting for the elevator. Housekeeping did a great job maintaining our room. We never received a do not disturb sign, so housekeeping can range anywhere from 10AM or later. We also received free continental breakfast with our stay, which was great! They had a wide range of bread and cheese and some meat. They also had cereal, yogurt, juice and fruits. It was a great way to start off the day. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and would definitely stay here again if we ever visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than reviewed”
Reviews.Author: st_ansgar_84-88
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the excellent reviews we read on Travel Advisor. The hotel was even better than what the reviews stated. The rooms, their cleanliness, and the services are excellent. Special, special compliments to Zyad, the hotel manager. His committment to the guests was extraordinary. You can count on him to provide first-rate, dedicated service to any of your needs or requests. We travel a great deal, but we have never experienced the exceptionally friendly, generous, informative, and helpful service we received from him and his staff. Our stay at the hotel significantly contributed to our Paris experience. If you want extravagant luxury, go elsewhere. If you want a most comfortable hotel with personal and excellent service, at a great-deal price, in an up-and-coming area of Paris, call/email Zyad for your reservations. We won't bother to search for another place when we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Bones2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 days over Christmas (23-31 Dec 2009). Hotel service wonderful. Staff entremely courteous and helpful. Rooms wonderful and newly refinished. Location great with Metro less than a block away and Nation 2 blocks away. 3 bakeries within 2 blocks, 3 Pharmacies within 3 blocks, 2 grocery stores directly across the street. Many many resturants in the same radius. Significany department sores 3 blocks away close to Nation. Great place to call home for a Paris stay. Recoommend it for consideration anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good average for Paris but nothing to rave about either !!!”
Reviews.Author: bambaSydney
Reviews.Content: I am French and used to the very average hotel quality in France therefore when I choose a hotel in France I usually go on foreign feedback ....as they are more critical. I had a 2 days trip to do in Paris and I chose this hotel because of the location and obviously the feedback. Finding a decent hotel in Paris under 150 Euro a night when you are a single traveler is nearly impossible therefore I was hooked on this hotel. I will start by the downside. The room are renovated therefore to standard you would expect for a 3 stars but VERY VERY small. Basically there is less then 1 metre around the double bed...so if there is 2 of you it is quickly "small" but for 1 or 2 nights its ok. The breakfast roomis underground...so if you feel clostrophobic well....don't have breakfast there. Now on the positive side, the hotel feels new (its has been totally renovated...and typical French style there is still some bits of the renovation left in the entrance hall,...why would you do that when you just did such a good job...) . The batroom are small but really nice and very modern. The wireless is great and powerfull and the breakfast is plenty. The entrance is also nice you can have a drink there or wait for people whilst consulting the internet (providing you have your own laptop obviously). As the room are so small its actually a nice place to use if you have a bit of time on your had waiting..... The hotel is also very convenient near the metro and the RER. All in all I would recomend this hotel as for Paris (I have tried many hotels there during the years) its actually surprisingly good value for money as long as you know what to expect i.e a very small room but adequate for 2 nights or so.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and good value, but slightly overrated”
Reviews.Author: kuu-kanko
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on the reviews here. Perhaps the hotel is a bit overrated here - it is good, but after all, it's a 3 star hotel on the French rating. The hotel is elegant and recently refurbished. The service is warm and they have printed a map of recommended restaurants in the area. Although the hotel itself is a metro trip away from the city center, the area has a lot of restaurants with everything ranging from fast food to fine dining. We found the small room to be the biggest downside. The room is not much bigger than the double bed in it. It's ok for just sleeping a night, but with two persons in the room it started to feel small on the next day. The TV is probably a flat screen model, because there would be no room for an older TV :) There was a safe in the room, but no water boiler (which would have been nice on cold days). A complimentary bottle of water and two soft drinks were waiting in the minibar. The bathroom was nice and of decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Great character and a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Smileymelissa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its rating in trip advisor, and were pleased with our decision. We were made very welcome when we arrived, and were upgraded to a corner room which has views out of three large windows and more floor space. The bed was very comfortable, and the new decoration not only very well finished but also rather intriguing with what appears to be stretched wallpaper as well as stretched rubber ceilings. The overall effect is very stylish and comfortable. Although a little out of town, there are underground stations nearby which make it very accessible. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly return here!”
Reviews.Author: josiewitchgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights, but the day before we were leaving for Paris, my husband got the flue. We had to cancel 2 of the 3 nights, and allthough the hotel let us know we had to pay for 1 of those cancelled nights since there is an 48hours cancellation policy, in the end they only charged us our one night we actually stayed there + a small advance payment, wich was a really nice gesture of them. The hotel looks like it has recently been renovated, and our room felt luxurious (it was just a standard room), decorated with a lot of good taste and new. For Paris standards, it was very big, and we had three windows looking out over the city and a small balcony. I really liked those small extra touches of hospitality, like a welcome drink in the fridge and the slippers in the bathroom. There is free wifi, wich is great, but it didn't work properly some of the time. The bathroom was more then large enough and very nice. The location is great, there is a metro station right at the front door and you can get anywhere in 10 minutes time. There are a lot of bars, restaurants and shops at walking distance. The hotel as a really friendly feel to it, staff being helpfull and polite at all times, making you feel welcome. Breakfast is more then ok, with fresh pastries, fruit salad, cereals, bread,... This was certainly the best hotel in Paris I ever staid in, very good value for money, and I will certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “hospitality at its best!”
Reviews.Author: dammers44
Reviews.Content: Great location, great attention to service, refurbished with great taste! a parisian hotel worth knowing!

Reviews.Title: “Compact and bijou!”
Reviews.Author: tiadoll
Reviews.Content: Three words describe this hotel perfectly - compact and bijou. The service in the hotel was superb. Second to none. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was compact but didn't feel cramped at all. The decor was modern and the room ws well laid out. The en suite was also quite small but again, very well laid out and comprised a bath, shower, basin and toilet. Everything was very clean and fresh. The hotel is situated on Rue Voltaire, just down from Place de la Nation. Transport links are excellent with Nation and Rue de Boulets Metro stations practically on your doorstep. All in all, a little gem of a hotel and the nicest staff we've encountered in a long time. Would definitely stay again. C'est magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful room, unsurpassed service. The best in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnyMontreal
Reviews.Content: I was so relieved when we got to this hotel. After staying in various places throughout Lorraine and Alsace, we were glad to be back to a full functioning hotel. Internet connection is often advertized but sometimes not effective when it cuts out all the time, and sometimes service in certain hotels leaves to be desired. Well, this place was worth every penny. The staff was absolutely warm, friendly, helpful, courteous. The place was super clean, and modern. The area (11e arrondissement) is now my favorite area in Paris. (I already stayed in the 7e, too touristy especially when it comes to food.) At this hotel, you can enjoy Paris as a local. A few steps from the metro, near excellent restaurants, cafes, post office, grocery store (right in front), Pere Lachaise cemetery, Musee des Arts et Metiers, close to hip Marais district, and yet, quiet, and not full of tourists. The staff was very helpful with anything we needed (restaurant reservations, maps) and cordial, polite, and one staff member just seemed so happy working in a hotel. This is truly my new home away from home, and made me fall in love with the 11e arrondissment enough to want to move there! (Check out nearby restaurants: le Chardenoux, and others, 6 minutes walk from the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: ParisSheraton
Reviews.Content: We (four adults - 2 rooms) stayed here last month. We were looking for a cheaper option with our package but were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the breakfasts were excellent and cleanliness was good too. We were expecting to find it difficult to get around the city from that location but found it easy and the local area also has some interesting markets etc. The nearby restaurant recommended to us by the hotel was excellent. I should mention that the rooms are small but if you are out most of the time that is no problem. Thank you, Grand Hotel Francais

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with first class service”
Reviews.Author: Poppycocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been totally refurbished this summer and is clean and bright with modern fittings. The rooms are tastefully decorated, with up to date bathrooms. The reception are very welcoming. Nothing was too much trouble e.g. when phoning to make reservations for restaurants and entertainment. We were celebrating my wife's birthday and the owner brought out a bottle of champagne on the house! This is a first class hotel at a very reasonable price. It is well situated in a quieter area, but only 15 mins by 2 main Metro/RER lines to the main sights. I would have no hesitation in booking it again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good find and good value”
Reviews.Author: Brisie_on_the_move
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the Rue des Boulets metro and walking distance to Nation so its easy to find, and close to Gare de Lyon train station. The hotel has been renovated recently and the room was very nice, clean and with a very stylish bathroom (great shower). There was 3 complimentary drinks in the fridge which was a nice touch and breakfast was included in our price. We stayed alot around Saint Germain des Pres and so would look for a hotel in that area next time we are in Paris - however, this hotel was good for visiting Bastille, Pere Lachaise and Sacre Coeur. It was also easy to get into the city and only a 10 euro cab ride home (metro stops at 2).

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: Thor666Uk
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this quiet friendly hotel. The amenities were great as was the cleanliness breakfast and customer service. La Bastille can be an over looked area but it was a great experience living in this area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the city”
Reviews.Author: Mayura
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for about 5 days. The hotel looks a little out of place - the modern sliding doors were all glass and did not suit the rest of the buildings. The elevator was quite small as were the rooms. However we got the corner room and it was pretty good for two ppl. We were able to separate the beds and the a/c worked quite well. There was free laundry service if you provide a bag. That was awesome. Most places overcharge for this service. Breakfast was included and it was a continental breakfast - I loved the croissants and the meats and butter. The rest of the breads were quite good also. Fresh squeezed apple or orange juice was available as was coffee or chocolate (not very hot) or tea. The main girl who was serving did not speak much English so you would have to try to tell her your room number - luckily I remember my numbers in French - also specify if you want milk with your coffee - cafe au lait - I forgot and only received black coffee once. The staff - from maids to wait service to concierge were all terrific, extremely patient and able to direct us alot.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: rita10Portugal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in The Grand Hotel Francais is Paris. Was very comfortable and the rooms where fresh and new. We thought that this was good value for Money for Paris. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to Grand Hotel and Railbookers”
Reviews.Author: BarbicanLondon
Reviews.Content: Had a great long weekend in Paris in September spending 3 great nights at the Grand Hotel Francais. I was little worried about the location at first but the guy at Railbookers, Chris(?), said he had stayed there and that the location was good. Having booked a few trips through them I went on the recommendation and I am glad I did! Plus points - lovely rooms, staff friendly, actually pretty well located! Down side - had to change lines on the metro, but directions given by Railbookers made that easy as we were only travelling with small cases. Both Railbookers and Grand Hotel keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Look like 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: kikouz1984
Reviews.Content: All the rooms of this hotel have been recently refurbished with very moderne and classy taste and finition. Very clean hotel. Polite service. Decent breakfast in underground room (10â‚¬ per person if not included in your room rate). Walking distance from nation metro station, wich has a lot of line going trough.

Reviews.Title: “The treatment we received at the Grand Hotel Francais was 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: RestonVaDentist
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais near Place de la Nation in Paris. Our son's apartment was nearby and the location seemed to be perfect for us. It was, but for more reasons than just location. The hotel staff all took an interest in our comfort and well-being. They advised us on the location of good restaurants and answered many other questions during our 4 night stay. Near 2 different Metro stops as well as the SNF train, we were able to go anywhere in Paris in minutes. Yet, the location was less congested and tourist clogged. To top it off, when I indicated that our check-out day was my husband's birthday, we received a bottle of champagne to celebrate! We were very sad to leave the hotel....beautifully remodeled, clean, cheerful. Who says that residents of Paris are aloof and unfriendly? NOT HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Yashodara
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a great deal!! We stayed there 4 nights last week end had a wonderful experience. ROOM: very nice, modern equipment, comfortable bed, very good air conditioning (no noise), a bit small but you have to expect it in Paris BREAKFAST: good and over all for free (not obvious in Paris) LOCATION: perfect, near to Nation metro station from where you can easily reach every destination in the city (and not only, since de RER line A stops there). Itâ€™s only 5 minutes by taxi away from the Gare de Lyon, which is perfect if you are arriving at that station with the TGV (it was our case). The neighborhood is not a tourist area, but there is quite a lot of little restaurants, offering excellent cuisine at good prices. Personally, I find this much better than a busy area, full of bad restaurants for tourists! STAFF: nice and helpful. There is only a little â€œminus pointâ€�: the Wifi was hardly working, at least with the iPhone. I donâ€™t know if there is a problem for this phone in particular, but it was impossible to connect and if you have to check your business mail, it can be a bit annoying. But finally, I decided to enjoy 4 days without it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Trentos6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GHF for 4 nights in September 09. I have been to Paris twice before and stayed in varying accommodation, so was well not to ever expect too much in Paris unless you stay at a top end establishment. However we were absolutely delighted to come across this gem via Tripadvisor. We managed to find a really good room rate through HotelClub online and it ended up being about AUD $170 per night when we booked (the exchange rate is much better now). This is still pretty good for what we received though. The hotel was having a bit of a refurbishment. The rooms were spacious (for Paris), modern and very clean and the bathrooms spacious and also modern. They have free wi-fi and provide welcome drinks (bottled still/sparkling water) on arrival. They also don't fill the mini-bar unless you ask which I like because I never use it and it allowed us to store our own drinks we bought from the grocery store across the road. The staff were freindly and spoke good English. They were helpful in terms of tips for dining and attractions. There is a Metro station pretty much outside the hotel (great if you come in via the Metro after a Eurostar to Gare du Nord), or you can walk 5 mins to the Nation station which is a main one and connects to all the major lines. There is no shortage of places to eat and drink nearby. Paris is one of those cities that can be made or broken by the people you deal with and your accommodation. You can be confident that you will start each day in the right frame of mind at GHF. GHF isn't a 5 star hotel... but it's great bang for your buck and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte-Marty
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank the Manager, Si Zyad, for making our stay the best. There is no problem that he doesn't handle quickly and effectively. It was amazing to see such dedication to service. This hotel is the most comfortable hotel we have ever stayed at during many trips to Europe. Thank you Si Zyad! Marty & Charlotte, Sacramento CA

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajshar
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. 5 minutes to Metro. The room was excellent although small but I guess that is the norm all over Europe. I had some good as well as not so good interaction with the staff so I will say it was average. Things not so good - There is only one small elevator and we were on sixth floor so sometimes it can take a lot of time just to come down. No coffee maker in the room which would have been convenient as we were traveling with a toddler.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the cause!”
Reviews.Author: robbiesarsenal
Reviews.Content: This was our (my girlfriend and I) first visit to Paris. The purpose of this trip was to take my girlfriend away for her birthday. The location of this hotel was excellent to escape the busty, busy city life but easy enough to get to the city centre. The Metro is no more than 1000m away at end of the street providing routes to all over Paris including the main tourist attractions. The Metro is equivilant in operation and layout to the London Underground, so if you are familiar with how this operates it will be a breeze. In contrast if you are not familiar with the Tube network it is equally as easy to grasp which will make the visit more enjoyable! We visited the Eiffel Tower, Montparnasse Tower and Notre Dame via the Metro which were all easy to get to. All of the hotel staff which we met were extremely friendly and helpful, with excellent knowledge of local facilities nearby. The hotel itself was in very good order, both clean and welcoming. It has recently been renovated and is very modern, hich leads onto the rooms. They are typical French size but very modern and up to date giving you a warm, homely feeling. On arrival to Charles De Gaulle airport, we took a taxi to the hotel not knowing of any alternate transport methods or routes to take to the hotel. This cost 36 Euros and was roughly a 20 mile trip. After gaining better knowledge of the underground system we took the RER from the local Metro to CDG Airport (with one stop). This took an hour and was half the price compared to getting a taxi, so well worth it if you are looking to save a few Euro's. In summary, a lovely, highly recommended hotel, excellent location and we would definately re-visit in the future! Au Revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, value for money, comfortable, and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: AJP-Tokyo
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel. Good for business or seeing the city. Rooms in cheaper European hotels can be very small, but the single in the Grand Francais was fine, the bed a good queen size, and enough room to work. Clean, comfortable and overall excellent value for money. Air conditioner worked! The location's good - I don't know Paris well but found my way around easily from Rue des Boulets metro (a few yards from the hotel) and larger hub of Nation metro, a 5 minutes walk. Staff we extremely kind and helpful. Couldn't have been nicer. Will definitely stay there again next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GrrlDetective
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! I've stayed here twice. The first time, summer of 2008, because the trip was a last minute decision and it was the most affordable choice. I was traveling alone that time, and felt completely safe and comfortable at this hotel. So when I made plans to return this past summer, this time with a friend, I didn't even consider staying anywhere else. Nice rooms, friendly staff. Free internet. It's not in the "center" of the city, but very close to the metro, making it easy to get where ever you need to be. I like the neighborhood because of all the little bakery and bread shops. There's a grocery store right across the street where you can buy water and soda and anything else you might need. Much more affordable than in the heavy touristy areas. (It is within walking distance of Pere Lachaise Cemetery, and silly American tourist that I am, visiting Jim Morrison's grave was on the top of my "things to do" list -- something I never got around to doing on past visits to Paris.) I imagine that on future visits, I will continue to stay here. Why stay anywhere else? And anytime someone mentions that they are planning to visit Paris, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice this year. During our second visit there was an incident concerning a lost wallet. The hotel staff was incredibly helpful, making calls to contact credt card companies, and directing us to a local police station to make a report. The mangement is local and gave excellent advice about neighborhood restaurants and activities. The rooms are stylish and the beds very comfortable. It is located within steps of a metro stop and is far enough away from central Paris to be free of a crush of tourists, but close enought to be able to get to the main attractions within 20 minutes. We plan to make it our base during future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rapid_fire_96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first wedding anniversary in Paris and we stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for 8 nights. The hotel was awesome! The room was small by US standards (most Parisian hotels are), but roomy enough for us to move about with out bumping in to anything or one another. The staff was very accomodating. The hotel manager gave us a complimentary bottle of champange to celebrate our anniversary. We also had several requests during our stay and he met each one without delay or hesitation. The rooms were newly remodeled, the funiture was very modern and the veiw of the window was awesome. We will definilty be back!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager Soured the Hotel for Us”
Reviews.Author: BaconLewis
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is very nice, and seems to be in the process of further remodeling. It is not located in a particularly "hopping" part of Paris, but it is quite close to a large Metro stop with quick access to the rest of the city. What hurt our experience with this hotel was the rude behavior of the hotel manager. We are not stereotypical loud and ignorant Americans but he treated us as if we were, and was generally stereotypically French. Something we didn't experience anywhere else in our 9 days in Paris. So he generally made us feel uncomfortable. I hope he improves his attitude towards paying customers at his hotel, as otherwise this was a fine hotel at a good price, which as we all know, is difficult to find in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly hotel. Highly recommended for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LondonScot20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my parents. The staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. I had mentioned in advance that it was my parents' wedding anniversary and so the hotel upgraded them - they were delighted. The rooms are very modern and comfortable with free WiFi, I would say this hotel is equally good for couples or solo travellers - anyone really. Breakfast was fine - cereals, orange juice, pastries, coffee etc. The hotel is right by Rue des Boulets metro and it's a short walk to Nation for further transport options. Overall, for a 3 star hotel, I thought it was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our hopes and expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MHB48
Reviews.Content: We had read the excellent reviews on this hotel before travelling, and were not disappointed! Good location, spotlessly clean refurbished rooms, welcoming helpful staff and more than adequate breakfast - what more can you ask for? Even the small room and even smaller bathroom we were given would not deter us from using this hotel again and recommending it. We ate at Les Galopins, one of the recommended restaurants on two evenings, and this was excellent, again the staff were welcoming and offered complimentary drinks before and after the meal. All in all, an excellent city break which we intend to repeat as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true--a really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rahwayan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Room was modern (w/in-room air conditioning/heat control). Reception and breakfast room staff friendly. Location just a couple of blocks from Metro: Nation. In short, this is a perfect choice, as they do everything just right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Steph_and_Mart
Reviews.Content: Easy to find- straight down the road from Rue de boulets Metro. On arrival we were kindly upgraded to an executive suite as I informed in an email that it was our honeymoon. The most polite and helpful checkin staff we'd met! The room couldn't be faulted following a recent redecoration (they were just finishing the reception area). Champagne on ice complementary with a kind congratulations note. A/C was great, shower brilliant. Breakfast was simple yet exactly what you need for a day of sightseeing. Upon check-out were left our bags in the store at no charge for as long as we needed. Great Value stay, hopefully will return.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussieos09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of our month around France. The newly renovated rooms were a delight and larger than the usual Paris closets. I had actually only booked two nights and we had a large room with balcony and a king size bed, shower and bath. It was delightful and the staff were most helpful and gave great advice, especially when I realised we needed a third night. We had to move rooms, but got to experience another slightly smaller but very comfortable room. Breakfasts were good and we suggest you try the restaurant recommended be the hotel - Les Gallopins. It was friendly, cheery and good local food. We went back two nights. The area is a bit out of the trendy districts, but so close to the metro this is not an issue and the local neighborhood offers plenty of food, supermarket, cafes and laundromat options - great for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: aleciaf
Reviews.Content: For those who want to see nothing but other tourists, pay outrageous rates for an OK room, and put up with noise and traffic, this isn't the place for you. The hotel is located in a Parisian neighborhood near two handy metro/train stations (Rue de Boulets & Nation) and across the street from the best (Jewish) bakery in the entire city. The newly-refurbished rooms are gorgeous, and, although they are small, there's plenty of room for luggage and excellent storage for clothes and other essentials. Free WiFi is included and laundry and petite dejeuner are available. There are excellent restaurants within walking distance, and some marvelous shops, selling everything from fantastic fabrics to designer clothes. The staff is the best we've ever encountered; especially Zyad - who knows everything about anything in the city. We almost want to keep this secret to ourselves but decided to share. We won't stay anywhere else - why should we?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - these guys have thought of everything.”
Reviews.Author: Welly_China_Girl
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Francais Fantastic hotel - would definitely recommend to others and would stay here again. Loved the boutique hotel decor, location, breakfast, thoughtfully provided amenities and friendly staff. These guys have really thought of everything. Really enjoyed our stay here. Service Great service from Zyad the manager and the young lady with long blonde hair (Sorry i never asked her name) - very welcoming and accommodating, giving us maps and directions and being very responsive to any other needs (eg I needed to print out something, so the manager gave me a usb drive to put it on for printing on the hotel pc). Both were fluent in english and even tried helping me with my really bad french. It was our first trip to Paris and I had asked for a quiet room as well - not sure which helped, but we got upgraded to a superior room with a bathtub. Check-in and check-out were very quick and efficient. Room servicing was efficient and thorough - everything was always well done and bathroom always sparkling clean. The maids did seem to want to enter the room a couple of times after it had been cleaned - a bit strange, not sure why though as my french is pretty poor. Room We were in room 16 which is just up the stairs at the back of the hotel, overlooks a side street with view of the park. Decor was a nice change from all the floral bedspreads seen on nearly every other hotel in the same price range - contemporary decor (new) and a small but well-laid out room. Amenities included aircon, free wifi from room (with daily code from reception), fridge, phone, lcd tv, in-room safe (english channels were BBC and CNN). The aircon and welcome bottle of chilled water in the fridge were a huge plus for my partner after we lugged our bags from Nation station (it was at the end of summer). Room was a superior one with a bathroom - not sure if this makes the room bigger than a standard, but size was decent, didn't feel really cramped as was expecting for Paris (although there really is only space for one suitcase to be laid out). Lighting provided was a big plus for me as many hotels often have only lamps by the bed making reading difficult - but there was good overall room lighting, over the bed lighting (each side) as well as a lamp and wall lighting - lots of options. Also really liked the clever use of storage space and shelving, given the size of the room. Bed was a queen, extremely comfortable with crisp white sheets and a euro and standard pillow to choose from. Food isn't allowed in the room and there are no tea/coffee making facilities - I came prepared and brought my own kettle and teabags as I can't get by without my cuppa in the afternoon - hope that was ok, didn't get any comments on it. A fridge is provided, and you can optionally have it stocked by the hotel or use it to chill your own water or wine (1.5 l bottle of water is 70 centimes across the road at the supermarket). Everything was pretty new and all in perfect working order. Overall the room was great. The only problem we had was occasional noise from the next door north american guests (sorry, but we could hear their conversations and accents) who would sometimes have very loud and vocal discussions at strange hours of the night. Not the hotel's fault, just inconsiderate travellers (different lots of guests too). It wasn't annoying enough to call reception, but it did wake us up a couple of times. Bathroom Bathroom was lovely and sparklingly shiny and clean, although on the small side (as to be expected in Paris). All the standard amenities were available, and even slippers were provided. We had a bathtub room with shower. Watch out for the tiny gap between the glass door and the hinge - it can make a big puddle on the floor depending on where the showerhead is pointing (stuffing a bit of paper in the gap seemed to prevent this happening after the first time). Breakfast Breakfast was well catered for but agree that the 10 euro price might not be worth it if you haven't got it included in your rate, especially if there's more than one of you. Tip here would be, if there's 2 of you, check out the breakfast inclusive and exclusive rate when booking - the price difference might make it worthwhile to include breakfast as it is substantial and you can eat as much as you can manage - it's good, and you can sit down and take your time. My standard breakfast was cereal with fruit and yoghurt, croissant or roll with ham, salami and cheese, finished off with a couple of sweet pastries, washed down with a cup of tea and orange juice - pretty much a bit of everything, and all very good quality and tasty. The breakfast area can seat about 20 people - popular time seems to be around 9:30 to 10 when there were some people who had to wait, so maybe have breakfast early to get a good start on the day. Hotel Hotel decor is nice and contemporary, I think final renovations are still underway. There is a lift (thank goodness!) but it's small and a bit slow. We used the stairs anyway as we were on the first level. There's also a complimentary english newspaper available (The Guardian). Reception is manned 24 hours and is in a pretty safe-feeling area. Location Location was in 11th arrondisement but pretty close to Bastille and Marais, a little bit off the tourist map, but with such great access to the metros (Rue des Boulets is about 1 min walk, and Nation is about 8 mins) no complaints. The location also provided a more local feel, which is better than the tourist areas where you feel everyone's out to rip you off. Location also convenient for RER stop (Nation station) so good for Disneyland Paris. We did feel that we saw an awful lot of the metro service, but that might just be bad route planning on my part). (Tip - the Rue des Boulets metro stop is closer to hotel than Nation but there're still a few steps and walking to get to the correct station for the green line - tossup between negotiating crossing the roads and walking a couple of blocks, or the hassle of changing for one more stop). We bought the carnet of 10 tickets for 11.60 which I think works out cheaper than the 1 day pass which is 5.60 each for zone 1, depending on how much you want to do in a day. Eating Plenty of places to eat around the hotel - they have a list of recommended restaurants and a map and indicative price range. We tried the much-touted Les Galopins - loved it the first time but not so sure the second - 2nd time round, they seemed to be short-staffed that night and completely different staff and food not to the same standard (eg burnt creme brulee) - true test of a dish is ordering the same dish twice though!. We had a starters, mains, desserts and a 46cl bottle of wine - cost was around 60 - 70 euros for two of us. Note that some of the starters are large (eg the pate and the foie gras) so might be worth sharing these or having a 2nd starter instead of a main. I have to say I enjoyed the starters and desserts more than the mains. Also liked the italian place right next door (my partner had a hankering for pizza) who were also just as friendly and spoke english with amusing english menu, food is pretty reasonably priced and good here too. If you want to look further afield, then try the side streets. One night we didn't realise the time when we got back (around 10:15pm) and many places were already closed - we did find a pub called L'armagnac about 3 blocks up Blvd Voltaire and just off the corner on the left - this was still serving food although it is more pub style (eg served with french style chips and salad) but really nice local atmosphere and some of the staff there speak english. Other comments - We tried the shuttle service that the reception very kindly organised for us - again nothing to do with the hotel, but the guy was about 30 mins late, and then got lost trying to find his last pickup (unfortunately this involved going in circles around several tight corners and narrow streets in the Marais district, including side-swiping a parked car) but luckily we had checked in online already so weren't delayed too much. Reason for choosing this hotel Primary driver for a hotel in Paris for us was price, and photos and comments from other travellers - when I first started looking for a hotel, this one was ranked #79 on Trip Advisor, and now it's sitting at #18 out of over 1,900 hotels (over a period of about 6 months) - which says quite a bit in itself. The lift, aircon, wifi and location were an added bonus. Extremely pleased with our choice, we had a fantastic stay - would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Close to Metro, Super Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MartiniAngel
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Paris and were a little concerned with this hotel being so far out of the center. We were crazy! It is very close to the metro and within a few minutes you can be in central Paris! The staff is very helpful, the wireless internet is great. Our room was very clean and of a decent size! The Italian restaurant next door is fantastic if you want to eat close, skip the sushi restaurant tho. We had a great time and will definitly stay with Grand Hotel Francais again!

Reviews.Title: “Despite the small room, the best hotel we've stayed in so far!”
Reviews.Author: ash7974
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The reviews on TA have been spot on. On arrival there was some renovations underway in the lobby and i think as a result, our room was upgraded. The room although quite small, was modern and very clean with an excellent shower. The staff were exceptionally friendly, the breakfast quite nice and the room included free WiFi. On check out at 6AM, the man at reception was excellent and took us down to the kitchen for some fresh coffee and crosissant's even though the kitchen was closed. We didn't want to cause a fuss but he virtually dragged us down there! Overall my wife and i rated this hotel as our favourite whilst our honeymoon due to the service and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “This is one place where you SHOULD believe the hype !”
Reviews.Author: dmorvanuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently for a 3 night stay, having been treated to a trip of our choice by the wife's very generous parents. Having scoured Tripadvisor and read the reviews, for the budget we had this hotel seemed very much to fit the bill, and seeing as we secured the last available room for the time we were there, we figured it was a good choice. That proved to be an understatement as it lived up to, and indeed, surpassed expectations. Arrived mid afternoon to a friendly welcome and an immediate apology to the fact that work was going on to redecorate reception and install a new bar area. Lift up to our room to dump our bags and have a look around, found us with a very well appointed and clean room (yes, it was small, but in fact large for a 3 star Paris hotel) with 2 balconies looking over the Bvd, 3 complimentary waters waiting for us in the fridge and a note saying if we wanted the mini-bar filled to let reception know and they could advise on prices (we didn't take them up on the offer but it's a nice touch that you have a small fridge you can keep your own drinks in). A small safe for your belongings, flat-screen tv on the wall and a compact bathroom which was well-appointed with the most fantastic shower (and we've got a very good one at home as it is) we've ever had the pleasure to stand under. Slippers, clean fluffy towels and the usual complimentary toiletries. The hotel was literally 1 minute from the exit of Rue de Boulets Metro stop, and about 5 minutes from the Metro/RER hub station at Nation, so getting anywhere on public transport was a doddle - took us 20 minutes from Gare du Nord including changing lines at Oberkampf !. Most of the sights can be reached in anything from 10-20 minutes from the time you walk out of the door to the time you get off your Metro/RER train, but it's actually nice to walk - and we did a lot of that - walking to Notre Dame took us about 35 mins at a leisurely pace. The manager, Zyad, was tremendously helpful, making recommendations for places to eat locally, and when we asked him to make us a reservation at another Bistro for our last night in Paris he and his staff literally kept at it for nearly 24 hours until they managed to get through to the Bistro and get us a table - now that's Ritz level service at a 3 star price ! Could go on and on - but you'd get bored. We've travelled extensively, and my wife has been to Paris on a number of occasions before we met. We can be VERY critical of establishments if we feel we don't get the service or facilities we have paid for - but we cannot criticise this hotel at all. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel - just grabbed a coffee and croissant on the way to our morning destination - and anyway it's nice to sit at a brasserie watching the world go by as you have your petit dejuner. The room was always impeccibly cleaned during our stay, On checking out we were able to leave our luggage in the care of the hotel as we had a 6pm Eurostar booked back to England, and it allowed us to get a final bit of sightseeing/lunch in with the knowledge our belongings were being safely cared for. I never thought I'd enjoy Paris as much as I did - it was my first visit to the city in nearly over 30 years since I was a child, and I didn't know what to expect. I had a great time, and a large part of that was due to the fact we had such a great hotel with the most fantastic service, which meant the only "fretting" we had to do was where to eat ( and believe me - that CAN be a problem - as our guidebook said it's really hard to get a bad meal in Paris - so you are spoilt for choice on good food ! ). We had no plans to rush back to Paris - for me I thought it would be a nice trip and that's it - but even before we came back I was saying I want to go back - and if I can't stay at the Grand Francais, then we'll be timing our trip so we can - because we're not staying anywhere else in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisevirgin
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but it was ideally situated and very clean and comfortable. Room and Bathroom small but when its only for sleeping it's not a problem. Breakfast adequate. Researched local restaurant through Tripadvisor which turned out to be fantastic also. Will never go anywhere again without checking here first

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShayMary
Reviews.Content: We located this hotel on Tripadviser and having read the good reviews for the Grand Hotel Francais, we made our reservation. The hotel is ideally located and is very close to several Metro and RER locations. The hotel is in a very lively area with a very diverse range of restaurants/pubs/bars. The Hotel itself is very very good : staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the room in which we stayed (on the 3rd floor) was very clean and tidy and had a great view of the Boulevard Voltaire. Sayed - the manager/owner - was extremely helpful too. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be ranked highly”
Reviews.Author: phoneticduck
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, and had a 5th floor room with Balcony. To be honest the balcony was a nice touch but isn't really a factor in how good this place is so don't worry if you don't get one! Room very modern, bathroom the same (fabulous shower!) and the TV was great with a load of channels including BBC World News and CNN. Staff very friendly but not overbearing, and give great helpful advice. Location is very good also in that it's very handy to the Metro, and also within easy walking distance of Bastille for cafe's, pubs etc, in the evening. Will definitely stay here again next time im in Paris, and recommend you do too!! Oh and the free wifi is great, just remember to ask for the password each day at reception!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Vic15Scotland
Reviews.Content: we had a room on the 5th floor with balcony & views over the tree tops down the street -- fabulous! very clean, bed was extremely comfy & loved the complimentary slippers! staff helpful & friendly. would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Highly Recomended!”
Reviews.Author: Gamblndan
Reviews.Content: Came to Paris for a long weekend, and ended up at this hotel because of all of the great reviews here on Tripadvisor. After staying for three nights, I can honestly say that the hotel easily lived up to the great reviews. I was able to book a Superior room, but after telling Zyad that it was our first trip to Paris, I was upgraded to a priveledge room. Zyad and his day staff are extemely helpful in every way, and had answers to all of our questions. He is extremely nice, and speaks perfect english! The room was small, but exactly what I expected, and the bed was super comfortable. The view from our room was very nice, and the room was also very quiet. I must say that the shower was fantastic with great water pressure, and tons of hot water. We also had a bath tub in our room which was also very nice for my girlfriend. The rooms were very clean, and offered a safe, and refridgerator in the room. Like everyone has said before, the location is wonderful with a great bakery, supermarket, and internet cafe all withing 100 yards. The metro was also within a few blocks in both directions and took only a few minutes to reach. The Metro station at Nation was best for us as it allowed us to travel to the entire city and return back to our hotel in no time at all. Breakfast was fresh and adequate, but if you are an American looking for eggs and bacon, you wont find it here. Just pasteries, fruit, and cold cuts and rolls, but also amazing coffee!!! I had a deal for free breakfast and if i didnt have it, I dont think I would say it is worth 10 Euros for that breakfast even though it was good. there are cheaper options for the money down the road. All in all I would definitly stay at this hotel again, and highly reccomend it to anyone who will be visiting Paris! PS..Remember to bring an electric adaptor because although the hotel provides them as best they can, we were without one for our first night because there were so many given out to other guests. I would just bring my own to make sure you can charge your camera or phone batteries if needed. Better to be safe then sorry! Once again Zyad, thank you for a great visiti to your fine hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kotikisu
Reviews.Content: Very cute little hotel and a lovely staff! Our room was quite small, but very clean, cozy and functional. Great value for money and we'll definitely stay in this hotel during our next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - made our honeymoon stay very special”
Reviews.Author: LondonCitybreakfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights - one at the beginning of our honeymoon and one, two weeks later, at the end. The first time, we got upgraded to a beautiful room on the top floor with a bottle of champagne and when we returned for the 2nd night, we got the same room again! The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and even agreed to store some of our luggage for the 2 weeks whilst we went travelling around Corsica on our honeymoon. The breakfast was delicious. The bed was so comfy and you get loads of really nice bath products. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here - we've stayed in many hotels in Paris but this was by far our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: cookie43
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris many times and I have to say this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The staff were kind and helpful at all times. The room was compact (Paris after all) but incredibly clean and well decorated. We had a small problem with our safe and it was corrected immediately and cheerfully. Breakfast was first rate. The area was excellent with great transportation connections. I found an internet cafe down the street that changed by the minute (less than 5 cents a minute!) I can't wait to go back to the Grand Francais.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - You won't be disappointed !”
Reviews.Author: matheus76
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed for a romantic weekend at the beginning of August 09. I have to say that we were very impressed with the hotel. On arrival we were greeted pleasantly, we were upgraded to a superior room at no extra charge. Our room was located on the top floor (number 61) and was impressive. It had obviously been recently refurbished and the fixture and fittings were to a high standard. The bathroom was particularly good, nice shower, etc. The bed was also very comfortable. I noticed on the hotels web site, that it stated the rooms were sound proofed. This became apparant as we did not hear a peep! Location wise, its situated right by the metro (Rue De Boulets) stop. It takes no more than 3 mins to get to the metro from the hotel. There are also some excellent bars, restaurants and convenience close by. The breakfast in the morning was very good, a choice of french pastries, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, ham, cheese, bread, fresh orange juice, coffee and tea. The staff were great and particularly the concierge on the front desk. He was very friendly and helpful and helped us with any questions. The hotel is rated as 3 stars, but I think it exceeds that rating. I have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels in the past and found them to be inferior on occasions. So the hotel exceeded our expectations. We will definitely be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star!!!”
Reviews.Author: DLO3
Reviews.Content: My family (5 adults) stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in July. We have nothing but praise for Zyad & his staff, all were extremely helpful & friendly. They went above & beyond what anyone would expect!! The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious, clean, nicely decorated. It is located near 2 Metro stations, Rue des Boulet (small) & Nation (huge) - you can travel anywhere in Paris from Nation. The area has many cafes & small shops. If I return to Paris, I'll be staying at Grand Hotel Francais again!

Reviews.Title: “Fully deserves all the accolades”
Reviews.Author: TTD1
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a gem of a hotel in a great area, just one minute (we timed it) from the nearest metro, Rue des Boulets. Rooms are immaculate thanks to recent refurbishment. Breakfast fresh and plentiful and staff fun and extremely helpful. It is also remarkably quiet. Free wi-fi adds to the pleasures. We had a fantastic two nights and wish we could have stayed longer. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Right up my street!”
Reviews.Author: JezNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights for our second wedding anniversary and i'm so glad i chose this hotel. The staff were more than helpful, the hotel ticked every box you'd expect for a city retreat, and was located close enough to the centre if you fancied a walk, or perfect for the tube. It made our anniversary perfect. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE GEM!”
Reviews.Author: Bigrogie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel. Amazing staff! Very friendly and helpful. Ziad (I believe it's his name) is an outstanding host! Very modern room and bathroom. A bit small for North American standard but this is Europe! Large enough for a couple. Close to 2 metro stations. For a nice meal, try LA DAME BRUNE. Cozy restaurant about 10 minutes walk. 80-85 euros with drinks and wine. Worth the stop! Many restaurants, bakeries, groceries store within minutes walk. We paid 115 euros/night . Free WiFi worked very well. AMAZING price/value! Would definitely go back and recommend this hotel to any one visiting Paris! A true gem! The metro system is the best way to visit Paris. Get a Paris Pass for Zone 1 as it is useless to get Zone 2 to 5 if you intend to stay within Paris. Eiffel Tower is worth the trip to the top but be there between 9-9:30 a.m. to avoid the lines. For lunch, grab a baguette ham/cheese sandwhich at many takeout places for 3-4 euros but if you sit at a table, price will double! Same thing for drinks. A pint of beer at a resto/bar will cost you 8-12 euros but only 2.5-3 euros at a takeout joint. See the Eiffel Tower at night from Tuscadero (metro station right there), amazing view!

Reviews.Title: “Best things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: Christian45
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 4 nights at this hotel, which we booked after reading the reviews on this website and we were not disappointed. As soon as we stepped foot through the door a we were greated with a warm welcolme and lots of information on Paris and where to go etc. On entering the room, the first thing we noticed was how nicely decorated it was. OK, so if you have read a lot of reviews on hotels in Paris, we all know they're small, but the quality of the fixtures and fittings in our room was of a very high standard. The best sight was the room temperature control near the door for the air conditioning, which is something I didn't realise the rooms had and after a hot, humid trip from CDG airport on the train & metro to the hotel (which is very easy to get to from Rue de Beaulais metro station) was a blessing. There were three different receptionists on duty during our stay and each one was friendly and well informed on most aspects of Paris. If there was something they didn't know, they would find out for you. The breakfast is served in the basement between 7.30am and 10.30am and has a nice selection of pastries, cooked meats, cheese, cereals and a nice strong jug of coffee, which kept us going most of the day. Again the staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location and within easy reach of most attractions via the metro station "Nation", which has 3/4 lines going all over Paris. As you can probably tell, I would highly recommend this hotel for a great value, friendly hotel and would certainly return on our next trip to Paris. I'm not sure if the staff will read this but I would like to express my thanks to you all there for a wonderful stay to explore a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirna77
Reviews.Content: Even though our room was very small, hotel was very modern in design. The room was extremely clean and comfortable, bedding and decor were nice. The location was convenient to two metro stations, and there were many restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel. Hotel staff was very courteous and provided an outstanding service. I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “incredible find”
Reviews.Author: atrmt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at the Grand Hotel Francais. This was a fantastic find at an affordable price in Paris. The hotel is not close walking distance to most attractions but it is about a five minute walk from the metro station which takes you anywhere you need to go in Paris. With the intense summer heat, the individually controlled air conditioning was a god send. The room is typically small for Europe but has more than adequate space. It is beautifully appointed and with plenty of great little touches (loofah, slippers). The breakfast (which we had included) was the best we had in our entire two-week European vacation. The hotel staff are also very friendly and helpful. They provide great suggestions for dining (especially if you want to stay away from tourist traps....we were usually the only tourists in the entire restaurant) and how to get around the city. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: 1TravelFamily
