Reviews.Content: We arrived and were treated so well. The staff was incredible. Our bags were taken, so they could finish our room (we arrived on a very early AM flight). We were directed to the best exchange rate (local post office around the corner) and directed to some great nearby cafes for lunch. When we arrived, they had selected an exceptional room. It had a large comfortable bed. They made sure my very tall husband had the most space possible. As in many of the reviews we've seen, the shower was AWESOME! The manager and his teaml do anything to address the needs of a guest. Irons aren't provided as in the US. They worked tirelessly to find someone to press my clothes for an event that evening. Every question (where to go, how to get there, where to change money, etc) was met with patience and expert advise. It made short 3 night 4 day visit easy and full. Location was perfect. We could access both the Metro and the RER. These take you to museums and points of interest with ease. It felt wonderful to be in a neighborhood with enough activity to be interesting, but not overly touristy. We felt we were living in Paris. Breakfast was very good. Excellent coffee au laiit, yoghurts, chesses, incredible breads, fresh butter and jam. These are the morning fare you used to be able to always find in Paris and now are becoming harder to get. Thanks to Grand Hotel for making our trip exceptional. It really is a hidden jewel in the world of boutique hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: TAr0cks
Reviews.Content: Positive: - Cost: Great value in terms of Paris standards - Clean: Room was pretty much spotless - Comfortable: Beds were comfortable and although room is small, it is still reasonable. - Breakfast: Included in the price, food was decent. - Internet: Free wi-fi everyday Average: - Location: It was far from city center so expect a longer Metro ride. - Staff: Generally helpful if you ask a question, but some will have a bit of attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Vetlisch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, and I have to say that it was one of the best hotels I have been to recently! We payed 125 Euro for a double room with breakfast included, and it was worth every penny:) Although the hotel is not in the very center of Paris, you can easily get around by the metro. The breakfast was not the best I have had, but OK. On beforehand we were a bit concerned about the noise from the other rooms, and to be honest we did not experience any of the problems others have mentioned. If we are going back to Paris I have no doubt that we will stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: AlanandSue
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay for our anniversary, received a nice welcome on arrival and that was matched throughout our stay by all of the staff at the hotel. Room was a ' superior' double and was well planned out, comfortable and very clean. The balcony looking out onto the Boulevard Voltaire was just what we wanted and yet there was little noise from outside. In fact this was one of the quietest hotels we have stayed in recently. Breakfast was served in a small basement room but again very clean, cheerful staff and a good selection which was regularly topped up., We did indulge ourseves in the fresh pastries each morning. The hotel is away from the main usual tourist haunts but we think that is one of its strong points. Restaurants recommended locally by the hotelwere good, we tried Chez Prosper and Les Galopins and would recommend them, both in terms of food but also in the helpfulness of the staff who had to cope with our very limited French.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: WoosterToronto
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful 3 star Paris hotel. My girlfriend and I stayed a whole week there. It's excellent value, partly because you're outside of the really central tourist locations in Paris. But it is a a very nice neighbourhood with good access to Nation metro/RER station and the #9 metro line right outside the door - so it's easy to get to the big sites quite quickly. The room was really nice,newly renovated, very clean and the bathroom is excellent with good shower water pressure. Breakfast was excellent with good pastries and so on. The best part of the hotel was the excellent service, particularly the very friendly manager! Our French was limited and the staff was very accommodating in helping us book some restaurants we wanted to go to. Thank you very much! I would fully recommend this hotel - it has a good rating for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lina315
Reviews.Content: If you have been in Paris before, this hotel is great in many ways. It is clean, friendly and modern. Ask them for rooms that end on a "3" like 53,43,33--these are corner rooms that have the best views and are LARGE. Our first night we had a very tiny room with even smaller bathroom. I asked the manager to have it changed and he was happy to help us. Thank you!! If you are visiting Paris for the first time, you probably want to stay closer to all the tourist sites. Even though this hotel has great access to metro, it can be a long trip home after a tiring day of sightseeing. There are very few tourists in this area (which we loved) and therefore not much action. And if you are like us (who WALKED from the hotel all over Paris for 3 days in a row) than you will get tired quickly. However, taking into consideration the value and the condition of this property, I do not know if you can find a better deal in this town. The beds were comfy, there was absolutely no noise from the street (the manager told us that Americans complain of street noise, so they are automatically assigned to the back rooms). Have the street-facing room if you can, it is wonderful and bright! We have not tried the breakfast (used the little food store directly across the street for a lot of our needs) but I am sure it is as good quality as the hotel itself. We will definitely stay there again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toongster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a romantic 5 days. The hotel is located on a quiet street with a nice shop to get food just across. There is a metro station nearby allowing you to get into the heart of Paris easily. The staff are very friendly and give you good suggestions of where to eat locally. Rooms are clean, breakfast is good. You do hear the metro rolling underneath thorughout the night but it didn't really bother us. Excellent hotel - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: MikeDVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at the Grand Hotel Francais. The hotel manager and staff are extremely helpful and very accommodating. The room are small but very clean and newly renovated. The hotel has a fantastic list of local restaurants (all of which were great). The Nation Metro Station is only a few mins walk away and a quick 10 mins metro ride has you right in the centre of Paris. We would most definitely recommend this hotel to couples looking to stay at a cute boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: lyletravel
Reviews.Content: Price and service was great!! Clean rooms & welcoming staff. This hotel was just outside of the main tourist-crazy section of Paris, which made it relaxing and home-like. We felt as if we were "living" there, rather than battling the insane crowds! The metro was a few steps from the door, which took us straight into the heart of Paris when we felt like seeing the sights! The manager, Zyad, was fantastic at giving directions and recommendations on where to go, what to eat, etc. The other front desk personnel were so friendly and accomodating as well!! This was our first stop on our vacation, and it was great

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here for a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: white2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting and traveling with our friends from the UK. The front desk staff were very pleasant and accomodating. It's a quaint little hotel with very cute rooms. We were told that we were upgraded to the superior rooms.....which were pretty small compared to the hotel rooms we are used to in Canada, but apparently most hotel rooms in Europe are smaller. We had a laugh when one of the guests approached us and asked if our rooms were teenie, tiny as well.....she was from New York and I am sure was used to something much bigger. The elevator is very small and will probably only hold 4 people comfortably....taking the stairs was a challenge as they were making renovations and upgrades and the working staff was usually in the stairwell. Don't get me wrong......we would still recommend this hotel, as the ambiance is great. There is a small lounge just off the check-in desk where you can relax and have a drink. Our room had three windows, so plenty of light - with a little balcony out each window. The shower head looked brand new and was adjustable.....great showers! I can't say enough about the continental breakfast.....much more than you would expect. There was croissants, breads, cereal, yogurt, ham, different types of cheese, fresh fruit, milk, orange juice, tea or coffee. The young lady that served us our tea or coffee was very pleasant....always a smile on her face! This hotel is very close to the Metro (underground) in case you want to travel in that manner. We used it a few times to get around quickly. A tip for you....if you want to have a few drinks you are better off to go across the street to the small store (market) and buy beer for about 65 Euro Cents as you will pay dearly for beer at one of the bars (we paid 6 Euro each for a pint of beer). Stay at this hotel while in Paris.....you won't regret it. Nora White Canada

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, gracious and helpful hotelier”
Reviews.Author: rogevahol
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Grand Hotel Francais and we could not be more pleased. There are some potential negatives, but one's attitude to all of life depends on what one accentuates the good or the bad. The rooms are very small by USA standards, but I expected that in Paris. The area is not the closest to the major tourist attractions, but the Metro gets you around easily and efficiently and the Nation station is a major hub. Even though we had never been to Europe before and only knew le Francais un petite pue, we easily got to the hotel using the RER. I felt like I was in a real Parisean neighborhood rather than a purely tourist area. There are many comfortable Cafe's and Brasseries nearby that we enjoyed. The thing that warrents the 5 star review is warmth, helpfulness, friendlyness and fraternite' of the host, Zyad, and all his staff. I want to thank them all from the bottom of my heart for making us feel welcome and happy as neophyte Americans in Paris. Merci Beucoup Zyad, Sincerely Roger and Joan of Asheville, Caroline du Nord

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel should be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AshfordKentRxs
Reviews.Content: Just got back on 14th May after a 3 night stay , the hotel was lovely and clean with modern rooms and the staff were very polite & the whole stay was fantastic , would def stay there again , the area is great around the hotel and everywhere we went the people were friendly and welcoming , you must try the restaurant called le n'yuman its about 200m from the hotel towards nation , its set just of the boulevard voltaire , their coffee is amazing and the staff are very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sekmd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an 8 day stay in Paris booked through Orbitz. Read alot of the reviews of the Grand Hotel Francais which all seemed favorable and we decided to try it out. The hotel and staff more than met our expectations, it is a real gem. The manager, Zyad, was a real asset; always there to greet us and help us in any way he could. Since we were staying 8 days, he upgraded our room. WiFi was free with a PIN from the staff. The room was comfortable and clean. The location is great just a block from the "Rue des Boulets" Metro station and so you have complete access to all of Paris. When we return to Paris would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel helped make our stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: bizbear
Reviews.Content: We booked a package air/hotel trip from AAA and this was one of the possible hotels offered. We were there Apr 19 - May 5. It had great reviews on Trip Advisor and it lived up to them. The manager Zyad is a gem. He always seemed to be there! We joked with him about what little time he had for a personal life (but obviously some as we met his wife and what he called his 'clone', his adorable son). The staff was alway pleasant, helpful and nice. The women who organized the breakfast room on weekdays was a wonder. We loved the location, the neighborhood is very residential. Not an American chain in sight! We bought snack at the market across the street and at the patisserie down the block. Lots of nice restaurants. Zyad has a list of recommendations, but we can also recommend Le N'Yuman toward the Nations subway station, just off to the left on a side street and Cafe Dalou on the circle. We got a great room #61 on the top floor which was wonderful. 2 windows with a nice view of the street and not at all noisy. The bed was comfortable, the shower was spacious (and we are 2 big guys so that makes a difference!) and there was always hot water! A/C in the room that worked (so many hotels in Europe don't turn it on for the building until it is in season but some days in our trip were unusually warm and it help sleeping. Our room had a minifridge, which the hotel would stock with what we wanted. We did not use this but it is a nice touch. A working safe in the room which was most helpful. The 10 euro breakfast was wonderful. We used that to charge ourselves up for a full day of sightseeing and it held us great. A good selection of dirferent breads, cheeses, yogurt with ham & salami also. Plus your mornng coffee, tea or chocolate. close to major subways. We were never very far away from anywhere we wanted to go, including all the way across town to the Marmotan musuem. Beautiful park just behind the hotel and lots of interesting shops all up & down Blvd Voltaire and adjacent streets. Make sure to take time to walk through the neighborhood. Again, can say enough nice things about the hotel and Zyad. To the staff from Ken & Mitch, thanks so much for giving us a home in Paris and helping make our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: apatra1
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at this hotel from April 20-22, 2009, and we absolutely loved it. First of all, it is in a great location (just a few minutes walk from the Nation metro, which serves the RER and multiple other subway lines, very easy to get anywhere you want ). Second, the hotel itself is very clean and modern. We paid a little extra for the deluxe room, which was a good sized room and bathroom, didn't feel cramped at all. And the main reason why we loved the hotel-- the hotel staff! They were all so welcoming, friendly, and helpful. I forgot the name of the manager, but he was fabulous. He always had good recommendations for restaurants and directions to fun places. My fiancee and I get lost all the time, so he made sure to give us detailed instructions. One time he saw us walking in the wrong direction on the street (we are both really clueless, even with maps) so he walked out of the hotel and actually walked with us a few blocks to where we needed to go. I doubt most other hotel staff are that helpful. Other hotel amenities- Free WiFi, free ironing service (drop off your clothes in the morning and they are ironed and put back in your room by early afternoon), good breakfast, good air conditioning (I can't deal with heat), in room safe. Overall I give this hotel 5 stars and will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GeminiTraveler
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here last month. The hotel was in a working class neighbordhood in Paris, within walking distance to the Metro station. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a room on their top floor with several walkout balconies. The room was nicely decorated with lots of modern touches. The staff at the hotel was friendly and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made us feel more welcome”
Reviews.Author: MargiD
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our long weekend at this great little hotel. Although it looks off the beaten track on the map, it is only six minutes walk from the Metro station Nation from where you can travel anywhere in Paris easily. Zyad and his young lady assistant spoke good English and were friendly and helpful. Immensely knowledgable of his city and quite comical, he reminded us of Rimmer from Red Dwarf (pay a visit and see for yourself!). Bedrooms were small but newly decorated to a high standard with very high spec fittings. Reading other reviews we had no problem with external or internal noise at all. The breakfast room in the basement again was small and sometimes we had to wait a few minutes for a table, but the staff were so polite and courteous with a good choice for breakfast - (with Sterling so weak we would eat as much as possible to avoid needing an early lunch - sorry Zyad, it was us who ate all the food!). On returning in the evenings the rooms were tidied and spotless. Overall this hotel is highly recommended and will definitely stay again - beautiful impressive city with lots more still to see. General advice for first time visitors - If you're arriving on Eurostar at Gare du Nord, look for the big green ticket dispensers and purchase an 11 ticket Carnet for 22 Euros. At one ticket for each journey the Metro is very cheap. When you travel back to Gare du Nord the station is huge and the signs to Eurostar are mystifying or non-existant - we missed our train so allow 20 mins for wandering around.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Campbell59
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay in Grand Hotel Francais. I can only agree with the excellent reviews on this site...they are certainly well deserved. Our room was modern and kept spotlessly clean throughout the whole stay. Some minor refurbishment was ongoing while we were there but it was very discreet and didn't bother us at all, in fact we found the hotel quite peaceful.The continental breakfast was delicious and plentiful and served with good cheer. The reception staff were extremely polite and helpful and spoke excellent english. I'm sorry I didn't ask for the name of the young man whom I presume is the manager. He kindly phoned 'Paris Shuttle Service' on our behalf when they messed up our booking and subsequently booked us alternative transport back to the airport. (32 euros for 2 people) Another plus is a small bar in the reception area where you can have a drink or a coffee anytime and read the free newspapers and magazines provided daily. We were given a code for free (very fast) Wi fi access in our room which was a real bonus. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes (some quite lively and others more sedate) within easy walking distance of the hotel and the Rue des Boulets metro is a stones throw from hotel, while the bigger Nation metro (and rer) is only a short walk along the Boulevard Voltaire. I would recommend a visit to the beautiful and tranquil Pere Lachaise Cemetry which is around 15mins walk from the hotel. Excellent hotel, charming staff...we will certainly stay at the Grand Hotel Francais when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheshirecate
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short but perfect stay in this lovely hotel. Rooms are small but what do you expect in old buildings in Paris! However, our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.The management have taken real care and pride in their use of interior design and have made a conscious choice to use the best of French materials and workmanship. The hotel is very near to a Metro station and within easy reach of many of Paris' famous sights. Each morning we enjoyed a fresh and substantial breakfast. A nice touch was the free English newspaper. I would definitely return if we go back to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnBarwise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for three nights at the end of February 2009 (my girlfriend and I) after finding cheap flights to Paris. After looking at LOTS of hotels in Paris on TripAdvisor we decided to go for the Hotel Grand Francais on the basis of it's reviews, after filtering all Paris hotels for ones under Â£100 a night. The location is slightly out of the way (i.e. not in central Paris), but is right beside Rue de Boulets Metro Station and a 5 to 10 minute walk to Nation Station, which has 4 Metro lines and one RER line running through it. We ended up using 3 carnets of Metro tickets (10 in each Carnet for 11.40 Euros) in the 4 days we were there between us (including getting to and from the airport bus drop off station at Porte Maillot) and the journey into central Paris (even to the Eiffel Tower in West Paris) was no problem. The slightly out of the way location was certainly worth it in terms of the saving you would make over other hotels of a similar quality in the centre of the city. After an early flight from Glasgow we arrived at the hotel at around 11am. While we weren't able to check in we received a warm welcome from the very helpful receptionist and were able to leave our bags there and go off and see Notre Dame before coming back at 4pm and checking in. The room (no. 36) wasn't particularly big, but we were expecting this from the reviews we'd read and it is apparently a norm for most hotels in Paris. It was clean though, very nicely decorated and the bathroom was immaculate with a great shower. It was always warm, even though it was fairly chilly outside, and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was your typical continental style breakfast served in the basement breakfast room, with croissants, pain au chocolat, mini baguettes/batons of bread and some mini brioche type buns that were very nice. There was cornflakes or musli if you wanted cereal, and ham, salami, butter, emmental and cream cheese too. All very tasty! Oh, and tea, coffee and orange juice to drink. All in all the only thing that could have improved our stay at the Grand Hotel Francais was if it had been nearer to the city centre, but then it would presumably have been twice the price! PS, other reivews have mentioned Les Galopins restaurant nearby which we managed to get to on a Thursday evening. Have to agree with other reviews and say it was definitely worth going. The food was very good, reasonably priced, and its clientele seems to be more authentic Parisiens than tourists, meaning you get the proper Paris experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: BJC84
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a number of reasons, it was highly rated (around 50) out of all the hotels listed on trip advisor (around 2000), reports from independent web sites and the cost when compared to others around the same rating and were not disappointed. It is located very close to the Rue de Boulets metro station but is also only a 10-15 minute walk to the Nation metro station which is an intersection for a number of metro lines. It is outside the normal tourist area and as such the language could be a barrier, we are basic French speakers and got by. The service we received was really good and the manager (apologies never asked your name), arriving around 10:30 we checked straight in as our room was ready. We had asked for a room with a view and was not disappointed, on the first floor overlooking the main road. On checking in were given a tourist map (really helpful), local restaurant recommendations, and some champagne (not sure if this is the norm but the visit was for our 25th Wedding Anniversary) and finally some helpful phrases in French (we also got these most days). The room was not large (we paid for a superior room) but had everything we needed for our 5 day stay. It has been redecorated recently in a modern style with the bathroom also having a hydro jet shower. A negative here is that the TV did not have BBC (you're not there to watch TV but its nice to keep in touch and its listed on the web site) and no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The hotel is still going through an upgrade but disruption is kept to a minimum. Breakfast is the usual continental style, with a good choice including tea and coffee. In our opinion more than adequate as you can have as much or little as you like. The breakfast room is in the basement, with tables set for 4. We always managed to get a seat, though we did see times when people had to wait though not for long (a couple of minutes). They also have daily newspapers for the guest's to take or return to the paper rack, English paper is the "The Guardian". A lot of people have commented on the noise. In our opinion noise was no more or less than in others we have stayed in, you could hear people from time to time but not what they were saying. All the staff were really helpful and ready to answer any question's you have. On the whole a great hotel which we definitely recommend, and are intending to go back and will stay here. The restaurants we tried locally were Chez Prosper (around a 15-20 min walk), this was for lunch on the day we arrived. This is were we found out about the language barrier, we were told we had to sit outside as I did not have a tie on (Talking to the hotel receptionist it seems this is not the case). On the food side my wife had a mixed fish salad which was excellent, I had a steak and did not enjoy it at all. We also went to Les Galopins (around 5-10 min walk), a traditional French bistro type restaurant with a great atmosphere. Le Ceffalu (around 5-10 min walk) is an Italian restaurant, they don't do pizza but do carbonara which is not on the menu. Both of the last 2 we recommend you book to ensure you get a table and they know you have come from the hotel, a number of people were turned away who turned up on spec. One of the things we liked at all these restaurants is that the locals use them and on a regular basis by the way they are greeted. There are lots of other cafe's, tabac's and fast food type restaurants locally, around the nation circle there are also local take away's (not international chain's). Travelling around the City was really easy and we bought a 5 day (1-6 zone pass) for around â‚¬49 (about Â£45 at today's exchange rate), may seem expensive but we used this all week including getting from and too the airport. Finally a great find of a friendly hotel which is well located for getting around easily, with local amenities so you get the true French experience. Check out the various web sites before booking as we found the prices vary quite a lot.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: una_pink
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel on Valentines Day after a recommendation from a friend. We were greeted by Zyzad who was extremely helpful- allowing us to store our luggage as we had arrived early and wanted to go sightseeing straightaway. We were given lots of helpful tips on how to use the metro, as well as what stops had the major attractions- a must in such a huge city! When we returned to our room we were delighted to see that it was stylish, comfortable but most importantedly CLEAN!! I have to say that although small, the room was perfectly formed and provided us with an excellent base for our first visit (of many, I hope) to Paris. It has a great location, close to a major train station and a metro line- which means that everything is in easy reach! I look forward to returning to the Grand Hotel Francais someday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and superb location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: goviley
Reviews.Content: We stayed over valentines weekend at this hotel. It is located within a few steps of the Rue Des Boulets Metro station and was easy and not too time consuming to get to from the airport. We arrived early and the hotel were happy to let us leave our bags safely in their luggage store so we could enjoy the rest of the day at Disney, which again is easy to get to from the Hotel, the next stop on the metro from the hotel at Nation you can catch the RER A on to Disney, the trains leave every 10 minutes. The room at the hotel was recently refurbished and although small it was of a really high quality and in perfect condition with a LCD TV on the wall. Most importantly the hotel and the room and bathroom were spotless, I have never been to a hotel that was so clean and tidy which was great. No problems with noise really, it is no different than any other hotel that I have been to before really, the road noise from outside was no different than you would expect from a city, in fact the road was mostly very quiet - which was a pleasant surprise being in such a large city. The staff were all very friendly and happy to talk to us in English as our French was rather limited. We had a complimentary bottle of wine when we had to wait a few moments for our room to be cleaned when we arrived back on the second day. Again when we left we were allowed to leave our bags in the luggage store so we could check out and come back later in the day to pick our bags before going to the airport. The breakfast was great in the basement below, you could have as much as you needed to eat and help you self, again everything was fresh and the very clean. All in all, a First Class Hotel that I would recommend to all and it will help make your stay in Paris a really enjoyable one. It is clear the people who run the hotel take great pride in offering a great service and great, clean and well appointed place to stay. And it is very easy to get to the many sights Paris has to offer, get a Mobilis Metro pass and away you go!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: djph
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, rooms very modern, with the best shower ive ever had!! The rooms are a little small, but no more than expected for a city hotel, and are definately cosy rather than cramped. The reception staff are excellent, very friendly and extremely helpful with anything you need. The breakfast is served in the basement and consists of cereals, breads, juice, fruit and yoghurts, cold cuts and cheeses its of good quality and you can help yourself to as much as you want. I would certainly recommend this hotel, and will be going back in a few years. Paris itself is a beautiful city, the people are as friendly as anywhere else ive been, the metro is very efficient and easy to use, and is the best and cheapest way to see the city, get a map from the hotel and plan the sites you would like to go to and their nearest stations from this, buy a day pass (about 9E) or two day pass from the metro station machines, you can back travel round all day and evening, and go back to the airports on this ticket too!! Of the sites i would CERTAINLY recommend the louvre (if you have time spend a whole day here), go up the eiffel tower for amazing views, notre dame cathedral, sacre couer, place de la concorde, and go to the arc de triumphe to watch the cars somehow avoiding hitting each other on this interchange (its insane!!).

Reviews.Title: “OK - A bit dissapointed with all the hype”
Reviews.Author: DENSAWE
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Paris. First time we stayed in a hotel which is part of a large hotel chain, this was basic, walking distance for all attractions, clean and nicely in proportion. On our second visit my partner and I decided to spend a bit more and get something a bit more special. Stayed here for 3 nights January. Rooms are nice enough, small and pretty noisey woke early each morning ( you can here other people in toilets, in the shower or banging about and we were very rarely in the room) !! I felt a bit dissapointed with previous reviews about this hotel being so good, I think I was just expecting something more....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....”
Reviews.Author: PCMatt101
Reviews.Content: As with many of the previous reviews I wholeheartedly agree that this hotel is deserving of more than three stars (although the price would probably go up). The Grand Hotel is small, but perfectly formed. It is in a prime location, being within 2 - 5 minutes walk of two metro stops; it is perfectly placed to see all of the sights, but is afforded the added bonus of being a little out of the centre so that food prices are a little cheaper. Upon arriving we were greeted by the friendly manager who explained what was what, and also gave us a map of Paris and also one that they had prepared of the local restaurants. The room was superb: modern and clean. We were lucky enough to be on the fifth floor and have a balcony facing the street. However, not having this, I believe, wouldn't have detracted from the experience. The rooms have toilet and ensuite facilities, and also a flat screen TV. The shower was almost worth the price alone! There is a lift that could fit upto four average sized people in it. The breakfast room is in the basement, and is large enough to accomodate the gradual trickle of guests through from 8.30 - 10.30. It is 10 Euros each and features cereal, croissants etc. Theoretically, you could keep on going up and helping yourself. The bed linen and towels were changed daily, and all of the staff were polite, friendly and helpful. Paris itself was a joy to visit. It was our first time visiting; we stayed for four nights, and already want to go back. Like any big city it is busy and bustling, but, to be honest, I found that all, or most, of the Parisians I encountered to be charming and polite - willing to speak English when our French failed us! The Metro system is fabulous and so easy to use. On local restarants, I recommend 'Chez Prosper' (it will be on the map the hotel staff give you); it is lively and bustling and is VERY popular with the local Parisians. There seems to be no formal booking system, but people seemed to turn up and 'queue', waiting for up to half an hour for a table. We went a little earlier our second time (7.30- 8pm), and managed to get a table without waiting. The food is divine! Order the steak: it's huge. If you are still reading reviews on hotels in the price range, the stop. Book this place now! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JR82
Reviews.Content: Good clean rooms. Good breakfast included in our price. Very close to metro station. Another vote for the restaurant Galopins as it was really lovely and good value. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Chezza00
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality for the price. The rooms are lovely - tastefully decorated and modern, the bathroom has a great power shower and everywhere is kept spotlessly clean. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. I visited with several of my friends and we all had a fantastic experience. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The metro is minutes away and there's some great restaurants and bars in the immediate vacinity. A brilliant find in a fantastic city..... I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Attention to every detail!”
Reviews.Author: HanslersTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Hotel Francais for 3 nights. My husband and I have travelled quite extensively and have stayed in many beautiful hotels, Inns and B&B's over our travels, and this hotel was no exception. It was rated as a 3 star, but it really could be closer to 5 stars. It was recently renovated and the room was beautifully furnished in very contemporary expresso furniture and pretty textiles. The bathroom, although the smallest we have ever had in our travels, was also very nicely done. The breakfasts in the morning were filling and very nice. A great assortment of cheeses, cereals, yogurts, and pastries. (The croissants were phemomenal - I will never be able to eat another croissant from Canada again!) Also, the gentleman at the front desk was always very friendly and extremely helpful with directions, making dining reservations, even advising us where to get the best Dijon mustard to take back home and he offered to mail our postcards! Also, the restaurant Les Gallopins was recommended to us by a lady at reception and it was wonderful! (must order the Fondant au Chocolat avec Creme Fraiche - worth every calorie!) Our stay in Paris was wonderful, in large part to our great accommodations. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel with 5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: Backbiter
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Francais was recently renovated and the room we were in was immaculate. One of the best showers I've ever used in a hotel. The service was amazingly friendly and helpful. Every suggestion they made for restaurants was spot on and you could tell that each member of the staff took a lot of pride in their service. The Nation neighborhood doesn't have many Paris sites, but is minutes away from all due to the fact that 4 or 5 major Metro lines run through the area. We enjoyed the fact that it was less of a tourist area and soaked in some real Parisian atmosphere. People in the neighborhood were very friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “A 'Grand' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emptynesters08
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful long weekend in Paris. Having decided on our hotel based mainly on Trip Advisor reviews, the Grand Hotel Francais exceeded our expectations! The Management and staff were all very helpful and friendly. Our room was spotless, roomy by Paris standards and the bed one of the most comfortable we have slept on for a long time. The hotel is very convenient for the Metro, which we discovered after walking almost the length of the Boulevard Voltaire on our arrival Can't wait for a return visit to Paris and would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I chose 'Grand Hotel Francais' for my trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: report88
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as a result of Tripadvisor reviews and wasn't disappointed. The manager has a great sense of humour and understands Brits very well. We were the first into one of the brand new rooms and it was superb! The MOST COMFORTABLE BED AND DUVET EVER! Luxurious & crisp white sheets changed daily. Immaculate. Lots of mirrors & flat screen TV. It was the first time I have ever looked forward to sleeping in a hotel bed. This is the only hotel I have stayed in where complementary slippers are provided (excellent) and daily English newspapers ready and free at breakfast. As others have said The Metro is right nearby and a doddle to use and very cheap and reasonably clean. Do make sure you get your tickets in advance as not all stations have a machine or attendant. Even though it rained for most of our break we did a lot of walking despite the nearness of the Metro and found everywhere accessible by foot & the Parisians very helpful indeed with offering & providing directions without us even asking. For children the Evolution exhibition at the Natural History Museum is wonderful but get there early as the queues are long. There is also a small zoo there and some great pushchair walks in the grounds. For history buffs - dont miss the Pantheon or Basilica St. Denis. Foodwise - Opposite the hotel is a small supermarket and divine bakery. They are Jewish run so shut on Saturdays but open Sundays. The bread is the best ever and still hot, the pastries are delicious. It gets very busy and seems to have a complicated system of ordering and paying which I couldn't work out. We loved the staff at the Gallopins restaurant & the food is hearty & plentiful and of the 'bouchon' type. We liked the pasta bar in the food hall of the Hommes section of Galleries Lafayette - pricey but great for people watching and usually space when everywhere else is full. The famous cafe 'Les Deux Magots' in St. German de Pres was great when we went in the evening for coffee & supper but absolutely dire (dirty tables, lipsticked glasses & food stuck on cutlery, rude overworked waiters, smelly loos, bog- standard salads, wrong orders provided) when we went in the next afternoon. Overall we loved Paris and heartily recommend 'Grand hotel Francais' - we will definitely be back. It felt like ' home from home'.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable hotel near major metro stations”
Reviews.Author: RWAppleWannabe
Reviews.Content: This was our ninth or tenth trip to Paris in three years, and I echo other comments about how convenient the hotel is to metro stations, and Rue Paul Bert (the darling of food media right now) is less than a 5-minute walk away. Eric Kayser has a branch of his outstanding boulangerie near Nation metro station, so in terms of eating, we were well-placed. It's a bit of a hassle getting over to the Left Bank from the hotel (particularly bc the 86 bus wasn't running last weekend), but accessing the Right Bank was no problem at all. I'm very likely to stay here again. The Grand Hotel Francais was excellent value. For more detail on our trips to Paris, please see my blog at http://rwapplewannabe.wordpress.com/tag/paris/

Reviews.Title: “lovely, lovely, lovely”
Reviews.Author: STRESSED_MUM_OF_2
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before going and chose this hotel from previous comments. We were in no way dissapointed. 20 steps away from a metro station (Rou Boulets) with Nation station about 5 mins away where there were more connecting lines. In a nice area with restaurants scattered around sits this lovely little gem of a parisien hotel. All the staff were very friendly and the rooms have been refurbished to an excellent standard. We chose not to upgrade to a superior room and were pleased we had not. I think all you get is a slightly larger room, but the room we had (room 32) was perfectly adequate, yes it was quite small but I think not a bad size for paris hotel rooms. The bathroom is very clean and compact and the shower gorgeous. There was a slight smell in the bathroom at times, (not us!!!). It smelt like 'onions' but i think it must have been the drainage. It was never bad enough to bother us. They are still refurbishing the lower floors but this does not disturb guests in any way. There was a plentiful supply of pastires, cereal, yoghurts, meat and cheese for breakfast and they even let us take some for the airport as we had an early departure. If you take the metro line from outside the hotel to ALMA MARCEAU you are opposite the Eiffel tower!! and this is also the stop for boat trips. Also a memorial for Diana is situated here above the tunnel in which she died. A must to see is the Eifffel tower at night, it looks stunning. Also the Moulin Rouge is well worth treating yourself, the men especially love the show!! Previous reviewers mentioned LES GALOPINS restaurant and the hotel recommend it too. It is lovely. Extremely friendly staff and very very reasonably priced for Paris!!! The meal was delicious. Just one tip, we went for 3 days---- not enough!!!! wish we were still there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: hannah_193
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais in September 2008 for three nights. I was visiting Paris on my own, in advance of being there on a training course. When I checked in I was lucky enough to be upgraded to the hotel's suite, which was absolutely lovely - I had booked a standard double room, so I was very pleased with the upgrade. The room was not the size of a suite that you might expect in a five star hotel, but for a Paris hotel room it was huge. The hotel is recently refurbished, and is beautifully decorated. The room was gorgeously furnished, with a lovely bathroom and very comfortable furnishings, plus a flat screen TV. It also had a small balcony. The hotel is situated near Place de la Nation, so although it's not right in the centre, and therefore not walking distance from the main attractions, it is less than 5 minutes walk from Metro Nation, which has very good connections to all the popular sites. Metro Rue des Boulets is even closer - about 20 seconds from the hotel. Boulevard Voltaire, where the hotel is located, is a pleasant street with numerous shops, cafes, patisseries etc. The traffic was not overly heavy and there was no noise in my room so I slept very well. The room was also air conditioned, so it would be fine for a summer stay. There was unlimited free Wifi which was easy to connect to. There are lots of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance of the hotel, and they gave some recommendations on a map when I checked in. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were all polite, friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble and they were very knowledgeable about the city. They all spoke excellent English (and other languages from what I saw) but were happy to indulge me when I wanted to practice my rather rusty French. I will be returning to Paris in May and definitely plan to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvllr40
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel, my girlfriend and I thought the reviews sounded too good to be true. However on arrival we soon realised that the reviews are to be believed. The hotel itself was very easy to reach from the airport by train and metro (about 45 minutes in all), with the walk form the final metro stop to the front door taking no more than two minutes. The rooms themselves are compact, but this seems to be the norm across Paris. Despite the space the room was in brilliant condition and a pleasure to stay in. The staff were most friendly and extremely helpful. For the price of the room, I would challenge anyone to find a better hotel in Paris. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geengem
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for three nights for our honeymoon. The hotel was easy to find, and very close to a metro station, so you don't even need to walk the five/ten minutes from the larger station at Nation. The rooms were very nicely done out, clean and quiet - with air conditioning, safe and mini fridge (and a very comfortable bed with the softest pillows!!) the only thing I would say was missing was tea and coffee making facilities (although this may be not be a standard thing in Paris hotels anyway). Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, continental breakfast very nice. We would certainly stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: IrelandTilly
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay in Paris. Chose this hotel due to the excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. Still some upgrading of rooms on level 1 and 2 going on, but only during the day and we were out all day anyway. Had fantastic room which even had a table and two chairs, lots of bathroom space with an excellent shower - Room 61. Had two windows but a step up to the little balconies, not direct as on floors below. The bed was great, and nice crisp linen. It is only minutes from a Metro station or a short walk to the main station. In a quiet area by night, but felt safe enough. We booked for tours (Moulin Rouge and Night Seine Cruise) and had a great tour of Paris on our return journeys as we were always last dropped off. The staff at the hotel are excellent, friendly and helpful. We owe a special thanks to Jacques the night porter who made our coffee how we like it each night on our return, and made me a cup of tea each morning. They recommended local restaurants and we chose their top pick on the one night when we were not heading out, and it was excellent. Les Galopins was a superb restaurant and had an English speaking waitress. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Praise for Grand Hotel Francais”
Reviews.Author: si7sud
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais last week (13th - 17th) and were very happy with our stay. After reading tripadvisor reviews we decided to book the hotel as we had got a good deal. We could not complain at all about anything in our room (61) everything was perfect from the decor to the air conditioning. The space available in the room was fantastic and the shower room, especially the shower with jets that was fantastic. We had 2 small balconies whcih the doors opened and as we were on the top floor we left them open. On holiday it is always a thought sometimes to come back to your hotel but not here we felt very relaxed in the room and enjoyed coming home to sleep. The service provided in the hotel was brilliant, the cleaners were very thorough in the rooms and the reception staff were brilliant - especially the young girl who gave us so much info regarding places to go and how to use the metro. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel but there are so many patisseries near by we just bought from them. We also ate in a recommended restaurant, Les Galopins, it was a fantastic meal, we thoroughly enjoyed it and wasn't too expensive. The metro service is easy once you get used to it and 2 stations were nearby rue de boulets (line 9 - took us to eiffel tower) and nation which has a lot of lines going through and also RER A which takes u to Disney (35mins). We mostly walked to the attractions as the weather was good, the walks are very enjoyable. One thing the hotel didn't have was tea and coffee facilities so we brought our own kettle as we like a cup of tea (Milk is available at near supermarket). We took a Taxi to the airport the day we left because we had an early flight cost approx 45 euros - make sure you are waitin for the taxi and not the other way round (On arriving at the airport we took the RER B to gare du nord then line 5 to oberkampf and then 9 to Rue de boulets). All in all our stay in France and at the Grand Hotel Francais was fantastic. thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jadinew
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais at the end of June this year. As there are SO MANY hotels in Paris I made sure to do my research on Tripadvisor and was encouraged by the many great reviews on here. We were certainly not disappointed with our stay. We stayed in room 51, which was a superior shower room. The room was newly renovated (as is the whole of the hotel now, I think) with full air conditioning, a fridge, safe, flat screen TV and lovely balcony. It was well worth paying the few Euros extra for the superior room, as the large walk-in shower was great. Yes, the rooms are fairly small but they're perfectly adequate and don't feel cramped. We didn't have any problems with noise from the metro or street (as we were on the 5th floor and were able to keep the balcony doors shut) although there was a small amount of noise between rooms, but not too much. The staff were very friendly and helpful but not prying, which was perfect for us. The hotel's location is great for accessing all the Parisian sights via the brilliant metro service. When travelling from CDG airport, take the RER to Gare Du Nord, then get the metro no. 4 line to Strasbourg St Denis, and then change onto the no. 9 line to Rue De Boulets. We found this to be the easiest way to get to and from the airport and it only cost us about 8 Euros each. The hotel is right next to the Rue De Boulets station. I think it's just a short walk to the right. It is also close to many handy shops such as supermarkets and boulangeries.During our stay, we ate at the nearby Les Galopins restaurant and found it to be as great as previous reviews have claimed. The staff were extremely friendly and generous (even giving us free drinks as a welcome, as well as an English menu, which was very helpful!) and the food was great, traditional French cuisine. Overall, I cannot fault the Grand Hotel Francais for its service and location, and I would highly recommend it as a great hotel for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Smithwicks_1710
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hotel for three nights in July. From the first time we reached the hotel, we were treated with great service especially from the friendly manager on the front desk. The rooms were small but modern in appearance and recently renovated. Bathroom was clean and towels changed daily. Breakfast was simple but sufficient and offered plenty of choices. Location is excellant with the metro only minutes away. We will be returning on our next visit to Paris and will be recommending to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucg71
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in Paris, staying at the Grand Hotel Francais. We had a room on the 6th floor which had been renovated. For a European hotel room, it was spacious and nice. In room safe, air conditioner, flatscreen tv with cable, big stand up shower and a comfortable bed. The room was very clean and comfortable. The neighbourhood is nice and quiet, with many restaurants, bakeries and grocery stores nearby. The hotel is also only 2 blocks away from one of the main metro stations which makes getting around the city easy. Our concierge, Diede, was extremely friendly and helpful. He definitely played a hand in making our week long trip enjoyable. On our next trip to Paris we will probably stay at the Grand Hotel Francais again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful saty at Grand Hotel Francais!”
Reviews.Author: slarrabee691
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful 120 yr old hotel! It's newly rennovated and quaint. Zyad, the manager, is the most gracious host! What a great stay. I absoluletly would recommend to anyone. Very close to the Metro & RER. Did not need a car at all!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable considering costs.”
Reviews.Author: mtveter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my anniversary in April. The renovated room was impressive. While expectedly small, the room had a pleasant feel to it and the furnishings were surprisingly high-end (lots of nice woods and great ceiling work.) TV is flat screen and shower is much better than what you usually get in Europe. The hotel is close to two metro stops and is in a decent part of the 11th arrondissiment. Nation metro stop should get you anywhere you need to be. Staff was far better than expected. Manager is fluent in english and just about everyone else there spoke at least a little of it. Cute little bar at entrance and decent breakfast room (though 10 euro per person was steep for petit dejuner.) Only real complaint is slow elevator. The best part of the room was the cost. You can get a package deal for under 110 euros per night. Though this is $175, it is Paris and is about half of what you'd expect to pay for a hotel of this quality (closest other hotel on street was same price and a dump.) I work for a high-end hotel chain in the US and even talked the place up to my cohorts (some of the better items could easily be replicated here.) I would recommend this to anyone (couples, kids, pensioners) though you should ask for the highest floor possible as the lower rooms are not yet renovated (ok but far inferior.)

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SallyJP
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice staff, lovely room (incl a proper bathroom with bath). We paid a bit extra for a superior room and would cheerfully do so again. I can't think of a single fault.

Reviews.Title: “simple but perfect!”
Reviews.Author: birdbeak
Reviews.Content: this hotel was absolutely perfect for our time in paris--it was superbly close to many metro stops, including the nation station--making it very easy to navigate the city. the staff were nothing short of amazing--so friendly, especially zhed(sp?). he helped us out of many a complicated snafu! we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A happy stay”
Reviews.Author: smortion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, has a lovely little bar and reception area and very nice breakfast. The rooms are simple, but perfect for a short stay. The staff and management were extremely friendly and helpful. Our travel agent went into administration shortly before our trip which was a bit of a problem, but the hotel sorted things out for us and smoothed over what could have been a bit of a nightmare- so we were really grateful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, as we throughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: SnowGlow
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, it was clean, the staff were friendly and really helpfull. Our room was small but we hardly spent any time there so we didn't mind. View from the room was lovely and looked out over the Paris rooftops. Location of the hotel was good, excellent rail links and it is possible to walk to the main attactions if you don't mind walking and the weather is nice, or you can get a cab. We found a lovely restaurant nearby called the Marco Pollo (if it's still there).

Reviews.Title: “Great family Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rin100
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay of 3 days in Paris , with my husband 2 children and my sister. Staff were very freindly and helpful, rooms were better than expected, very clean and larger than expected for Paris.More than adequate breakfast, and we found the location was realy central to everything. We also ate at Le Galopins restaurant close by , and it was our best meal in Paris. Would definitely stay here acgain if we return to Paris in future. Thanks to everyone atThe Grand Hotel Francais!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value + Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samburrows
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a small pre christmas getaway, the deal came out of The Times and was linked to a Eurostar journey. The staff at this hotel are really fantastic, so friendly and helpful. When we arrived they talked us through our location (which was fantastically placed) and gave us a superb list of local restaurants. Like a previous reviewer we ate at Les Galopins twice too, amazing food and good prices. Would reccommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: azarbrook
Reviews.Content: My husband booked an air+hotel package through Jublilee travel and we loved this hotel. You are very close to one of the most central metros (Nation). The first morning we woke up at 3am (due to the time difference) and laid in bed until 5am and finally went downstairs to the front desk and asked if we could go somewhere for breakfast this early - he said no but to follow him. He took us down a spiral staircase to a cozy little breakfast area. We sat down and one of the staff brought us a carafe of espresso and one of hot milk to make our own cappucino or latte. They had fresh croissants, pain au chocolate (yum!), cheeses, meats, fresh fruit, yogurts, cereals, juices. It was included in our package and we didn't even know it. When we left the hotel though we noticed that it was posted on a wall the breakfast rate (25 euro per person), so it was good it was included. Small rooms, but clean and opening windows. Did I mention how good the breakfast was!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: HappyGuy54
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for us overall.....great location a stone's throw from Nation, one of Paris' primary hubs with RER and four Metro lines (1, 2, 6 and 9) and right above Rue des Boulets station on Metro no. 9!!! So convenient to get all over Paris and easy to and from CDG airport...only 8.2 Euros each way---<$12!!! Mgr. Zyad and his whole staff were very helpful in every way; they recommend restaurants and cafes nearby; just ask! Our room was newly renovated 100%...bathroom was ultra modern and fresh. Our only little problem was with the computerized phone system but that was resolved. Ask Mr. Zyad to make you a cup of LaVazza double latte espresso at the bar!!! Hope you enjoy Grand Hotel Francais and the staff as much as we did recently. "I Love Paris in the.........". Bobby and Jeannie Moon, Houston TX

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Rocksy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night recently and it was terrific. My friend was sick in the middle of the night and they organised an English speaking doctor without any fuss and the following morning bought us breakfast to our room. The location is terribly convenient with Metro on the doorstep and RER just down the road at Nation. The staff were attentive and helpful all the time. For the price, it's brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “ok choice for a stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kasibru
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel in August for four nights. It's an ok option, with clean rooms, a good breakfast (for France) and friendly service. The room was quite small though, just big enough for a double bed and a tiny adjacent bathroom. The hotel's location is quite convenient, close to metro and RER lines and you are quickly everywhere in Paris. The service is very good and staff at the reception extremely friendly and helpful. If you get a good deal on the room rates, definitely worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: disney743
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for the second time in June 2007 (the first time was in 2003). We decided to stay here again as we found the hotel so convenient for the Metro and the RER and as you are so near to Nation you have the bars, supermarkets, restaurants etc within easy walking distance. We found the hotel to be clean and the staff very friendly - they can't do enough to help you. The breakfasts are great and the range of pastries brilliant. The only thing I would say about staying in this hotel is be aware that it is an old building and therefore it does not have great soundproofing. The hotel is situated on a busy road so you will get traffic noise. We could also hear the people in the next room use their shower and flush their toilet - it was so loud that it actually sounded like they were in the same room as us. I didn't remember it being this bad from our first visit. I would recommend this hotel for your first trip to Paris as it is so convenient to the RER if you want to go to Disneyland Paris but if I do return for a third trip (I love the city so much) I would probably look around for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for the third time !”
Reviews.Author: elcieWales
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and helpful staff especially the man on reception ! Really good breakfast - fresh fruit salad, croissants,coffee etc all served up by a kind lady who did not laugh at our attempts at speaking french.Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: KGTravels
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a two-night stay in the Grande Hotel de Paris, and it was very nice hotel in a central location near Nation/Rue de Boulets Metro stations. Check-in was pain-free with fantastic help from the lady on reception, who also pointed out how to get to the main attractions easily on a map for us. The room was a little small, but it was comfortable, clean and well-equipped. The shower was lovely and powerful and had nice fluffy towels, but could really do with a shower curtain!!! Breakfast was superb - croissants, pastries, cereal, fruit salad, yoghurts, rolls etc This was included in our rate, but I think it was 10 euro otherwise. We had a nice meal last night, after going through Time Out Paris for tips, and after realising that you should really book in advance, we found upon a nice traditional bistro restaurant about 10 mins walk from the hotel, called Au Vieux Chene (rue du Dahomey - we got so lost trying to find this road and the restaurant kindly gave us directions over the phone - but it's right by the corner of Rue Faidherbe and Rue Chazny by the Faidherbe Chaligny metro station). Well worth a visit and the pork was fab. Beware of beer prices though, even off the tourist-trap areas you could get stung for 12 Euro a beer - check first!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for us”
Reviews.Author: DKTraveler
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Grand Francais in March of this year (2007) and it turned out to be the absolutely perfect choice for us. We had a corner room on the first floor with three French balcony windows, very bright, it was small, but clean and completely sufficient for our needs. The staff, and particularly the hotel manager, were friendly, upbeat, helpful and happily for my sad French levels, spoke English very well. The area of Paris the Grand Francais is located in may not be right at the centre of all the tourist action, but that's one of the things that's nice about it. We did all our sightseeing "downtown" during the day, then came home to a very lovely residential area in the evenings. Still well within the city, but quieter, and very easily accessible to everywhere by Paris's amazing Metro system. If I'm ever lucky enough to return to Paris, this is where I'll definitely stay again. Thank you, Grand Francais!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMNandDMN
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two-week European vacation, having spent our first four nights in Paris at the Grand Hotel Francais. The hotel was terrific, an excellent value, and I would recommend it to anyone. Zyad, the daytime manager of the hotel, (who speaks English) took time everyday to provide us with city maps, directions, and whatever assistance we needed to navigate the city. He couldnâ€™t have been anymore helpful. The hotel itself is very nice. Its located close to a metro stop, which we found extremely helpful. The rooms are fairly small by American standards, but are standard European size. Although clean and quiet, donâ€™t expect many amenities. The hotel was a great choice, and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: pjs2780
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon in Paris and had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hotel Francais. We booked it as part of a flight-and-hotel deal, and after our stay there, we think we made out like bandits! Our room was very large with a huge bathroom, had a nice view of the side road, and was very clean. It smelled a little bit of smoke (the front desk had warned us that it is hard to keep people from smoking even in a non-smoking room, so we were prepared), but we had brought some Febreze with us (I never go to a hotel without it now) and that took care of it. The location is phenomenal -- close to the Metro as well as bakeries, fruit markets, and restaurants, the front desk staff was very helpful (directed us to good restaurants, helped us buy our Metro pass, and cleared our confusion about how to get to Versailles) and converses well in English. We will definitely stay here again, especially if we get another great deal like we did! Some tips: buy the museum pass -- we loved being able to choose places off the beaten path simply because they were free. Eat at Cafe Bonal near the hotel; the food is amazing. Skip the hotel breakfast, instead get almond croissants from one of the nearby bakeries and some fresh fruit from one of the markets. Pain de Pomme and the Brioche Doree have great sandwich/dessert/drink deals, perfect for the budget traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loopylouise75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais first weekend in March and found it to be more than adequate for our break. Our room was of an average size, in fact by Parisian standards, I'd say it was big, even! The shower room was pretty small but how long do you spend in the shower room anyway? The room was cleaned every day of our stay and the beds made. The beds were comfortable but the pillows were not! If you have room in your case, pack your own pillow! I slept with 3 and they were still too thin! Overall, the room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate with pastries, yoghurts, cereals, jams, juices and tea or coffee and replenished frequently. Staff were really nice and helpful and will tell you where is good to eat/which metros to use/train times etc etc. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: kedge
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from four nights at the Grand Hotel Francais. I booked the hotel because of the many good reviews from the tripavisor, and I am glad I did so. The staff were pleasant and very helpful, and the rooms were nicely decorated, warm and cleaned everyday. We also received fresh towels and soap daily. The location is superb, with close metro links. My partner and I used the Nation metro station because it had a number of lines running through, and you could get to a lot of places without having to change trains. The breakfast had a great continental choice, although i don't think I would have paid for it seperately if it hadn't been included in the price as the tarif showed it to be pricey. I would definately stay there again, and recommend it to all travellers to paris who are looking to travel on a budget. You can be assured that you are getting a good quality hotel. A little tip for fellow travellers, the price of beer is really expensive. With the price of a pint being up to 8 euros. However if you go into the little cafe bars in the metro station, you can get a beer much cheaper. Also one of the turn offs at the nation roundabout has a cinema, next door to the cinema on the right is a small bar that had a happy hour between 6-8. The price of a nice pint was 2 euros!! Not sure if that was only on saturdays though because it wasn't open on sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris with Superb Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: naneki06
Reviews.Content: It is centrally located between 2 metro stations. Zyad, the manager, is absolutely awesome and gave us the best maps and tour books on arrival. The morning breakfast was wonderful and the lady that works there Monday through Friday was such a doll. We loved hearing, "Bonjour Madame et Monsier (sp?)" from her every morning. We asked for the best room in the hotel due to our anniversary and we got room 62 I believe. It was on the top floor and had an awesome balcony and view. We loved every part of our hotel stay. There was a great deli/market across the street where we bought our wine and cheese and it was very reasonable. Also, the pharmacies nearby were great and open late. The chinese food restaurant 2 doors down is spectacular and we got great service. Everyone that works at hotel speaks English and they had great dining recommendations as well. On Sunday, Zyad suggested we go to the flea market because everything is closed and he was right--we got great bargain souvenirs. Tell him Nancy and Lorenzo sent you. He will know us I think! Enjoy and say hello to Paris, the best city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: chopper1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for a week between 28th Oct - 4th Nov 2006. What can I say it was a truly brilliant place to stay. It had everything i expected and staff that really would go out of their way to help. Especially the guy (sorry can't remember your name) he was behind the counter during the day. No question about Paris, parisiens or general tourist questions were too difficult. He helped with the most important one during my stay, where can I buy cigarettes? for those of you who dont know, unlike us in the UK were we can buy cigarettes pretty much everywhere, the french have funny licensing laws about tobbaco only allowed to be sold at tabacs, three of which are quite close to the hotel, but don't go looking a 10pm on a sunday night! Unlike some of the other reviews i read about the Grand Hotel Francais I already knew about the Metro and how every city in the world should have one, it is about a 2 minute walk from the Rue de Boulets and about 5 mins from Nation, were you can get the RER to Disneyland. The hotel is a good distance from the centre of paris and most of the top sites but with the metro you are only about 20mins from most places. We walked to Pere La Chaise in about 10 mins. The rooms were small but well kept, lets face it when you are in Paris, how much time do you spend in your room anyway. I cant really think of anything else to write some if you have any questions, feel free to ask me i'll be more than glad to answer them. Unlike some who tell you to search for it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant economical stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NKRR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent hours on the internet trying to find a decent hotel in Paris and we were very happy we chose this one. It is conveniently located near the metro and there are lots of eating places in the vicinity. The staff were hospitable and very helpful. Despite our limited knowledge of French they went out of their way to help us plan our 3 day itnerary. The room was small but clean.The noise from the road was not really a problem for us as we were on the 5th floor and kept the windows closed as the weather was chilly. For a 3 star hotel we were happy with the service/facilities. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! From a couple in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shawlands
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location for access to the metro. The room we were in was on the small side but was clean. We were on the ground floor, which should be avoided ,as the metro rumbles underneath from early morning to the small hours. We had booked for bed and breakfast and were astonished when, while checking out, we were told we had upgraded to a "buffet" breakfast and had to pay extra. At no time were we made aware that we had a choice for breakfast. The only food available in the dining room was laid out buffet style and we assumed that we just helped ourselves. So watch you aren't caught out by that one! We're still at a loss to think what the "breakfast" we booked should have been. Any ideas?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: bubbles66
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the posts I have decided to leave my comment. I know it was a while ago I was there but it is still fresh in my memory. What a fantasic little gem in Paris this hotel is! Off the beaten track and with fabulous staff ! Our room wa upgraded to a room with balcony because it was my 21st in January, they saw this by my date of birth on booking, what a lovely gesture! the staff were delightful, I tried to speak french a little but very badly and they really appreciated the attempt. It is in a great location for ccess to Metro system which we used ALL weekend and was so easy to get around and cheaply done ! I am planning on taking my sister to Paris for her 18th and I do not even need to look for a hotel because you can guarantee every time I am in Paris I will be staying right here !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TammyJackson
Reviews.Content: We agree with the other reviews that have commented on the friendliest and helpfulness of the staff in this hotel - they really are nice. And as described, it is in an excellent location for sightseeing plus you can book organized trips with them - we loved the one to Versailles and the trip on the Seine. However, we must also agree that the noise level from the road is pretty bad. As it was mid-June and pretty hot, shutting the windows would have meant suffocating. They definitely need air-conditioning so the windows can be kept shut. I would stay here again but in the Winter! We had a lovely time despite the road noise.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel - perfectly situated for seeing the sights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Hotel Francais was part of a Newspaper promotion with travel by Euorstar. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful and informative. Our room was better than the ones I''ve seen linked to this site, plus we had a balcony. Everywhere was exceptionally clean and well cared for. The only drawback was that as it was so hot at night we had to open the french doors which meant traffic noises were pretty loud (we were road facing). However, the location of the hotel was great for getting around Paris on the Metro. They also allowed us to keep or luggage at the hotel for the whole day after check out at 10am (our train was not until 6pm). I would happily stay there again i we went back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not very baby-friendly”
Reviews.Author: NandPMartin
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere to use as a base, this hotel is ideal, as it is close to the Nation Metro station, from which you can get to almost any part of Paris. It is also handy for dining out, and shopping for either clothes or local produce. And we have to say that the staff were very friendly, the room was a decent size (although you could barely turn around in the shower room). However, there was no air conditioning, so when the temperature soared to over 33oC it became extremely uncomfortable. A travel cot was provided for our baby and our bed was very comfortable. However, we put the baby on the carpet in our room to crawl around and when I picked him up, his hands, knees and feet were black. I'm not sure when they last cleaned the carpet. Also, the restaurant was OK, but there were no highchairs, and they would not allow us to take the pushchair into the restaurant. The first morning we had to feed our 14-month-old on our laps, which almost resulted in scalding hot tea being spilled everywhere. The second morning we had to feed him in the lobby and take it in turns to go and have breakfast in the restaurant. Apart from this, we had a very nice time there.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil68NearLincoln
Reviews.Content: Very good value 3* hotel. Booked as part of package with eurostar and not disappointed. Rooms okay, clean and who spends much time in hotel when in Paris anyway. V convenient for metro and bus. Staff very friendly. No air con so could be warm in summer. Breakfast was self service consisting of cereal, bread, croissant, danish, oj, tea coffee chocolate, with newspapers available. Look forward to going again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Tracek
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful (even with a sense of humour!) and I fail to see how anyone could not rate their service as excellent. The rooms are clean and tidy with everything you need and ours (on the 6th floor) even had two small balconies and plenty of room for our baby's cot. There is a little noise from the metro but again the higher floors are quieter if you can get them. Its about a 2 min walk to a metro that takes you straight into the Champse Elysse and about a 5 min walk to a larger metro station serving various other locations. Def recommend for a reasonably priced hotel with friendly staff suitable for a short city break. Would have no hesitation staying there again - lets hope I get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff....great weekend.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
