Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous weekend. My partner had booked this hotel for my 21st birtday and although it is not in the City Centre we found it very pleasant, friendly and relaxing. A great walk to all the tourist destinations passing lots of local shops on the way.My partner had requested for some flowers to be put in the room for our arrival, the flowers were presented beatifuly in a vase. The hotel staff are very helpful, telling us how to get to places, showing us on the map,booking reservations for dinner and taxi's to destinations. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed for a fantastic weekend. Would recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible services!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this socalled "Grand" hotel by tripadvisor and booked a double room by phone. The hotel is near subway, Although the location is good, but the services are awful. After my GF and I checked in, we found the room is very small PLUS it's very noisy B/C it's third floor and towards the street. So I called the reception to switch the room. But the reception refused to do so, because ALL THE ROOMS ARE FULL. What a lie! We checked out immediately. That's the worst hotel I've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: moulinal5
Reviews.Content: Charming, clean, comfortable, small hotel in a nice area close to Metro and RER stations. Our attic room had limited storage and a tiny wardrobe, but bathroom was spacious. Both rooms had traditional window-sized balconies! Breakfast was generous with plenty of choice. Reception staff were exceptionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stopped in this hotel for 3 nights and had no problems at all. Everyone from the manager to the cleaners were very friendly on arrival. Room is small (but perfectly big enough to 2 of us for 3 days) and comfortable, bathroom clean and tidy with fresh towels every day and good water pressure from the shower. Enjoyed the choice for breakfast - baguettes, croissants, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit salad, juice, meats and cheeses. Supermarket across the road was very convenient for essentials - water, etc Hotel is in great location, literally just 2 minutes from the nearest Metro station (Rue des Boulets) and bus stop (direct to Gard du Nord). Would definitely chose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I want to write a review on this Hotel in return to a great service that we got from them. Me & my husband stayed here for 7 nights last February & we had an awesome stay in Grand Hotel Francias. The room is enough for 2 people & they clean it everyday. The only thing that amazed me was the bathroom. It's has bathtub without a shower curtain, and so we have to sit down while taking a shower or else the whole bathroom will be wet. :) Aside from that, everything is fine. The staffs were great, specially Mahina & the manager/owner. They were so helpful to us in finding our way. The hotel is 1-2 minutes walk to the metro station, bank/post office, there's a grocery infront where you could buy fresh fruits and a lots of bakeries around. We didnt take the breakfast in the hotel because there were a lot of places to eat around - cheap!! I would definitely come back in this hotel on my next trip to Paris. Thanks guys........

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself,my mum, my godmother and her daughter stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and could not fault the hotel. I found it to be great value for money. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. The staff were so helpful and friendly, and really ensured that our stay was comfortable. The breakfast was good with a choice of baguettes, croissants, pastries etc. This is by far the best hotel i have stayed in when visiting Paris (this was my 4th visit.) It was only 10 minutes into the centre of Paris if you take the nation metro line to franklin d roosevelt which locates you to the middle of the champs elysees. Around the hotel were plenty of restaraunts we ate in these every night and never had a bad meal. I would certainly advise anyone to stay at the Grand Hotel and will definately be staying there on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3nights & could not have asked for better service! The hotel isn't 5star by any means, but for the price you are paying - the service is fantastic, the atmosphere is warm and friendly and the location is ideal with the Station Nation a walk away! We had fresh towels daily & the beds were changed daily also. The place is spotlessly clean also. I'd definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous, Darling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I chose this hotel after researching the comments on this site. Our experience far exceeded our expectations. The hotel was immaculate; the staff was wonderful; the room was toasty warm in chilly Paris; and after walking all day it was wonderful to come back to the hotel for a hot and steamy bath. I highly recommend you ask Zyad, the manager, all your tourist questions. He is a wealth of information and a delightful conversationalist. Also take advantage of the wonderful location to either walk or take the nearby metro to your tourist destinations. I hated to leave; I would highly recommend the hotel for great location, price point, comfort, and staff. Marvelous, darling.

Reviews.Title: “Little treasure”
Reviews.Author: lyndsayb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the new year period having booked after reading the existing glowing reports on here and was not disappointed. The hotel is small but the entrance is welcoming and the staff exceptionally helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 5th floor and was compact but satisfactory. The french windows were a welcomed touch and the full size bath also a bonus. Furnishings were basic but more than adequate for our stay. The hotel has a small breakfast room which serves continental breakfast from 7-11 every day and has a good selection of breads, cheese, pastries etc. The only downside to the hotel was the thin walls and you could hear other guests through the night. However, with it being new year this was to be expected and all these typical french buildings probably have the same problem. Although not centrally located, the hotel is a couple of minutes walk from the train and metro stops at Nation and from here you can get pretty much anywhere... 10 minutes on metro to champs elysee/louvre. For anyone wanting a comfortable break in Paris without spending a fortune.. book this hotel.. you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Really great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris on November 24, 2005. We stayed at the Au Grand Hotel Francais and loved it. We much prefer this type to a large chain. THe hotel staff was genuinely helpful, spoke great English, gave the best recommendations and directions and was just generally great. They fixed us a tray of tea every afternoon; so civilized! The location of the hotel is very convenient to the Metro (subway); the entrance was just across the street. Also, there were two great bakeries across the street where we had fresh croissants and pain de chocolat every morning for breakfast. And a wonderful little Italian cafe a couple of doors down. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: damen71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel Francais for 5 nights in October 2005. We had a room on the 4th floor in the back. The room was clean, and small which is typical in Europe. A little noisy from the street traffic. Not close to the attractions in Paris, but the metro is close. Bathroom was super clean, the only problem I had was with the tub, it said shower but it was a tub with a shower hose which was short. You had to squat down to use it, and there was no shower curtain so the bathroom got wet all the time. Other than that one thing it was great. Breakfast was a continental breakfast, criossants, meats, juice, French pastries, very good. The staff was always very helpful anytime I asked them for anything. Very polite and friendly. The hotel was close to 2 metro stations, one being Nation which connects to many lines. I would definitely stay there again if I stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: lindsaymcatsheffield
Reviews.Content: the staff were friendly, the lift big enough for 2 of us plus a very large case and the room small but perfectly reasonable, and bed clean and comfortable. that said, we were on the 2nd floor at the front of the building, and delighted to find we had a small balcony - until we stepped out onto it - the noise! constant traffic and the metro rumbling away not far below us every few minutes until about 1 in the morning. luckily it wasn't high summer, as it was we had a choice of sleeping with the balcony door shut, and being a bit warm, or opening it and not being able to sleep for the noise. also the waterpipes for what seemed like the whole hotel ran through our bathroom, and gurgled and gushed most of the night. however with the balcony door closed and the bathroom door closed, if a little stifled, we managed to avoid a fair amount of the noise. the walls were also thin, as we discovered when the people in the room next door came back late and argued!. however we did have a budget price offer, we live near a main road normally, and I assume if you got a room higher up in the 7 storey building, or at the back then you would be better off. the bed was excellent, the wardrobe space a bit limited, - a small wardrobe and a few small drawers, but the bathroom was clean, with complimentary shampoos and enough towels for two, the breakfast continued till late 10.30 or 11 the staff were friendly and chatty in english and kindly overlooked my attempts at french. breakfast was continental - cafe au lait or black coffee or tea seemed to be the only choices, plus cereal or fruit, brioches and jams and some assorted pain au chocolats and some meats and cheese - perfectly ok to start the day though the metro's rumbling could be felt below us, it meant it was only a very short walk - come out of the front door and turn right, and the nearest metro was 2 minutes away, Rue Des Boulets - with an escalator up to the street, just opposite hotel on the way back - heavenly for tired feet- nearer than Nation. it was very convenient for getting about everywhere by metro, train and probably bus if you could figure them out! we bought a 5-day Paris Visites travel ticket which was huge value for getting around everywhere and hopping on and off metros all day, and gives you discounts. recommend the Musee Carnavalet, which is free, and fascinating history of Paris - like a huge junk shop of rich and poor people's furniture and pictures. there is a bar in the lobby and they issue you with a handy free street and metro/RER train and bus map, and the Figaro was a free read at breakfast, even the Guardian appeared on the rack one day! generally a comfortable stay, but if noise gets to you, try to make sure you have a room at the back of the hotel. if you're a city bod, it won't overly bother you, but it was a little trying. and a fridge and safe would have been useful - however we cooled the wine in the basin. if you're going budget then be prepared for some small shortcomings! recommend, but not quite as good as I thought it would be from other reviews - they were obviously luckier than we were.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jajeffers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in July. Great place with a great staff. The hotel is perfect for those wanting a convenient location to get around the city. It was a 30 minute walk to the far west side of the city (Arc or Eiffel tower), and only 10 minutes by the subway. Great hotel, we would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A special thank you to the manager, Zaid. You and your staff made our Parisian trip an outstanding success. Everything was great,our room, breakfast and most of all our conversations with you. We felt like we were staying at the home of a good friend. Your advice and directions made every day a delight. Paris is fantastic, Parisians are warm wonderful people and The Grand Hotel Francais is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: painter1
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Zaid and the staff at the hotel for making their hotel my home away from home.Thanks for being so friendly and always there for me.For taking care of my emergencies...ironing my shirt (for free) when I was in a flat spin going to the Lido.Thanks for being the "Walking Paris Info Centre" and not getting tired of all the questions.Thanks for the good tips on where to eat (I am still making the glasses for the cheff...soon...very soon, I will post them) I have travelled a lot and this stay was one of the most special due to all of you.Great hotel, clean,close to everything and most of all...friendly....like Paris...never thought I would say that, but I do Had a great time. Thanks Cornelius Bosch...South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: f100zardoz
Reviews.Content: A well priced hotel with very friendly & helpful staff. I always find hotels in Paris a bit of a gamble unless your paying top dollor. But this hotel has a nice exterior a very clean interior with helpful staff. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ShadowChaser
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location about 10 minutes walk from an RER line which made the airport transfer easy. We checked in quite late at night which wasn't a problem with the English-speaking staff. The rooms are simple, but very clean and perfectly adequate. The bathroom was spotless. Our time in Paris coincided with some very hot weather, so the room and bathroom were quite stuffy, but bearable. We were on the 5th floor and there was street and Metro noise with the windows open, but again, it was bearable. The continental breakfast was great each morning and the hotel staff are all very friendly and helpful. The hotel has lots of restaurants, cafes/bar and shops close by and is very close to the Metro and the RER. The area seemed to be very safe and clean. We would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking for a clean, comfortable and good value tourist-class hotel in a good location. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: aztraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel several months ago. We checked in late and were put in a room on the first floor. It was very small (as many European rooms are) but clean. The issue was the noise from the metro. We were constantly woken up every time the metro went past the hotel. In the morning, we spoke to the manager and he said he would find us a new room and we could get the keys when we returned from sightseeing for the day. We had already unpacked in the room and assumed we would just move all of our things when we returned. We got back in the late afternoon to find out that they had actually moved all of our items during the day while we were out. Each item was in the EXACT place where it had been in our previous room - from a card on the bedstand, to a sweater folded over the armoire door, etc. Needless to say, we were amazed and grateful! The new room was on the top floor and was very large with two big windows that faced the street. It was still a "no frills" type room with a small amount of noise from the metro and small bathroom & shower, but all in all, it was a good room. I wouldn't call it great, mainly because I typically stay in 4 and 5 star hotels and resorts, and of course it wasn't what I was used to. Though, I expected that knowing that the hotel was a 3 star. Plus, we got a great rate through priceline. The location was pretty good - near the metro - but it is a little farther from some of the typical tourist sites. While I thought this hotel was good with great service, I would probably stay in a 4 or 5 star hotel in the Latin Quarter or St. Germain next time - even if the cost is quite a bit more. But if you are on a budget, it is definitely a good find.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: t50
Reviews.Content: This is a very respectable, well run and pleasant hotel. It is also very good value for a major city within the Euro zone. The staff were very friendly and helpful; be sure to ask for their restaurant recommendations. The rooms were very clean and comfortable although a bit small. They were also inclined to be stuffy and being in a large city leaving the window open was not compatible with a quiet night's sleep. Notwithstanding I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel. Nation is a quiet area of Paris a bit off the beaten track but the hotel is near two metro stations and only 2 stops on the RER from Chatelet (and the centre of town). It's also well on the way to Eurodisney.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms at great value”
Reviews.Author: Pat_newmarket
Reviews.Content: The rooms are average but very clean. We paid EUR 77 including breakfast which is a pretty good deal for Paris. The hotel is also one block away from the subway station and around 3 from Nation, a major subway line connecting almost all tourist attractions. There is also a supermarket accross the street where you can get groceries. Great price and not too crowded if you want to avoid the crazy streets of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - good time. Friendly to English speakers”
Reviews.Author: Eric-A95
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had an excellent 2-night stay at the Grand Hotel this week. After seeing so many positive reviews here, we were skeptical that they may have been fakes posted by staff, but once we checked in, we were quickly relieved that this was a lovely hotel. The desk managers spoke English well and helped us get around and choose a great local restaurant, that was off the beaten path. The hotel is located very close (1 minute walk) to the train. Bd Voltaire is a main street with lots of cafes, restaurants, and local shops, which gear more toward the locals, as this isn't a major tourist area. We had a nice lunch for Eur 4.00 just down the street, for example. The downside to it being light on tourists is that when we arrived on Sunday, most restaurants/storefronts in the immediate area were closed. Still, the Bastille is only 10-15 minutes on foot, or 3 on the metro, with the opera and everything else. You will need to add time (15-30 minutes) to get to the key tourist destinations by metro. Our room was above the street, overlooking the corner. We could lean out the huge windows. The room was cozy but big enough for us. Our bathroom was clean and new. Our package included continental breakfast, which was very convenient and tasty. This was a very great value, and we'd gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: VarsandPete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend here. Firstly one of the nicest parts of our stay was the friendliness of the staff. The chap on reception (who I believe is Wally the owner) is a great chap. His English is excellent and he's one of the friendlest people that I have ever found in a hotel. He would always make an effort to say hello and goodbye each time you passed through reception. He seemed to appreciate the effort I made in trying to speak French but thankfully his english was much better than my french! The rooms are smaller than I would have hoped but I believe that this is pretty much the norm for Paris. Having said this however they are extremely clean and do have all the features that you'd need - desk, phone, TV, hairdryer (that actually does dry your hair unlike hairdryers in some hotels). The bathroom is small but has great water pressure - the shower is very powerful but the thing that lets it down is that it's a hand held shower - all it would need would be a wall bracket and a shower curtain and it would be perfect! We found the location to be pleasing. Okay so it is a bit out of the centre, however it is between two metro stations. We arrived in to CDG Airport and caught the RER B to Chatalet Les Halles, change to the RER A to Nation. Upon arrival at Nation station, you leave the station, cross the road to Boulevard Voltaire and the Grand Hotel Francais is around a five minute walk on the right hand side. Nation is one of the central stations that has 4 or 5 lines running through it so the hotel is perfectly suited to get to any of the main attractions via the metro. There is another metro station - Rue des Boulets which is closer to the hotel (literally 1 mins walk away), however only the no. 9 line runs to this one. With the hotel being away from the centre it is certainly cheaper with regards to food and drink than residing right in the heart of Paris and is only 20 mins or so away from the attractions via the metro (single metro ticket only â‚¬1.40). So in summary, if you're looking for a friendly, economical hotel with clean basic features then this is the hotel for you. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: IKOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central for Paris visitors even though it is not in a tourist area per se. Lots of restaurants and supermarkets in the area for a quick bite or a sit-down. About 20 minutes from Place Bastille. 5 minutes from the Nation metro and train which then connects with all of Paris and beyond. Less than 1 hour and 8 euros from De Gaulle airport. A little over an hour and 2 Euros from Versailles. The hotel is not in the luxury class but a very good tourist class hotel.Very clean room, linen, bathroom. Staff always cheerful and ready to provide advice. Highly recommended! We would return here when we are in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Warrior
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I spent our honeymoon at this hotel. Although we had booked through Travelocity, I had inquired via e-mail to the management about staying in a room with a balcony. While we were not able to check in until 1:00, after arriving around 9:30, when we did check in, we were completely surprised to find that our room not only had a balcony, but probably the best balcony in the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and always willing to answer any questions we had. While the location was not close in proximity to the major tourist attractions, it's location from Nation made it easy to get anywhere we wanted to go. We also liked the fact that we seemed to be the only Americans in the hotel, we felt that we were seeing parts of Paris that not all tourists see. All in all we would recommend this hotel to any and all who are travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: f999
Reviews.Content: Like some other reviewers, my visit to this hotel left me with a feeling of indiference. There was nothing much wrong with it, it was just very average. The rooms are okay, just a bit small and bland. You can hear the metro running underneath the hotel at night, but its not a big problem. Don't underestimate how long it takes to get to the central tourist attractions from this location - you can easily lose 15mins on the Metro. The Bastile area is walkable (20 mins or so) which is a good area for more affordable bars and resturants. Overall - average, a little dissapointing, but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a fantastic experience! For someone who was travelling alone, the staff made me feel at home and part of their family. They were very accommodating and made excellent recommendations on restaurants and nightlife activities. The breakfast area was cozy and a great place to interact with a blend of locals and other travelers. I met a lot of friendly people at this hotel and would strongly recommend it to anyone who's travelling from abroad.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special, not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: tpsunny
Reviews.Content: It's just ok. I was expecting a lot more after seeing the reviews. I don't quite know what.....It wasn't bad, but it was average. Nation is not the most charming Paris neighboorhoods, and there really isn't much to attract me to the hotel in the future. I'm not saying it was bad, I'm just saying it was profoundly average.

Reviews.Title: “Give the Au Gand Hotel Francais a try”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a value hotel in a convenient location. There are several very good restaurants nearby. Try the Chardenou - around 35 euros per person The management of the reception and housekeeping is very, very good and there is a good bar in the lobby. The staff is friendly and will endure your attempt to speak french. Good natured people!!!! If I were going to make an improvement on the hotel I would recommend that every bath have a high shower and tub shield and that the hotel rotate to harder mattresses for all the rooms. The rooms are typical of Paris as to size. Nearby is the Place Nation and the Rue de Picpus which turned out to be interesting with a relatively hidden historic cemetery where 1300 guillotined martyrs are buried after meeting their fate nearby in the years 1789-1793 ...about a 12 minute walk from the hotel towards Porte Doree.

Reviews.Title: “You will never experience better service anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Alshaw70
Reviews.Content: I expected a pleasant stay and the hotel more than delivered. The manager was helpful, kind, pleasant, patient, and all of the previous posts about the good service are correct. I personally witnessed the manager give a guest 50 euros and tell her to pay him back later. (He didn't even make her sign for it or anything!) When I asked him to change our room (to a twin room with 2 beds because of an error I had made with the booking) he happily did so and even moved our luggage for us. Nation IS a little out of the way, and I did hear faint conversation from our neighbors in the other room but it certainly wasn't any louder than the snoring of my traveling companion (smile) but it is a less than 5 minute walk to Nation where you can catch any train going to the major tourist attractions. A short walk to 2 open air markets. Some VERY GOOD restaurants are right in the area. (I personally recommend La Dame Brune!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel in October for a weekend break and had a great time. Very clean and reception staff very helpful. Located approx 10 mins from Nation metro station which gives access to all major attractions. Cant wait to go back to Paris and this hotel is one I know we can book in the future without any apprehension !!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is grand!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean, bright and cozy and the hotel located within a few paces of the bus and metro stops, and within walking distance (20 minutes) of Place de la Bastille, where the off-and-on tour buses stop. But the best feature was the manager, Li Hocine, who elevated French hospitality to new heights. Perfectly bi-lingual, he was a wealth of information about Paris, France and the French, a model of patience with all our requests and questions, and incredibly generous with his time, as well as his euros! When we realised, upon arriving, that we lacked sufficient funds for the tour bus next day, and that the banks would be closed, he immediately pulled out his wallet and loaned us the sum! We would definitely stay there again, and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone eager to visit Paris in the happiest way!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just gor back from a great weekend at the hotel. Though the rooms are small, the give all the comfort needed. They are well cleaned. The staff is very nice and friendly. It's a recommendation for anybody who does not spend a lot of time in the room. And who would in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return to”
Reviews.Author: dezza13
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from the 16th of April and found it to be a great hotel to stay in, its warm very clean with friendly staff from the cleaners, breakfast waitress and the front desk. As other reviewers have said the rooms are small (well they are not for living in) but the bed was very comfortable, especially after walking a marathon around the Paris sites every day. My only gripe was the shower, as it does not plug into a wall mount and with no curtain it is a skill to shower just oneself and not the entire bathroom. One does notice the hum of the local metro passing below because of its novelty but it is not a distraction and is quieter than the cars on the road. If like us you are travelling from Ireland to Beauvais Airport with Ryanair the Metro Ligne 1 travels from Port Neuilly directly to Nation, just 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. ADVISE buy bottles of water from the shop facing the hotel it is extremely cheaper(E0.18 for 2lts). 500ml bottles around the attractions costs around E3.00

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly Formed”
Reviews.Author: Ieuanfawr
Reviews.Content: A lovely friendly hotel. All the staff were a delight. Our room is probably best decribed as compact with no spare space, and although we were next to the lift, we were never disturbed by it. Le petit dÃ©jeuner is basic, but fresh and filling. The location is terrific - although the Rue des Boulets MÃ©tro is the nearest, we used the speedy RER from Nation to get into the City Centre. There are handy wine stores and shops, and they are many restaurants along Rue du Faubourg Saint Antoine leading to Place de la Bastille. And for those on the budget, the best views of Paris are from the roof-top cafÃ© of the department store, Samaritaine, on the right bank of Pont Neuf.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned with the latest information”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned March 23, 2004. Overview: This hotel is clean, friendly and in a good neighborhood, and the photo's on thier web site are accurate. It is a short walk to the Metro lines 1-2-6-& 9 & RER. Guests of the hotel were from the USA, Britan, Germany. Ranged from ages of mid 20's to late 60's and all couples or families. No loud drunks, or uncomfortable situations permitted in this hotel. So if your planning on a "girls gone wild" spring break, I would tell you to look for a hotel in the Latin Quarter. The hotel staff: Incredibly helpful and every desk clerk spoke english, which is more than I can say regarding ability to speak French. Checking in and out was smooth with no surprises. Rooms: Small if you have never traveled to Europe, but larger than what I have stayed in in Rome or London. Quite with the windows closed, but I imagine that in the summer or warmer weather street noise may bother some people. There is no AC yet, but plans to have it installed are in the works for 2005. Rooms are cleaned each day, and we had no need to "hide" valuables. If you pack like your staying away for a month for a weeks vacation you will have little options as to where to place your belongings. There is TV, but if your concerned about TV I question your motive for travel to Paris. Beds were comfortable. Ask for a room that would be considered front corner, faces street. You will have 3 windows vs. 1 or 2. Safety: We walked, jogged and rode the metro at all hours. We never had a problem. The hotel is locked down every night and nobody gets in that does not belong. As in any big city the area has a few panhandlers. I found "street people" to be non-aggressive and I can count on one hand how many times I was approached in the Nation area. I had far more encounters with panhandlers and con-artists in central Paris, mostly in the tourist areas. Resturnats: Plenty of local neigborhood cafe's, restruants, sandwich shops, bakery's, and shopping at reasonable prices. In fact, we did much of our gift shopping in Nation and saved money vs. shopping in central Paris or tourist areas. We did not have a bad meal. There are several in the neighborhood we did not get to. But you can eat some great French food and not pay central Paris prices. Bars and Partying: If you want this activity, walk or metro a short distance to Place de Bastile. Note: Learn some French before you go. Many people are helpful, but since this is not a tourist area and many of the people speak French and very little English. But you are in France. We shopped and ate often in the neighborhood and always had a plesant time. In fact, I think the people in the Nation area went out of thier way to really try to be helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel Francais
HotelInfo.Address: 223 Boulevard Voltaire | 11th Arr., 75011 Paris, France
